author: {'steamid': '76561198042771493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1710996526}
review:
This one is a little older, and I think in some of the animations and things you can kind of tell, but overall it's still pretty solid. If I have any complaint about it, I would say that it's pretty short (although it does have a bonus adventure), but that's really it.

The story was straight forward and easy to follow. There are collectibles. The puzzles I found to be fine, certainly some that were a little reminiscent of the ones in other games, and a few of them I found to be a little more challenging than I was expecting, but fine. The hidden object puzzles were all good too, in this game they handle them in my favorite way, which is you come back and do them multiple times and slowly pick through all of the items, with all the items from the last time being removed for each subsequent puzzle. The interface also allows you to lock the inventory bar so that it stays open, which is invaluable when doing something like playing on a tablet.

The bonus adventure is also kind of short, but I found it enjoyable nonetheless. Sometimes you don't need a super long game in order to get enjoyment out of it.

The achievements I thought were fair, although be warned there is one related to difficulty, so if you were planning to try and get them all in one playthrough (which is doable, thankfully) then make sure you play on Expert.

I didn't have any technical issues with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199395326505', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1710187145}
review:
Runs out the box on the Steam Deck!

review:
Curto, porém bom!

Apesar da história ser bem bacana, e a temática também, ela foi bem curtinha e pouco desenvolvida. Eu esperava um jogo mais longo, e com mais variedades de cenários, mas não, achei bem apressada. Sobre o gameplay, ele é muito bom, e com bons puzzles, os mini jogos de achar objetos também tem suas particularidades, talvez o ponto forte do jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960931103', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1695609252}
review:
[b]Pros[/b]
+Great artwork
+Collectibles
+Achievements
+Decent story
+Good puzzles and HO scenes

[b]Cons[/b]
+Abrupt ending
+A little too easy

One of the better games I’ve played in the genre, Clockwork Tales has a fairly thin story but makes up for it with great artwork and plenty of puzzles. I can appreciate the little details like the main characters mouths moving in cut scenes. First time I can remember that happening and it was refreshing to see. 

Puzzles and HO scenes were good. I would have preferred more HO scenes but what they had worked well. All high resolution and the puzzles were explained well. 

Story ends abruptly and you are left with many questions. Needed more backstory. 

An all-around solid HOG, fans of the genre should definitely pick this up on sale. Full price is a bit steep for the short 4-hour game length

[b]7/10[/b] Good

author: {'steamid': '76561198013914001', 'num_games_owned': 1996, 'num_reviews': 919, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1448578584}

author: {'steamid': '76561198113388537', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1663693526}
review:
[h1] First entertaining Hog [/h1]

I am fairly new to Hog games, so not much expierence to draw from. Played some a few old one, some poorly made ones and this is the first modern one i played. That has been produced by larger more experienced studio. 

So i was pleasant surprised that this genre can be entertaining and enjoyble. The game has simple yet effective story. The riddles are not inrcredible hard nor to easy. Achievements are easily done. 
Only thing for me to question is the general hog logic of using items once or never using outside of riddles. Like fire when imprisoned or some knives when you live is at stake. But it seems unavoidble in this type of game. Only dump was when i had to make fire twice withing the same level when I had access to the "older fire". Nonetheless i had my fair share of fun.
Hog are someting i cant play to often and i have quite a few of them in my libary. So to play a game that i could replay to tidy up my missing achievements is someting i did not expected. 

I would recommend the game. I cant tell if this i a good one or not. For me it was the first game that did not felt like a waste of time. If other Hod of the same company are equal in quality I´d propably play them as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156701926', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1689957969}
review: Memories are fuzzy after several years, but I think this was the very first HOG game I played that opened me to the genre. Drawn in by the steampunk vibe, hooked by the nice balance between very easy (let's be honest, there's no challenge in these games ^^; ) but not boring. A nice way to sink a few hours, and even want to come back at it once every few years after you've forgotten it enough... and in between, there's a hundred other stories of the same sort, it's like a Harlequin Romance collection but for casual games. I am not ashamed to love it unironically. :<

author: {'steamid': '76561198045411242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1688843626}
review:
[u]Recommendation[/u]: Another quick and fun hidden object game which, unusually, doesn't involve any supernatural elements.

[u]Critique[/u]: This game plays pretty fast. Its graphics are superior in many respects to other Artifex Mundi games I've played, though the voiceover work is wildly variable (the old woman in the Inn had us howling with laughter with her incredibly slow delivery, which we clicked on as often as we could). There were only a couple of places where the progress bogged to a halt because it wasn't obvious what to do next; usually the puzzles were clear even when they were very convoluted. The hidden object portions had almost no translation difficulties, although some of that may be that we've become used to how the names of objects are translated in these games ("capsule" and "stamp" spring to mind as examples of words that could mean many different things, but I can't recall any that were the WRONG word in this game). I really appreciated the novelty of having no supernatural/spiritual elements in this game: there are no ghosts, no shapechangers, no monsters, no reincarnation, only Verne-like steam technology of clockwork robots. That's a nice change.

[u]Review[/u]: [spoiler]Professor Ink has a friend/protegee named Evangeline Glass who has worked as a spy. She receives a letter from the Professor that he needs her help. When she arrives in the mountain town, the Professor is abducted by a giant clockwork mech, and Evangeline must investigate the area to devise a way to rescue him. On the way, she uncovers the fact that the local noble/madman, Barber, is disliked by the community ("That...Barber...boy...is...a...rotten...egg...!") for ruling the region with an iron fist AND he has been creating a clockwork engine that threatens the entire region. Barber's father designed the engine to quell earthquakes, but Barber has adapated it to CAUSE them. You free the Professor and put a stop to Barber.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970310850', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1683757635}
review:
[b]9/10[/b]

[h1]Genau so muss es sein[/h1]

Clockwork Tales macht alles so, wie es in dem Genre meiner Meinung nach gemacht werden sollte. Nach inzwischen gut 15 HOGs erlaube ich mir dieses Urteil im Vergleich zu anderen Vertretern.
Die Wertung gilt natürlich dem Genre entsprechend. HOGs sind nach wie vor einfach produziert – aber sie sind mein Guilty Pleasure, und Artifex macht einfach die schönsten. Dieses hier war noch eine der Eigenproduktionen, und das merkt man.

Als erstes sei bedacht, dass Clockwork Tales trotz seiner mittlerweile zehn Jährchen immer noch super ausschaut. Mir gefällt das Steampunk-Setting und alles ist wortwörtlich malerisch. Die Szenen und auch die NPCs sind sehr gelungen. Die Sprechanimationen sind zwar wie üblich rudimentär, aber besser gemacht als in anderen Titeln (wo sich manchmal nur etwas der Kiefer verzerrt), und wirklich charmant.

Im 18. oder 19. Jahrhundert (wurde das überhaupt erwähnt?) ist man als Dr. Evangeline Glass unterwegs, die von ihrem Mentor Dr. Ambrosius Ink ins preußische Städtchen Hochwald gerufen wird. Der Bösewicht Barber plant etwas. Er hat eine Erdbebenmaschine und eine Golemfabrik, in der eine mechanische Armee auf ihren Einsatz wartet. Seine an die Wehrmacht angelehnten menschlichen Soldaten haben einen auffallend deutschen Akzent, bei dem man nicht weiß, ob man lachen oder weinen soll ^^
Man hat einen geflügelten mechanischen Gesellen namens Matthew dabei, der einem bei höher gelegenen Aufgaben hilft.
Gestartet wird im Städtchen, dann geht’s mit dem Zeppelin zu Barbers Schloss und dort am Ende ins unterirdische Labor. Jeder dieser Abschnitte ist von den anderen getrennt, es wird also nicht zu wild mit dem Hin- und Herlaufen.

Die Inventarverwaltung geht gut von der Hand. Die Minispiele haben mir gefallen, es sind sogar ein paar dabei, die nicht in jedem HOG vorkommen, davon einige wirklich interessante. Alles ist ohne Probleme machbar.
Die Wimmelbildszenen selbst teilen sich den Platz mit sog. Ketten-Wimmelbildern: dort sucht man abgebildete Teile, die dann zusammen etwas ergeben. Ist zwar nicht so meine bevorzugte Art der Bilder  und das erste waschechte Wimmelbild kommt relativ spät, aber ist Geschmackssache.
Die Wimmelbilder sind, wie im Grunde das ganze Spiel, doch tatsächlich frei von Übersetzungsfehlern; man glaubte ja schon gar nicht mehr, das nochmal erleben zu können. Sehr gut!

Vielleicht ist der Titel etwas kurz und vielleicht sind die Rätsel insgesamt eine Spur zu einfach gehalten, aber das ist für mich in Ordnung. Besser so als umgekehrt.

Es gibt diesmal ganz tolle Sammelgegenstände: die Steam Bugs. Mechanische Insekten, die in so ziemlich jeder Szene und auch nicht allzu gut versteckt rumkrabbeln. Mit ein wenig Aufmerksamkeit hat man bald alle 30 von ihnen gesammelt. Man sollte sich ihre Erklärung unbedingt durchlesen, denn es stecken tolle Ideen dahinter. Jedes Insekt hat individuelle Eigenschaften. Nice!
Was die Errungenschaften angeht, so bekommt man sie alle ganz gut zusammen. Leider fehlt mir eine einzige, weil ich HOGs immer im mittleren Schwierigkeitsgrad spiele (sie setzt “schwer“ voraus).

Das Finale ist etwas spannungsarm und wird flott abgehakt, da es zu keiner Konfrontation mit dem Antagonisten kommt. Leider erfährt man wenig von ihm, weder Hintergrundgeschichte noch Motiv sind bekannt.
Es gibt noch ein Bonuskapitel, das geht leider auch recht schnell und ohne Finale vorbei. Man nimmt es aber spielerisch gerne mit.

Aufgrund der inhaltlichen Schwächen gibt’s nicht die volle Punktzahl, alles andere ist aber wunderbar gelungen. Diesen erst einmal unscheinbaren Titel sollte man unbedingt nachholen. Eine oder zwei Fortsetzungen hätte ich hier auch gut vertragen :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968073802', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1682768530}
review:
I really like steampunk, cause it forces the person who creates the story to make up creative devices, and things that shouldn't be used in that kind of age, like here after the 1700 age. How can you not write a story about steampunk without crazy germans, with even crazier leaders though XD?

Anyway. To make this review short and easy. I like the game, story, music and it all. Over dramatic stuff might have made me cringe at some point, but this is how the games are.

I have a feeling that this Artifex Mundi game is a bit older, since some HO (hidden object) puzzles are definitely not as detailed as the newer one. It mostly okay, and you can find the items, but sometimes they are a bit harder to spot. I think at the same time that in the newer games, it's also easier to hide items in plain sight, since the quality and colouring is much more intense. Overall, I am happy with it ofc!

Some things I liked a bit less was when I felt I should be able to use an item, or be able to progress in the story by doing something, and then realising that nothing would work. Through the game however, I only used the hint button for progressing only one time. 

In this game your collectibles are steampunk bugs. I thought their description was funny to read! Achievementwise overall, it's not so hard to complete them in one go. I only missed doing a HO puzzle with no mistakes, but got it after restarting the game and the very first puzzle. For the bonus story, it didn't seem like the achievement worked properly, because I am certain I did 2 HO puzzles in a row, perfectly, and didn't get the achievement.

Overall, I recommend this game, but maybe best to buy these kind of games on sale. I just bought 15 myself on the Steam brain / puzzle sale, and I think it's good value for money that way. It also allow yourself to be a bit more tolerant if you feel the game is weird or short. You get what you pay for this way!

review: A perfectly normal HOG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001071004', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1678667838}
review: I purchased this game expecting a traditional 2-D point & click game like the Sierra and Lucas Arts titles, but instead was surprised to find hidden object puzzles.    The player is handed an item with each successful solution, leaving an empty feeling.  Moon logic puzzles and creative problem-solving with corresponding animations are missing.  Character development is superficial.  You are not going to remember these personalities for long.  However, this fits the bill if you just want a shallow, simple, steam-punk adventure game to entertain yourself on a Sunday afternoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027473826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1702838374}
review:
My 5-year-old daughter and I like to play this game together. There is nothing she finds scary in it (which is saying a lot since I feel she is pretty sensitive). She is able to handle some of the puzzles, though I often take the lead on them, letting her gather items and try out different combinations.

It took us about 3 hours to play through Evangeline's story and about 1 hour to play through Dr. Ink's story. So in all, a complete play-through is about 4 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971284198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1651465677}
review:
Neat game!
It's the newer crop of Artifex Mundi games... graphics are great, no weird resolution or perspectives.
Hidden object part has lots of variation... one thing I noticed on this one is that some puzzles are somewhat harder than average, not sure why. This might be bad for some I guess... but it's just a couple or so of harder ones.
Story mixes... something like WWII and steampunk, thus the "Clockwork" title. You are the daughter of a scientist who is looking into the link between earthquakes that have been happening with more frequency and one of his students, I think?
Something along the lines. So, female protagonist, lots of mechanical gizmos, bit of magic, and yet another save the world scenario. xD
Oh, this one has a bonus chapter that is basically a short prequel to it.
Anyways, recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062678111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1644602506}
review:
There is no magic or occult involved, so a big plus there. :D
An overall fun and interesting game in which you are trying to rescue Prof. Ink and stop the earthquake machine. There are machines & robots to fix or defeat.  The journal show your objectives and a map.  The map shows locations where you can perform an action and lets you jump to locations.  There is a hint button that also lets you skip puzzles or mini-games.  The puzzles & mini-games were fun and do-able, although I had to skip a couple.

The graphics are sharp and colorful. I enjoyed the clockwork music.  There are a few characters to interact with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095263665', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1641619921}
review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a hidden object game with a steampunk-clockwork aesthetic, which plays a great part of why I'm interested in it. You play as Evangeline Glass, an engineer who is searching for her mentor Dr. Ink who is captured by an evil general. You will have a mechanical crow sidekick who will be needed to perform certain actions, usually to get out-of-reach items.

Other than the aesthetics, one thing that stands out for me is the music. It just fits so well with the whole setting, sounding steampunk-y yet not too distracting, which for me kinda makes it more immersive. There are also some cool and unique thematic minigames, notably the dollhouse one near the beginning. There are also mechanical bug collectibles, but sadly you cannot view and read info about them from the extras menu after completing the game, so check on them before finishing.

Once you finish the game you will unlock an extra game mode, where you play as Dr. Ink as he tries to find a way into the general's castle. It is quite short, but gives a bit more backstory to the events of the beginning of the game. Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a good, steampunk-themed HOG, so if you're a HOG fan and love steampunk aesthetics, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1635958614}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Hidden Object Adventure

[h1] Story [/h1] Wir spielen eine junge Frau namens "Evangeline" und haben einen Brief von einem gewissen Dr. Ink erhalten, das wir sofort zu ihm kommen sollen. Dies tun wir natürlich auch sofort aber als wir dort ankommen wird der Dr entführt und wir müssen uns nun aufmachen ihn zu befreien

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Ganz Genre Typisch wie immer, lösen wir Mini Rätsel, Wimmelbildszenen und sammeln allerhand Gegenstände auf um diese dann irgendwo zu benutzen um weiter voran zu kommen. Sowohl die Rätsel als auch die Wimmelbilder haben Spaß gemacht. Es gibt natürlich auch hier wieder ein Bonus Kapitel nach beenden der Hauptgeschichte. Das Setting ist im Steampunk Stil was mal was anderes ist. Musik und Grafik sind völlig in Ordnung. Das Voice Acting war wie auch Genre üblich relativ schwach

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 19 Erfolge. Diese sind sehr einfach zu bekommen. Hierfür muss man einfach das Hauptspiel im schwierigen Modus durchspielen, alle Minispiele ohne Überspringen beenden, 1 Wimmelbildszene mit weniger als 2 Fehlern bestehen, das Bonus kapitel beenden (Schwierigkeit egal) und alle Sammelobjekte finden. Die restlichen Erfolge sind Story basierend

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Story OK
+ Musik passend
+ Nette Minirätsel
+ Nette Wimmelbildszenen
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein Hidden Object Adventure was mich doch sehr positiv überrascht hat. Das Steampunk Setting ist eigentlich nicht so meins aber es hat mich hier überhaupt nicht gestört, ganz im gegenteil, ich fand es erfrischend abwechselnd fürs Genre. ich kann es jedem Fan des Genres sehr Empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561198045607948', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1467726993}
review:
It isn't the best Artifex Mundi have done, but it's still solid and offers a few hours of entertainment.

[url=http://elinchan.blogspot.com/2016/07/dealing-with-backlog-clockwork-tales-of.html]Full review here.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039783902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1629226866}
review:
Казуальная игра в жанре “поиска предметов”, который намного проще квеста, и которых видимо невидимо. Данную же игру я купил по распродаже в Стиме несколько лет назад, и периодически возвращаюсь к ней, дабы вкусить немного ламповой атмосферы. В этот раз изучил её полностью, собрал всех жуков и выбил все достижения, стало быть, надо написать отзыв, что и решил сделать.
Что понравилось:
1. Сюжет – профессор Гласс обнаружил в маленькой деревне нечто опасное, поэтому вызвал на помощь свою ученицу Евангелину. По прибытии профессора похищают, и за этим стоит правитель здешних земель генерал-инженер Барбер. Теперь героине предстоит освободить профессора, узнать тайну правителя и остановить его коварные планы. Интриги - ноль, оригинальности - ноль, предсказуемость - стопроцентная, но мы ведь и не ждём от подобных игр запутанного сюжета? Всё верно. Но и скучной данную историю назвать сложно, ибо даже здесь смогли раскрыть персонажей через письма и диалоги, хотя типажи и характеры избиты до одури.
2. Рисовка – локации, обстановка, персонажи, анимированные ролики сделаны на твёрдую пятёрку. Да здесь бери любую локацию и ставь на рабочий стол. Анимированные ролики ставят эту игру на голову выше остальных представителей данного жанра. Каждый предмет, каждая линия выдаёт кропотливый труд художников и дизайнеров, явно вдохновлявшимся Германской Империей начала двадцатого века.
3. Головоломки – большинство из них требуют умственных усилий, а вот часть решается методом тыка. В любом случае играть в это было интересно. Ну а сами поиски предметов тренируют вашу внимательность, поэтому не верьте тем, кто говорит, что компьютерные игры ничему не учат.
Что не понравилось:
1. Нет русского дубляжа – расстраивает, ведь большинство разработчиков этих игр наши с вами соотечественники, хотя в данном случае это чехи или поляки. Русский текст есть, а вот качественного дубляжа нет. Что несколько разрушает атмосферу этакой европейской сказки, замешанной со стимпанком (не люблю стимпанк). А уж когда наши разработчики ленятся, и не делают русскую озвучку своей игры – это вообще позор!
2. Сложные головоломки – их всего несколько за игру, но они изрядно подпортили нервы, поэтому упоминаю об этом здесь.
3.Продолжительность – игра проходится, вместе с дополнительной главой всего за два с небольшим часа, что мало для такой продуманной игры и неплохого фантастического мира. Тем более что больше игр в этом мире и с этими героями нет, и вероятно уже не будет, что расстраивает.
И всё же я рекомендую поиграть в неё, ибо она достойна вашего времени и внимания, тем более на неё часто бывает скидка.
А от меня игра получает 8 землетрясений из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032783211', 'num_games_owned': 2473, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1647950669}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106507444', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1629067887}
review:
Artifex games have become so formulaic. The stories are all the same. Female protagonist. Has a doctor, alchemist, inventor, scientist that's like a father to her (her parents are always dead or so we think) who asks for her help and then gets kidnapped or disappears. Eventually she goes to rescue him and gets arrested or thrown in jail herself. She has to escape. Along the way she must disarm the bad guy's minions and eventually save her mentor. The end. The bonus chapter is played from the perspective of the guy she rescued. This game is a steam punk version of the same stories we get in Endless Fables, Eventide, and Family Mysteries. They aren't bad games but why can't Artifex come up with a new plotline?? This one is beyond played out.

Often in these kinds of games you'll run across the same items twice. Early in a game you'll use a screwdriver and later you'll find another one. In this game, they bring the double item shtick to the level of ridiculousness. Within the same scene, you have to find a way to light a fire. You have flint and light a lamp and five minutes later are scratching your head trying to figure out how to light a stove. Suspension of disbelief doesn't even apply here. This is just stupid. The flint you just used is still there! Why can't you pick it up to light the stove? Artifex is a Polish company isn't it? Hmmm

author: {'steamid': '76561198180880538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1625483910}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995194702', 'num_games_owned': 1227, 'num_reviews': 714, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1404494892}
review: Nadprůměrné HOG, které těží především z přenádherného vizuálu a s tím souvisejícím steampunkem. Přece jenom kolik znáte titulů, jenž by se mohly pyšnit tímto neortodoxním prostředím? Hra je parádní, zábavná a jediným záporem je skutečnost, že neexistuje pokračování. Protože zde vytvořený svět je dostatečně zajímavý, takže si umím představit trilogii, podobně jako získaly jiné série od Artifex Mundi. Rozhodně se jedná o hru, která se mezi ostatními HOG neztratí, jelikož na rozdíl od nich to není čistě jen fantasy, ale právě onen steampunk z toho dělá něco víc. Hru tedy rozhodně doporučuji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330888468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1623725405}
review:
Seems like a fun little game. The art is okay, nothing exciting, and the hidden object games suffer from that problem where the items you are looking for seem to be a different layer and very obvious, but the story is interesting. Besides, the hidden object games are a bit thin on the ground anyway.
Controls work fine, voice overs are acceptable and the music is pleasant, while remaining in the background.
I do have to say that your next course of action doesn't always seem clear to me. I use the hints a lot in that regard, but not on most puzzles, near the end some of them got very frustrating and I did skip over them. I am playing on the easiest level of difficulty too. 
An easy thumbs up, though I will return if things change. 
Sadly very short, only a tad over three hours play time. Get it on sale is my suggestion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845717264', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1621612789}
review: Thumbs up! This is a pretty good hidden object game. It has a mix of regular hidden objects and fragmented hidden objects. I didn’t like a couple of the mini-games, but most of them were okay. I liked the steampunk theme. I don’t usually like collectibles, but finding the mechanical insects was pretty straightforward. I think they helped add to the steampunk atmosphere and you’re not forced into pixel-hunting to locate them. I’d be interested in a sequel, but I don’t think they ever made one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364076564', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1614084852}
review: <6/10>画风不错,谜题中规中矩,世界观也算有意思,就是剧情有点草率,我到最后也没明白boss为什么一定要通过地震统治世界,这部分可以再细说一下(当然可能是时间不允许了,再长要超过4小时了),再加上一个奖金章作为前传总体来说还是不错的.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116879768', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1616246967}
review: Also ich weiß nicht genau, was ich von der Geschichte beziehungsweise deren Realismus halten soll. Die Rätsel waren gut, meist relativ einfach. Mit 4 Stunden Spielzeit ist es jetzt auch nicht sonderlich lang aber vollkommen Okay. Die Animationen sind tatsächlich etwas witzig, aber das Spiel lebt ja von seinen Rätseln und nicht von atemberaubenden Grafiken und Animationen. Die Geschichte hätte allerdings ein bisschen besser oder auch realistischer sein können und auch ein bisschen schwerere Rätsel hätten mich erfreut aber Alles in Allem ist es für das Genre wirklich okay. Man kann es mal gespielt haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974457154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1616079132}
review:
This is actually a pretty good game. This game changed my opinion about hidden object games. The story line is good, the artwork is beautiful, perfect variation in puzzles which are not too easy, but also not frustrating. I really enjoyed playing it.

I would recommend it on sale, it would cost about 2 to 3 hours to finish the game. Maybe double if you go for all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052938275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1612731741}
review:
Wieder einmal ein nettes Wimmelbild von Artifex Mundi. Die Geschichte ist recht nett und nicht zu lange, gut finde ich das es ein Bonus-Kapitel gibt. So kann man schön sehen, wie die Geschichte seinen Anfang nahm. 
Die Rätsel sind nicht zu schwer aber trotzdem fordernd, geübte Spieler können es gleich auf Schwer durchspielen.Es gibt Sammelkarten und nach ca. 6 Stunden hat man das Spiel auch auf 100%.
Ich kann es nur jedem Fan weiterempfehlen, und neugierige Spieler sollten auf einen Sale warten.
Freue mich schon auf das nächste Wimmelbild von Artifex Mundi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970483018', 'num_games_owned': 4124, 'num_reviews': 707, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1613268669}
review:
[h1]Too Long Didn't Read Version[/h1]

[Table]
[tr]
[td]Recommend[/td]
[td]✔Yes, on sale, or part of a bundle[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hours of Gameplay[/td]
[td]Two to three hours[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Difficulty[/td]
[td]Normal[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Graphics[/td]
[td]Good[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Art Style[/td]
[td]Comic Book[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Replayability[/td]
[td]Once is Enough[/td] 
[/tr]
[/table]

[h1]Synopsis[/h1]

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a Hidden Object / Puzzle game, without having an over-abundance of either.

[h1]Story[/h1]

Your mentor is investigating some disturbing earth tremors and asks for your assistance.  You arrive in town and while you're with your mentor another earth tremor hits and your mentor is kidnapped in the confusion.  Find him, stop the tremors.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The game constantly swaps out the kinds of puzzles you need to solve to advance.  I play on the casual mode and it is very helpful in letting you know what you need focus on so that you can advance.  Like most hidden object games you revisit areas to obtain items you need in the hidden object puzzles.  The puzzles were not too difficult, I was able to solve everything without asking for a hint.  The puzzles where you had to find machine parts to assemble were a bit more difficult as it isn't clear what some of the parts look like.

[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]

I recommend this game. A good game where you don't feel like you are endlessly searching for hidden objects.  This game would be a good introduction to the hidden object game genre. The price is a bit higher than what I personally would pay, I got it as part of bundle and paid much less than retail.

[h1]System Specs[/h1]

Intel i7-8086K Coffee Lake 6-Core 4.00GHz CPU
Crucial Ballistix Sport AT 2666 MHz DDR4 RAM (16GB x 2)
ASUS GeForce RTX 2080 Overclocked 8G GDDR6

author: {'steamid': '76561198043262862', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1611542765}
review:
Este é o meu segundo jogo de objetos ocultos com o selo da Artifex. Esse jogo manteve minha impressão inicial - o foco maior são os quebra-cabeças e minijogos recorrentes, a história por sua vez é apenas uma forma de conectá-los.

A temática “steampunk” é bem legal e nesse aqui tem até algumas animações. A história, apesar de na minha opinião não ser o foco, ainda é interessante. Os quebra-cabeças são mais elaborados e a dificuldade é um pouco acima de casual. Duração de 4 a 5 horas.

O ponto fraco fica para a tradução BR. Nos diálogos eu não notei problemas mas no resto tem uns erros de tradução bem grosseiros. Por exemplo: “pipe” que no contexto seria “cano”, traduziram como “pipa”. “File” que no contexto seria “lima”, traduziram como “arquivo”. São muitos erros assim, jogue em inglês se o seu vocabulário permitir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055367776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1611555976}
review:
So, this is the second of five hidden object games (HoG) that I bought in a bundle- and unlike the first, I was pleasantly surprised by this one. It was an enjoyable few hours as I sipped my tea and clicked through some pretty simple, but interesting, puzzles. The game has three different types of puzzle- hidden object, inventory, and logic. Most of the main story involves inventory puzzles, where you're finding things and using/combining them to solve a larger issue. And they were great. There were a few chin-scratchers where I was left muttering, "But what am I not seeing here..." as I wondered what I needed to progress.

There are, of course, logic puzzles where you need to use your brain in a more concerted fashion, but they all fell on the easy side. Near the end of the game, I was getting a bit sick of them and did skip a few of the more tedious trial/error ones. I do have a limit as to how many logic puzzles I'll suffer through. There are a few hidden object puzzles, but not as many as I expected. The game really was more a point and click adventure than a HoG, which is why I enjoyed this so much.

There is a story here and it is enjoyable. It's certainly full of adventure- at least as much adventure as you can have while being on rails. I enjoyed it. The steampunk aesthetic wasn't overdone, but it was there. I gave the game a very specific style.

Overall, I liked the game. It was a fun three hours- but, it was only three hours. Honestly, I could have beat the game in two, but I spent a fair bit of time reading all the addendums, making tea, and drinking said tea. There's also not a lot of replayability. It's not like anything changes from playthrough to playthrough. So, once you've beaten it... That's about it. For $10 that's incredibly steep. I got the game for under a dollar, and at that price it was worth it. That's the only way I can recommend this game- get it in a bundle at a steep discount, otherwise it's a bit expensive for the limited experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1673658031}
review:
This is a routine hidden object casual puzzle/adventure game with a clockwork/steampunk theme. Solving various puzzles and hidden object minigames reveals the plot and uncovers the mystery.

Once more we see Artifex Mundi trying to screw over PC gamers. On Steam, this is $10 USD, on app stores, it's completely free. Mobile devs must learn PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay a premium for a free mobile game just because it's been lazily dumped on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011362044', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1605402001}
review:
Very good and interesting game.

   Monissa kaupungeissa on tapahtunut lyhyen ajan sisällä pahoja maanjäristyksiä. Tohtori Ambrose Ink on tutkinut asiaa ja tullut siihen tulokseen että tapahtumien keskiössä on pieni kylä nimeltään Hochwald jossa vaikuttaa kenraali Barber.
   Tohtori päättää kutsua paikalle ystävänsä naisagentti Evangeline Glassin jotta asiaan saadaan selvyys.

   Heti saavuttuaan agentti Glass huomaa että järistykset ovat jollain lailla keinotekoisia ja tohtorin jouduttua kidnapatuksi on toimittava nopeasti jotta tulevat julmuudet saadaan estetyksi sillä kaikki ovat suuressa vaarassa ja tohtori on saatava pelastettua. Glassin suurena apuna on Inkin kehittämä robottilintu Matthew joten seikkailu voi alkaa.

   Pelissä on mainio extra-tehtävä joka on samaa hyvää tasoa emopelin kanssa.

   Pelissä ei käytetä W,A,S,D-näppäimiä vaan liikkuminen tapahtuu toimintapisteiden kautta.

   Tehtävät ovat monitasoiset, osa on melko helppoja mutta jotkut ovat tosi vaikeita ja saavutuksia aukeaa huolellisella pelaamisella.

   Pelistä löytyy keräilykortit.

   Suosittelen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016332737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1603471212}
review:
У Артифлекса очень много годных игр, но данное произведение я не рекомендую. Игра в общем хорошая, но по сравнению с другими гораздо слабее, подробнее ниже.
Особенности
- летающая курица которая помогает разгадывать загадки (совершать действия) как и компаньоны во многих других играх
- игра на вечер, проходится за несколько часов
- сюжет в принципе стандартный, есть злодей, нужно найти его и победить и спасти родственника/друга которого похитили
- мини игры и поиск предметов как обычно
Плюсы
+ вменяемые достижения (моё сугубо личное мнение, что достижения это зло и портят игры, и если они есть, они должны получаться без необходимости десятки часов потеть с гайдами в руках)
+ нет кривых в управлении мини игр
+ поиск вещей интуитивный, нет таких от которых сломаешь глаза
Минусы
- игра сверх простая, за игру всего пару раз возникло желание ткнуть на подсказку даже в дополнении
- сюжет невнятный и короткий
- персонажи серые и неинтересные
- перевод местами кривой и мешает играть
- после прохождения, ощущение что прошел демо версию нормальной игры

author: {'steamid': '76561198206068576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1602607613}
review:
Absolutely gorgeous, stunning artwork and captivating background music and voiceover. It doesn't overstay its welcome with its nice 3-6h, which makes it a nice little no-melodrama steampunk story.  The mini-games are for the most part revisited classics, I almost expected to see a "mastermind" pop up at some point. The point-and-click are never too far-fetched, which is always good to see in a point and click adventure...

I really enjoyed this enchanting game, and often stayed for a long time on hidden item images just for the beauty of the artwork. 
Definitely recommend playing this, even to non-fans of the genre. At worst you'll have "wasted" 3 hours watching stunning visuals and listening to peaceful music while looking for items.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155097545', 'num_games_owned': 1114, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1602771974}
review:
This game has a beautiful menu with:
[i]- concept art
- music
- achievement display
- ingame posters that you can download in various sizes
- you can even choose to play a specific minigame or Hidden Object Scene again![/i]

While the story itself was not that engaging to me, I could spend hours in that menu LOL. They really put a lot of thought into it and it shows. Very well done!

It also has [b]really[/b] good achievements and trading cards, which is kind of unusal for HOGs. Very much appreciated!

author: {'steamid': '76561198199331935', 'num_games_owned': 1371, 'num_reviews': 1096, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1599124085}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044715770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1598108007}
review: Pretty good game. Lots of hidden object scenes, most are reasonably challenging without having 1-pixel-showing objects, but some scenes are reused multiple times. Puzzles are extremely generic, not a single novel one. Steampunk theme is fun, though the tick-tock music is annoying. Matthew, your mechanical crow pal, is mostly used to grab objects that are out of reach. Be sure to get all the collectable bugs in each section before going down any one-way passages, as there is no going back between sections. Overall, worth it if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099650601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1597587289}
review: It's a kind of short but high quality point & click puzzle game. Many of the puzzles are actually connected to the plot which is definitely a plus and keeps me interested the whole time. Visuals are good and it's obvious that much effort was put into it. Some of the hidden object mini-games are unsolvable though because I have no idea what is shown in the example picture.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424121178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1596558216}
review: 游戏画面好赞，最喜欢这种手绘风格。人物对话时不光有口型，面目表情和动态都表现出来了。玩的休闲模式，谜题和找物都比较简单。收集昆虫设计的不错，不容易错过，可以达成成就。不过当游戏通关之后在外篇里不能单独看昆虫信息，这点太糟了，我完全没看每个昆虫的信息啊，哭。还有地图需要吐槽一下，点击地图跳转之后，地图不会自动关闭，还得手动关一下感觉有点累心。整体很好，期待续作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198164831891', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 785, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1596311668}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1595557236}
review:
This game has a great steampunk aesthetic and the art is simply fantastic.  This game stands out for its gorgeous scenes.

It also stands out for some of the worst voice acting I have ever witnessed in a video game. I say that as a man who played many low-budget adventure games during the Dark Age for the genre in the 2000s.  Those games always had poor voice acting, but some of the villager voices in Clockwork Tales are hilariously terrible.  One man recorded his line with a microphone with no pop filter, generating a "pop!" sound when speaking a plosive sound.  How unprofessional!  I won't even mention the 19th century German soldier that says, "Seems legit."  Yes, that is a direct quote.

Fortunately the main characters have decent voice acting.  This is another hidden object adventure game story with extremely thin characters, which is a shame.  The Grim Legends series did a great job creating compelling main characters, but I haven't yet played any other game of this sub-genre that even tried.  The story barely matters, and what keeps this game going is its strong steampunk setting.

The puzzles were very nice, and a few were pretty tough.  I spent ten minutes on the darn "equation" puzzle near the end of the game.  Eventually I got it through trial and error.  That puzzle was not in the "Sweet Spot" of puzzle challenge: too complicated to think it through methodically, and also too complex to be solved with trial and error without getting lucky.  I didn't enjoy that puzzle, but I did enjoy a very interesting puzzle that reminded me of Sudoku.  I've never seen this kind of puzzle before, and would be interested in knowing what its name is. (EDIT: My buddy saw my video of this game and heard my interest in this puzzle, and stumbled across them by chance a few weeks later.  They are called Nonograms!)

This is the first hidden object adventure game I replayed on Expert difficulty.  I got all the achievements (also a first for one of these games), allowing me to uninstall Clockwork Tales completely satisfied.  On to the next of the 15 Artifex Mundi hidden object games I bought during Steam Summer Sale 2020!

author: {'steamid': '76561198180339967', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1594587732}
review:
Игрушка неплохая, но не за ту цену за которую продают. На скидках рублей за 15-30 взять можно. Проходиться быстро. Головоломки не сложные (уровень сложности не влияет на трудность головоломки.они везде одинаковые). Многим может не понравиться брождение "туда-сюда" по несколько раз, но есть карта, с помощью которой можно быстро перемещаться между локациями. Из плюсов: красивая графика, приятный видеоряд, нет головоломок и действий на время.

П.С.:  отдельный ОГРОМНЫЙ минус за ужасный перевод. Аудио вообще без перевода-это ладно,есть титры. НО корявый перевод предметов это нечто (например, предмет "шесть",а оказывается имелся ввиду листочек с цифрой семь, это не говоря уже о названиях обычных для нас предметов,а не цифр). Приходится долго рассматривать экран, а в конце кликать наугад или брать подсказку.

Поставила "не рекомендую"  из-за очень высокой цены и корявого перевода.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207649600', 'num_games_owned': 1989, 'num_reviews': 369, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1594182074}
review:
Ещё одна достойная игра от Artifex Mundi. Дизайн, графика, головоломки, музыка: всё на высоком уровне. Сказал бы это же и про сценарий, если бы не скомканная концовка. Могли бы придумать что-то поинтереснее. В целом, если вам нравятся приключения с поиском предметов, то эта игра вам точно зайдёт.

P.S. Опять подкачала локализация, из-за которой приходилось несколько раз тыкать всё подряд наугад. Вот как их понять, когда под зёрнышком они понимают початок кукурузы, а под очками бинокль?

author: {'steamid': '76561198144904652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1594114917}
review:
[b]Playtime: [/b] 4h
[b]Achievements: [/b] 19/19
[b]Most challenging achievement: [/b] None
[b]Recommending:[/b] Yes

[b]Story:[/b] You get pulled into steampunk word where Dr Ink is investigating often earthquakes and you as a lady coming in to help him. [spoiler] Dr get kidnapped and you tried to solve the mystery of earthquakes and help him break free.[/spoiler] 
[b]Playstyle:[/b] Full clicking game. You get a static image with some movable part as background and then by pressing on sides, you move. It's a full-on puzzle game.
[b]Graphic:[/b] Nice clean art style of steampunk, with the use of darker colours.

For a starter I 100% recommend to start the game on hardest option, as its actually the same game as on casual, but with less visible clues. Even tho you get stuck you can press clock on the side and get help, there is no point of going casual unless you want it super easy. Plus when you play the first game on the expert you can finish the achievements quicker. The story is nice and your lil bird helper is adorable. I enjoyed the steampunk feel and good puzzles. So I do recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198960427716', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1593833414}
review: прикольная залипаловка!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198329950931', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1593611802}
review:
I'm a huge sucker for hidden object games. They're probably my biggest guilty pleasure as far as games go. This one caught my eye immediately because I also love steampunk and knew I had to have it!

The story is good. The puzzles are fun, not too hard and not too easy, and there's also a good variety in them. I was pretty impressed with the art and scenery as well. One of my favorite aspects is Matthew, the mechanical crow you can use to fetch out of reach objects and perform tasks that you can't get to yourself.

My only issue was the length of the game. It seemed quite short? I was finished in two and a half hours, not even realizing I was on the last level until all of a sudden I was finished with the main task and the credits started rolling. Again, this could just be simply because I'm used to breezing through this type of game, but most of the time I'm looking at a good 4 hour play through if not more!

Still, visually and puzzlewise, this has been one of the best I've played and I definitely recommend if you're looking for some good steampunk fun to pass a few hours!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974580177', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1593627279}
review:
A very nice point'n'click HOG from Artifex Mundi, where you play in a steampunk kind of scenery.
The gameplay is pretty linear and you can get help in any situation (depending on the currently chosen difficulty) but it's ok in this game as it follows the story. This makes the game a very good casual game, as you can quit and resume anytime in the last scenery.

I took my time at the first playthrough to enjoy all hand-drawn backgrounds and items (and in order not to miss any secret for the 100% achievements) and the main story plus the bonus chapter (the prequel of the main story which intentionally is meant to be played later) it took me about 3 hours and the "fast-click-speedrun" (to also get the achievement for playing it on hard difficulty) took roughly 1 hour (with skipped movie sequences wherever possible, but many puzzles can be solved faster than being skipped).


I can indeed recommend this game from Artifex Mundi, which ran flawlessly on my Ubuntu 18.04 familiar to almost all other Artifex Mundi games. Plus the system requirements are pretty low, so you might be able to play this game nearly everywhere, wherever your steam desktop client runs. So this game is also well suitable for children (maybe when they're old enough to read and when they're able to combine little information packages and draw conclusions). Apart from that you can play together and share the fun ;-)

It is also sometimes included in "Artifex Mundi game bundles" on 3rd party sites (Indiegala) and often on sale on steam for a few bucks (currently ~3€) which indeed is a very good value per playtime.

-> If you like how the images are drawn (and ofc like HOGs) go for it, there's nothing wrong with it (especially when on sale).

author: {'steamid': '76561198052388186', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1593559076}
review:
This was a very enjoyable Hidden-Object adventure game.   However I do have to emphasize that this was mostly an adventure game, of the sort where you need to find a key to open a door or find scissors for a rope, and that sort of thing.  I am quite happy to report that no Bat-Logic was involved-- that is, you don't have to be MacGyver to figure out that a bottle of aspirin and an airplane somehow become a key; everything made sense if you buy into the Steam-punk setting.  

Besides the adventure-game part of Clockwork Tales, there were some Hidden Object Scenes and there were many puzzles.  None were challenging to the point of being tedious and none required skipping, though several took a few tries until I worked out the solution.  No walk-through is needed; I managed to complete all puzzles, but if there's one that you can't, then there's a skip button.  

Additionally, there is an achievement to find mechanical beetles that are in each scene.  There's one per scene, and they are usually animated, so there's really no way to miss any of them.  

By the way, for those curious, Mr. Ink and Ms. Glass are the protagonists.  You play as Ms. Glass, though Professor Ink helps you in the beginning and end chapters.  

For achievement hunters: the game seems easy enough to get 100%.  I played it once on normal to make sure I had a handle on the puzzles and adventure-game objects, but there's one last achievement for playing the game once on hard.  So there's replay-ability.  There's also a bonus prequel chapter I haven't done yet but I'll get to that this weekend.  

All in all, this is a very fun game.  There were no glitches or bugs, the art is fine (no pixel-hunting was required except in the hidden-object scenes in which by definition that is what you're doing) and the voice-acting was passable.  My one regret is that I didn't get any backstory, but perhaps that is what the prequel is for.   

Two thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198307908110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1592373631}
review:
I really enjoyed the game and it's steampunk aesthetic.  I don't play a lot of games with that, so this was very fun.  I also enjoyed how many of the characters had animations and mouth movements that matched their own body stances and movements, so it made them feel a bit more alive.  The bugs definitely varied, and I loved seeing them all, in addition to the automatons.  The designs were cool and added to the general feel of the game.

I did think this was a fairly short game though.  It only took me a couple of hours to go through the game without a guide, and one hour to finish the game after I had initially played it (for achievements).  The storyline did make up for that though, so I was only mildly upset the game had ended.  

The game overall was very fulfilling and I am very glad to have played it~

author: {'steamid': '76561198093298055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1761, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1698966779}
review:
МОЙ ЛЮБИМЫЙ ЖАНР.

И КАК ВСЕГДА НЕТ РУССКОЙ ОЗВУЧКИ.

ЗА ЭТО МИНУС.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109191384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1590197386}
review:
the game is lacking difficulty and honestly not worth it when not on sale. with only 5 HO screens and 6 main puzzles within main game. the last HO screen is in the bonus chapter. 

to pay more than the 3.29$ CAN (reg price 10.99$ Can) I did is honestly not worth it. like i said the screens are easy and the puzzles are just plainly lacking the ingenuity that alot of other developers have. i like being stumped whilst playing these and honestly the 3 hours (if that i honestly got bored and left the game open and watched youtube) of game play is most definitely a waste of time. there is no pizazz, no real mystery or story that will leave you wanting more. 

the graphic and character models are lovely and that may be the only good thing about it,

author: {'steamid': '76561199000078579', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1587577416}
review:
Steampunk isn't really my thing, but the game itself isn't bad.

You play as Evangeline Glass, a friend of Dr. Ink, and have been called to a small village to help him ruin a plot involving an earthquake machine. The bad guys all sound very German and their symbol and vibe all feel kind of... Nazi-ish, so keep that in mind if you're sensitive to it.

Otherwise, the story isn't too bad and it has pretty solid gameplay. The HOPs are fun but aren't very challenging, and the minigames are fun enough. This is an older AM game though, and it really shows: the animations leave a lot to desire, and the voice acting is hit or miss depending on the character.

Like most AM games, it feels overpriced at $10.00 when you can complete it in 2 - 3 hours. Buy on sale or bundled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174538130', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1587253297}
review:
8小时无攻略全成就通关(包含当初以为这游戏就是用来挂卡的三四个小时)。期间漏了一个收集要素[spoiler]我就说花园那里一定有只虫子吧！！！[/spoiler]导致还打了个二周目[spoiler]惊了。。。Artifex Mundi的游戏我居然开二周目了。。[/spoiler]。
蒸汽朋克风的解谜游戏真的不多见，《机械迷城》算一个，但是那个太烧脑。《发条传说》的友好度和观感都好的多。
Artifex Mundi祖传的翻译纰漏在这部作品里依然存在[spoiler]俗称“翻译永远迫击炮”[/spoiler]，俩人的名字也是很有趣[spoiler]没有把女主和他的老师翻译成玻璃和墨水真的是谢谢你了呢Artifex Mundi[/spoiler]，但是难得遇到他们的剧情经得起考究的一部作品。更不必说为了补全主线剧情甚至还为你准备了一个短小的前传来讲述下前因(成就党的话这部分就一个成就。。。简单难度快速rua过去就好了)。
尤其一点，众所周知Artifex Mundi的剧情在恐怖都不如角色的面瘫脸给你做表情恐怖。。。这部的这个问题好很多，大体上不会吓到你(大。。。大概？)。和兄弟游戏们相比，这部应该是目前玩儿过最好的了。首先是不刻意营造恐怖氛围这点就非常非常棒。精神完全集中在解密上，而以往的Artifex Mundi常常像是担心解密元素不足想要留住你似的(也可能适得其反？)搞一些莫名其妙的恐怖元素进去。。。要知道这类游戏在国内那是爸妈给娃下载pad上耍的，真就不怕过不了审呗。。。

[spoiler]好吧主要是我害怕。。。当初STCN一个大佬送我一份《组织2》，我一边被拼图虐的要死一边被诡异氛围吓得要死[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1587220101}
review:
[h1] Очередной поиск предметов, к тому же с довольно сложноватыми головоломками - некоторые без руководства было довольно сложно решить... [/h1]

Не очень обязательное приключение для любителей ломать глаза об экран. История тут якобы про учёных, но из разряда фантастики в мире паропанка. Тут невообразимые технологии соседствуют с антуражем XIX века и паровых машин. Опять играем за бравую женщину, которая грудью ложится на поиски своего наставника. Противостоит им, как обычно, некий злой гений с манией величия и немецким акцентом. Тут вообще есть небольшие аллюзии на Первую Мировую войну и учёных того времени вроде Теслы, хотя косвенно тут много кто фигурирует из реальных светлых умов. Но всё ограничивается лишь образами и парой комментариев. Но остальной игровой процесс остался стандартным - носимся из комнаты в комнату, решаем некоторые задачки и ковыряемся в куче барахла...

Аудиовизуал в этой игре уже так себе. Такое ощущение некоторой халтуры от Артифекса. Даже достижения тут халтурные, например достижение про прохождение игру на сложности... Какой сложности - догадайтесь сами. Но я сразу врубил эксперта. Головоломки решал с помощью руководств. Очень мозголомно было. Хотелось пройти один раз и больше к этой игре не возвращаться. 

Поиск предметов здесь также может быть очень трудным ввиду не совсем точных слов для поиска. Что-то из предметов может быть вообще в тени. Так что сложновато будет совсем без ошибок. Но одно из достижений вполне дозволяет одну ошибку.

Достижения в целом при руководстве можно выбить за один заход, также быстро выбиваются и карточки. Облако также в наличии. Любителям можно поиграть, но поскрипеть мозгами придётся очень сильно, если сразу выбирать эксперт. Рисовка здесь на уровне, но ничего особенного. Мне до такой рисовки далековато, но рисованные образы всё равно не впечатляют. Рекомендую по скидке, потому что игра в целом простая и история на среднем уровне.

author: {'steamid': '76561199043487725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1934, 'last_played': 1587196346}

review: Z jednej strony trudno coś tej grze zarzucić. Jest ładna grafika, jest sporo ciekawych, niezbyt trudnych zagadek, piękna muzyka i niewiele męczących elementów HO. A równocześnie fabuła jest mocno pretekstowa, nie potrafi zaangażować gracza, nie zachęca do zarywania nocy. Wychodzi mi zatem z tego podsumowania, że to taki udany średniak. Może nawet bardzo udany, ale... tylko średniaczek. Artifex Mundi zwykle stać na dużo więcej.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071909158', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1586130086}
review:
Definitely worth the sale price that I picked it up for. Good length, solid puzzles, fun hidden object problems, good story, awesome world, and a solid number of quality of life implementations to make for ease of travel and keeping track of tasks and locations. Also contains a great variety in the gameplay as far as point and clicks go. Bonus chapter was also a solid addition, although could most definitely have just been put in the beginning of the base game. 
Excited to see more from the world in other similar games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198346468603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1583281182}
review:
I found this game very nice. Artworks and cutscenes are pretty good (but sometimes characters animations are a bit weird, maybe that was planned). 
I found a story interesting for me too. I like those all mechanical animals and steampunk things. 
Puzzles were good, some were a bit difficult to solve them fast, but just some of. 
Espessially I liked moments with the doll house and tasks when you need to find all hidden object from task list.
Game keeps attention to details in artworks and even non-active objects contains some useful hints.

The bonus aftergame was especcially fun cuz of 4 statues..) I like those kind of humor. Who played - will understand xD


I went through it during one long evening so was just a bit tired to the end cuz wanted to finish it today but you can enjoy it through few nice evenings.
I recommend this game for puzzle- and cozy games lovers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198953419762', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1583250132}
review: Completing this game was my first real experience with a hidden object game.  Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink was an enjoyable experience.  I thought that the puzzles ranged from easy, to very challenging.  The artwork was pleasing to look at.  The story, though simple, was charming and kept me engaged.  The game took about 3 hours in total for me to complete.  Normally, I would consider that to be a very short game.  However, because I used a lot of hints during my play-through, I think it would have taken me perhaps another hour at least to finish it.  Still a short game, yet worth it, in my opinion.  Some sections of the game were a bit confusing for me, and left me wondering what to do.  But, overall, I felt that this was a good experience.  I would consider myself a fan of hidden object games, now, as a result of playing Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink.  I look forward to playing more of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845931061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1581065550}
review: Interesante título para pasar un buen rato.  La historia se desenvuelve en un contexto "cyberpunk" . No encontré ningún fallo técnico a lo largo del juego . [spoiler] Iba a decir no encontré ningún "bug"  pero uno de los logros consiste en recolectar "bugs" (bichos) justamente [/spoiler]. Los puzzles no son excesivamente difiíciles sobre todo para quienes ya tenemos unas cuantas aventuras de objetos ocultos a cuestas.  Hay escenas de objetos ocultos de las "tradicionales" (encontrar los objetos mencionados en la lista) y de los de encontrar objetos a partir de siluetas. Al ser una edición del coleccionista se tiene la posibilidad de jugar escenas de objeos ocultos y algunos minijuegos todas las veces que se quiera. La música es agradable aunque podría llegar a parecerte un pelín repetitiva en algún punto. Me hubiese encantado grabar un gameplay de este título

author: {'steamid': '76561198977248226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1575838908}
review:
RATING: 7.7 based on the following criteria: 

Story: 7.5/10 - A fun, lightweight romp through a steampunk universe. Use your wits to save the world and your wise mentor from the evil German baddies. 

Puzzles: 6/10 - If you’re a faithful Artifex Mundian, you won’t find yourself particularly challenged by the array of “spin the dials until they match,” “rearrange the mosaic,” and “mix the potion” mini-games. There is nothing innovative here. 

HO Scenes: 7.5/10 - Well drawn, fit within the context of the story, not very challenging. 

Art: 9/10 - I enjoyed the steampunk scenery, and everything was beautifully painted. 

Graphics: 9/10 - Solid graphics, no bugs, smooth cutscenes. 

Length: 7/10 - About 5.5 hours with bonus chapter. The ending feels a bit rushed. 

Overall impression: This is a breezy little game in a fun steampunk setting. A nice change of pace from the “sinister dark force lurking in the shadows” plots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017642387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1572710317}

author: {'steamid': '76561198166062736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1572003343}
review:
Il gioco è un classico punta e clicca, quindi è consigliato solo agli amanti del genere. 
La trama non è nulla di eccezionale e gli enigmi non presentano una difficoltà molto elevata (quindi perfetto per chi è neofita), quindi lo consiglio, ma solo se preso a pochi € oppure in un bundle, altrimenti non vale assolutamente il prezzo pieno.
Finito in 4/5 ore, la rigiocabilità è molto limitata.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995982646', 'num_games_owned': 4611, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1569521195}
review:
Yet another installment from Artifex Mundi (AM), who seem to dominate the hidden-object (HO) gamesmarket nowadays. This time the player is trying to release Dr. Ink, which has been captured and imprisoned by the antagonist, Barber, and as a side-quest, you try to save the world as well. Please do not expect much of the storyline, it is just here to glue all the puzzles, minigames and hidden object scenes together. Which is the mainly the case in all standard AM games. Having released over 50 HO-games at the time of writing, they do know what they are doing when making games in this genre, one can expect a decent, solid, integer game.Clockwork Tales is no exception to this, although it seems to have a bit less hidden object scenes. The lack of a map optionmakes for a bit more backtracking throughout locations, than normal.

Decor arethe snowy reaches of the town of Hochwald, which is oppressed by nazi like soldiers, with Barber representing the Führer himself. All in a pre-war, steampunk setting, heavily inspired by World War II. Dialogue with the soldiers is rather amusing, speaking English with their German accent. The factory together with all its machines and transports, blend in perfectly with the steampunk. Cutscenes and zoomed-in dialogue all have a comicykind of art style.

Little flaws can be expected from a smaller developer team. It are these imperfections that often create amusing situations. The spoken dialogue of the older woman in the bar: “That Barber boy is a rotten apple, if you ask me.”, for example, is outright hilaric when you hear her say it. Also, note the facial expression of the little girl with the cat, at the end of her dialogue. Simply funny.

Atmosphere is good, due tolocation colors and lighting. AM seems to get this right every time. Music could be better, though, with most tunes being repetitive and rather annoying. Developers made an effort to implement speech for all NPC’s, however.
Steambugs are scattered among the plentiful number of locations. All 30 have to be found to unlock the perfect game. Players can not let their guard dropping down by rushing through the game, this way.

As usual, a lot of extras are available. There is the bonus chapter, which in this installment, has a lot of HO scenes and additional puzzles. Through the main menu, the HO scenes and minigames can be replayed as well. There is also concept art , music and wallpapers. As well as overviews of collected achievements and steambugs.

The fact all achievement can be earned in one playthrough makes Clockwork Tales quicker to perfect than other AM-HOG’s. Be mindful, there are achievements which can be easily missed. A perfect game can add up to 19 achievements to your profile, all acquired in approximately 8 hours.

Recommended for: fans of the genre, casual gamers & achievement hunters

For myself, I tended not to enjoy CT as much as other AM HO games. The logic behind the usage, by means of combining the several found objects, was too often far fetched. Which resulted in hitting the hints button one too many time. Overall, not a bad edition, but surely not one of their better ones either.

Cheers

SultanK

author: {'steamid': '76561197993502256', 'num_games_owned': 2488, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1569005935}
review:
Ein erschütterndes Spiel, weil .... Erdbeben!

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink ist ein Point and Click Adventure im Wimmelbild-Spiel. Man selbst Spielt eine Agentin, die von ihrem Mentor nach Hochwald beordert wurde. Es wird vermutet, dass von dort aus Erdbeben geleitet werden. Als wir in dem Dorf ankommen beginnt ein weiteres Erdbeben. Warum diese Erdbeben passieren und wie es genau weitergeht, das solltet ihr aber selbst erspielen. Auch wenn ich die Story jetzt nicht so unglaublich spannend fand.

Grafisch ist das Spiel sehr schön gestaltet. Die Hintergründe sind gut, auch jeweilige Animationen und Zwischensequenzen können sich sehen lassen. Es ist eben stimmig, wer auf den Screenshots denkt, dass das nicht gut aussieht: Finger weg, so sieht das eben aus. So möchte das Spiel aussehen. Auch soundtechnisch kann das Spiel durchaus gute Leistungen liefern. Der Soundtrack ist gut und auch die Effekte hören sich gut und nachvollziehbar an. Einzig die Sprachausgabe, die in englisch ist, hätte weitaus besser sein können. Die Sprecher haben einen merkbaren Akzent, was vielleicht so sein sollte, das kann ich nicht beurteilen. Einige Übersetzungsfehler sind mir auch aufgefallen, aber nichts dramatisches.

Tja, wie bewerte ich nun das Spiel? Ich denke ein Daumen nach oben hat es sich verdient, da ich mich gut unterhalten gefühlt habe. Das Spiel ist meiner Meinung nach nicht sehr schwer und hat einige gute Hilfe-Funktionen für jene, die nicht ewig alles absuchen wollen. Wer eine undurchsichtige Story mit krassen Wendungen sucht oder richtig knifflige Rätsel, der sucht besser weiter. Alle anderen können hier für den Angebotspreis gern zuschlagen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190913063', 'num_games_owned': 2539, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1568693232}
review: Glass and Ink ist auch ein gelungenes Artifex Wimmelbildspiel. Junge Archäologin gegen Steampunk-Nazis, die sogar im Originalton teilweise deutsch sprechen. Das Spiel ist nicht allzu schwer, Wimmelbilder und Minigames sind gut zu schaffen und auch die Achievements sind recht locker in einem Durchgang zu schaffen, sofern man daran denkt mit allen Leuten zu sprechen, jedes Fitzelchen Papier anzuklicken und jeden Käfer pro Szenerie mitzunehmen

author: {'steamid': '76561198052332539', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1567942270}
review:
[h1]*Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink* - Vielfältig und spannend![/h1]

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink ist ein Steampunk-Abenteuer aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi und überzeugt auf ganzer Linie. In rund 4 Spielstunden (inklusive Bonuskapitel) erlebt man als Agent Evangeline Glass zusammen mit der mechanischen Krähe Matthew ein spannendes Wimmelbild-Abenteuer, bei dem man natürlich wieder seinen Freund (in diesem Falle Dr. Ambrose Ink) und natürlich gleich die ganze Welt rettet.

Die abwechslungsreichen Wimmelbilder und Minispiele sind durchweg einfach gehalten, so dass für Fans des Genres hier keine Lösungshilfe notwendig sein dürfte. Ein Sammelmodus, bei dem man jede Menge "Steambugs" einsammeln muss, ist ebenfalls enthalten. Auch diese sind in den Szenen unübersehbar platziert. Da gestaltet sich die Suche nach Trugbildern in anderen Hidden-Object-Games deutlich schwerer. Dennoch hat das Spiel durchweg Spaß gemacht.

Erzielbare Erfolge zum Spiel kann man problemlos in einem Spieldurchgang freischalten, was mir sehr gut gefällt. Alles in allem ein kurzes aber dennoch gelungenes Wimmelbildspiel, das ich gerne weiterempfehle.


✿ [i]Special thanks to 🍒 Lilly (🌸◠‿◠) or gifting me this game![/i] ✿

author: {'steamid': '76561198032596719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1558215795}
review: If you dig steam punk and HO, this game is for you.  Just 5 or 6 hours of play so try and wait for it to go on sale.  Graphics and puzzles are exactly what you'd expect from Artifex Mundi.  The story doesn't delve too deeply.  You're just a girl on a mission to rescue someone dear to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091958907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1567887862}
review:
Definitely recommend!

Pros
.Coherent story
.Immersive steampunk atmosphere
.Amazing, clear, clean artwork/graphics/scenes
.Enhancing music/sounds/voice acting
.Three difficulty modes (no custom)
.Mini-map with fast travel
.Lockable toolbar
.Intricate adventure play
.Variety of easy to semi-challenging hidden object scenes
.Decent mini-puzzles
.Interactive elements in scenes
.Collectables (steambugs)
.Bonus chapter

Cons
.No indication when objects in correct position for possible use
.Very, very short

Final opinion (8/10):
Phenomenal steampunk detailing, loved Mathew, loved the moving steambugs, just great fun all around!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066273990', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1567252172}
review:
A short point-and-click puzzle adventure game. Not bad, but don't expect too much of it. The artwork is nice. The story is kind of OK. 

My biggest concern is that the puzzles are sometimes rather disconnected from the plot. You want to open a door? Here, solve this stock puzzle. These get a bit boring by the end, even though most of them are not that difficult, and you can just skip them if you get stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346538568', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1567136474}
review:
蒸汽朋克，一贯的am风格。
这家公司建议买一两款打折入，其他云了，看看故事就ok。
一周目专家无压力，二周目休闲找东西。
一次性游戏，顶多存存壁纸看看昆虫。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1567119063}
review:
Spielwertung: 8/10

- tolle Zeichnungen / Grafik / Animationen
- durchschnittliche Storykreativität und Erzählweise im Steampunk-Style
- sehr faire Rätsel / Wimmelbilder (auf Mittel durchgespielt, keinerlei Hilfen gebraucht)
- gute Vertonung
- verhältnismäßig kurzes Vergnügen (mit Bonuskapitel ca. 4 Stunden)

Fazit: Ein klassisches Artifex Mundi Spiel. Man bekommt gute Qualität für seine Erwartung. Ein Zehner als Vollpreis ist vielleicht für 4 Stunden etwas happig, aber man kennt ja AM-Spiele, die sind ständig im Sale oder Bundle irgendwo. Von mir eine klare Empfehlung, aber es war kein außergewöhnliches Erlebnis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872007595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1566491316}

review: love this story. not too scary. my kids loves hidden object game, but most of them has a too "scary" story line and they wont play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147225023', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1565287774}
review:
Очень понравилась эта казуальная игрушка. Среди своих собратьев выделяется хорошей рисовкой предметов и фонов, коротким цельным сюжетом, вполне сносным, и даже довольно логичным обращением с предметами и множеством головоломок - что не мало порадовало. Видно, что над проектом постарались. А херовая локализация добавляет остроты и сложности.

Приятно провела время.
