author: {'steamid': '76561198066154260', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1561566685}
review:
Because it is an older title published in 2013 by Artifex Mundi, I expected little of “Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink”. As it turned out it’s a rather loveable gem of a game. The whole game seems to have been made by a creative team who simply must have enjoyed this game.

Graphics:
I expected blurry graphics which would make the HOP’s in particular a little eye-tiring, but the graphics look good, quite sharp actually and the steampunk design is lovingly made. Scenes are beautifully arranged.

Cut-scenes and voice acting:
The cut-scenes look nice and tell the story well. This game has also great voice-actors. I really had to laugh several times about the well-done german accents of the villains. Maybe because I am German I had to laugh extra hard :) Seriously, all the voice actors did a great job.

Story:
Of course nothing deep very entertaining. Set in a steampunk decor female protagonist Evangeline Glass has to help her old buddy Dr. Ink save the world from evil. The story is told with pleasant tongue-in-cheek humour. Clicking on a painting of a lady holding a fish gets the comment: “ there is something fishy about this picture”. The game is full of ironic remarks and yet it never distracts from the plot.

Gameplay:
Pleasantly fluent, I didn’t get stuck once as it was always apparent what to do next. There is a mini map allowing you to fast travel and there is not too much travelling back/forth as most of the time you have several available action in one scene. Matthew, a mechanical bird helps you reach objects in high places.
This game even has collectibles which add to the fun. You have to find “Steam Bugs” and can watch their fantastically made up names and descriptions. Artifex Mundi put a lot of thought into even small details.

HOP’s and mini games:
HOP’s are plenty yet not too much and there is basically three types of them: good old text descriptions, find & use and fragmented objects. Mini games make sense and there is quite the variety. Both HOP’s and mini games get harder towards the end of the game.

The bonus part is a prequel to the main game and quickly over. It took me a little longer than 30 minutes to finish it. The main game took me 3,3 hours. 
Clockwork Tales made it into my favourites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023154119', 'num_games_owned': 5242, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1556897960}
review: Kolejny HOG Artifexu. Albo je lubisz, albo nie. Gameplay się nie zmienia. Tu mogę dodać, że klimat (steampunk) i historia podeszły mi bardziej niż w poprzednich grach studia. Fajna otoczka, niezbyt trudne zagadki - przyjemne parę godzin. Z rzeczy innych niż w większości HOGów - dodatkowe robaczki do znalezienia na planszach, miły dodatek. Błędy? Widziałem drobne literówki w notatniku, ale to tyle. Nic utrudniającego zagadki, a zdarzały im się takie niespodzianki. Polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999921146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1557346324}
review: Un jeu de style "objets cachés" mais finalement avec peu de scènes d'objets cachés par rapport à d'autre du même genre. Du coup il fait un peu plus la part belle à d'autres puzzles. Le scénario et la mise en scène sont classiques mais de bonne facture comme la plupart du temps avec Artifex Mundi. Question durée de vie cette version collector avec une petite aventure annexe vous occupera dans les 3-4 heures. Essayez directement le mode "expert" sans utiliser les indices car sinon le jeu sera beaucoup trop facile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339662539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1562508795}
review:
Bardzo przyjemna gra na parę godzin. Ciekawe zagadki na raczej łatwym poziomie, które bardziej relaksują, niż sprawiają trudność. Klimat jak w starej "Syberii", chociaż mniej się trzeba nachodzić. Grafika oldschoolowa, ale za to ładna muzyka (chociaż powtarzalna). Gdyby rozbudować fabułę i rozgrywkę i poprawić grafikę (m.in. animację twarzy), to byłoby naprawdę super. 
Daję 6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081340622', 'num_games_owned': 5267, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1554399100}
review:
Possibly the shortest hidden object game I've played to date, clocking in (ah ah!) at under 4 hours including the very much useless bonus chapter (which still has a couple of nice puzzles).

But I'll take a great short HOG anytime over a long boring one. Clockwork Tales has atmosphere, balanced difficulty, interesting puzzles (most of them I've already seen in all other Spark-powered Artifex-published games, of course), and one of the single most beautiful instrumentals I've ever heard in a HOG, "Calm - Exploration". Just give it a try... It matches the game well: it's short and very elegant. Really, this must be in the top 5 games I've played in that genre. And you can get it for next to nothing through trading, as it's been bundled over a dozen times already, including in late 2018. I'd say it's a very fine introduction to hidden objects.

I really have nothing to say against it. I'll have to admit I was stuck with two puzzles in the final section of the main game, though. They were much harder than the rest and I had to rely on a walkthrough to complete them and still get the achievement. I was so close to completing the game without a walkthrough! Ah well, never say never... Maybe next time, Artifex?

author: {'steamid': '76561198269060330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1553769028}
review: I really enjoyed Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink - it has a steampunk vibe, an interesting story, many different settings, and beautiful hidden object scenes (especially in the bonus chapter that acts as a prequel). I was surprised that the play through time was only 4 hours, because it felt longer than that, but in a good way! Great quality game overall and I recommend for fans of hidden object games and point and click adventures!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1577143657}
review:
This game has a different feel from the Davey Jones game series that I had been playing. There is more emphasis on interacting with room puzzles to advance the story, and there is less emphasis on long, single image hidden-picture gameplay. I have got to say that I do like the style of Clockwork Tales more, as it feels more like a Point and Click style game, although the characters are a bit forgettable.

This game has very nice cutscenes that use face-morphing CGI for good effects. I am also enjoying the stories in this steampunk themed gameworld. At this moment, the game is seventy per-cent off, which I think is a solid deal. Even at full price, I think there is a lot of value in these types of games, which includes a short bonus chapter, for over four hours of gameplay. This kind of relaxed, thoughtful gameplay will not be for every Steam gamer, but those who enjoy this style will find a lot of extras packed into games from Artifex Mundi, such as the extensive and high quality voice acting.

I am playing on an old ubuntu linux computer, with radeon mesa graphic drivers, and using a mouse for game control. The game runs very fast at maximum fullscreen settings, with no slowdowns. The game seems to use a specialized game engine, and it has an install size of 850MBs.

review:
역대급으로 재미있다! 짧지만 강한 스토리, 귀여운 조수 기계새(메튜), 다양한 퍼즐 게임, 방탈출이 나를 즐겁게 만들어줬다.
쉽고 재미있는 퍼즐이 있는가 반면 맨 마지막 에피소드에 구슬에서 약간 막혔는데 결국엔 5시간 안에 끝냈다.
거기다 한글화까지 되있는 갓-겜
나같이 퍼즐에 취약한 사람도 구슬을 제외한 나머지는 다 쉽게 깼다. 난이도가 캐주얼, 보통?, 전문가가 있는데 전문가를 해도 바뀌는게 없으니 아무거나 해도 상관없다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1550520689}
review:
Tags: Adventure - WC - Hidden Object
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Backtracking, unfun recycled minigames, a mechanical flavor that just throws gears everywhere to symbolize a working machine. Played once, found the story cliche and caricatural.

Clockwork tales has decent animation and decent looking environments, but the pacing of the game is constantly boggled down by minigames. A lot of scenes of hidden objects had you hunt for specific items instead of the usual list system, and many of the other minigames were ones commonly found in other HOG games. There is a clear rift between who the good and bad guys are and you can tell immediately that this is not going for subtlelty. The voice acting had its lower quality moments but thankfully there was not too much of it in the whole game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220304959', 'num_games_owned': 6170, 'num_reviews': 864, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1550384627}
review:
Diria que é um game introdutório ao gênero Objetos ocultos por ser bem simples e bem feito.
Tudo no game ta traduzido pro nosso Português, cenários bem feitos e ótimos desafios.
Quanto a duração para mim deu umas 3 horas na maior dificuldade,e pra coleciona os insetos.
Recomendo para se você quer testar esse gênero de game, se já curti esse estilo talvez não va gostar muito por ele ser bem simples e meio fácil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336582195', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1550331232}
review: 85/100。发条传说：格拉斯与英克。解密游戏中的本社早期作品，质量有保证。打开游戏就是一段动画引入剧情，为了不让你跳过还有个成就专治强迫症。动画完成还是熟悉的界面，音乐配合每个场景，场景画面精美，中有动画穿插转场。剧情大概分三段半，半段算是有些虎头蛇尾（-8），流程下来四小时稍短（-2），附带特典前传剧情，线性流程不烧脑。翻译除了游戏标题外没有太多槽点（-3），玩多了迫击炮管子习惯了。自带中文好评。解密游戏在游戏中逐渐增加难度，寻物谜题有些费眼（-2），反正玩多了也就轻车熟路了。全成就一周目可达特别好评。学英语，看故事，这个价（包货带卡均价1腿）值了。还有就是徽章不算难看。

author: {'steamid': '76561198821234868', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1558981073}
review: Muy interesante sinceramente, no es excesivamente largo y conforme avanzas se van desvelando mas trozos de historia que te van afectando directa o indirectamente. Algunas escenas su dificultad puede ser un poco traumatico, pero al final como todo acabas por resolverlo y continuar hacia delante. Algo que me parece muy bien es el desarrollo de los personajes, en este caso puedo decir que no son nada planos, todos nos presentan sus inquietudes y taras. El toque magico steampunk en algunas de las escenas me resulta muy diferente a lo que suelo ver normalmente, en ese sentido mejora relativamente respecto a otros titulos similares. Quizás por meter un pega, si te pones analizar su argumento (no haré spoiler) te puedes dar cuenta de algunas lagunas argumentales que han quedado sin pulir, ya es cuestión de la atención que prestes a la historia, depende mucho del espectador, pero prácticamente como cualquier juego o película que se precie.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988945848', 'num_games_owned': 1518, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1544732014}
review:
Это пожалуй самая динамичная (читай - короткая) игра от Artifex Mundi, абсолютно никуда не спеша прошёл на эксперте без пропусков, со сбором всех ачивкок, вместе с бонусным приквелом за 5 часов!
Стимпанковские декорации понравились, атмосферно получилось, задумка с насекомыми интересная!
Ну и локализация как всегда не очень...

author: {'steamid': '76561198452319550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1547033636}
review: In most of my reviews regarding hidden object games, i like to put emphasis on the storyline, as it is the thing that tricks you to continue playing the game.  In Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink, i felt that there was a lack of explaing much on the background story of the earthquake's machine, how it ended up there, as well as the end was still unresolved, as Barber's death was narrated and not shown.  Overall, the graphics were good, not the nicest i ve ever encounter, but not the worst, the  hidden object games were not that hard, only in some points where you really had to figure out what to do next, as you needed to go back and forth to different locations.  Also, as every game of Artifex Mundi, the puzzles and minigames are similar, but if you like hidden object games and want to accomplish some easy achievements buy it, but only on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198184897393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 653, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1459816287}
review:
If you like Hidden Object Games (seek and find, puzzles, point and click), then games from [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] are for you.  

[h1]System Info & Performance Report[/h1]
[table]
   [tr]
        [td]Operating System[/td]
        [td]Ubuntu Linux 14.04 x64[/td]

author: {'steamid': '76561198877195481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1545191556}
review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink es un excelente juego de misterio, analisis y búsqueda.  Me gusta lo provoca en el jugador: poner atención a los pequeños detallles, de lo contrario no se alcanza el éxito en forma completa.
Desde el primer momento es atrapante.  Si es la primera vez que va a jugar este tipo de juego, recomiendo utilizar la guía que se ofrece, de esa manera se podrá disfrutar, entender y vivir la aventura en su plenitud.
En lo personal, me a gustado tanto, que lo he jugado varias veces en los diferentes "grados de dificultad", y en cada ocación lo he disfrutado mucho.
Lo recomiendo, te ayudará a agudizar la habilidad de observación, eso si, advierto que si le agrada este juego, va a querer conseguir las otras aventuras e historias.  Les doy las gracias a los desarrolladores por brindarnos tan excelente material.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366275531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1546362212}
review:
Let's see...the story was boring, for starters.  The characters were all boring as well, and at times odd (for example, why does that girl keep standing there in the corner even after I gave her what she wanted?).  I am also tired of these games having only a female lead character.  Is giving an option for boy or girl so much to ask?  Guys like these kinds of games too FYI.  Worst of all, the instructions for the puzzles most of the time were unclear and didn't even make sense.  In several cases I just hit "skip" because it wasn't clearly explained.   And finally, for the love of God, LEARN HOW TO SPELL.  

In short, this game isn't clearly just aimed at little pre-teen girls; it appears to have been created by one.  My spelling was better than this by the time I hit 5th grade, if not before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198435157201', 'num_games_owned': 4819, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1545927287}
review:
凭个人来看，这一作在Artifex的解谜系列里，属于设计比较糟糕的那一类型，但是由于没有什么BUG和硬伤，依然在这里给出推荐。但老实说，除了配乐以外，这一作没有什么值得称道的地方。老套的剧情、反复堆砌的隐藏物品环节、没有特色和创新的小游戏，尤其是不可理喻的道具使用设计，整体给人以较差的印象。
那么专门来说说这一作的道具设计有多么不可理喻。类似这种道具解谜游戏，一般需要玩家推测出道具和它们功能的关系，这要求玩家要么能从道具上看出很明显的功能，要么在接触道具之前有机会接触到使用道具的地点，这样就能保证整个游戏流程里，玩家总知道自己要做什么。但是这一作很多设计就完全不顾及这个问题，比如在进入实验室之前，玩家手上就有木炭了，那么这个木炭一直都没有使用的地方；又比如裁信刀的用法，不是用来割东西而是用来取钥匙，诸如此类。在毫无提示的前提下，很容易让玩家在毫无意义的地方卡关。总之这一部平白无故浪费我不少时间，令人感到挺恼火的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198190537711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1545464519}
review:
한글화 된 게임으로 일단 좋은점수를 드리고 싶습니다. 
그리고 간단한 퍼즐과 쉬운 난이도로 포인트앤클릭 게임을 처음 시작하시는 분들에 추천할 만한 게임인거 같네요.
대신 짧은 플레이타임으로 인해 조금 아쉬운 점은 있습니다. 추가 시나리오까지 포함하여 3시간정도로 끝나기 때문에
정가를 주고 사신다면 아깝다는 생각이 들것 같습니다.

세일을 하는 중이라면 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034193738', 'num_games_owned': 2536, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1536644732}
review:
[b]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink [/b](IHOG)

Options include separate sliders for Music and Sound, Custom Cursor, Voiceovers and Full-screen/Windowed, plus your choice of Casual, Advanced and Expert play.

Hidden object scenes vary from Fragmented Objects to Silhouette to the usual finding items by list.  The HOS are beautifully done, with nary a junkpile to be seen.

We have a mechanical helper that can fetch out-of-reach items for us. 

POP CULTURE ALERT: Click on the little girl in the tavern (with a cat in her lap), and see what happens.  

Insta-travel Map

[b]BONUS CONTENT:[/b]
[list]
[*]19 Achievements
[*]30 Collectible "Steambugs", each with its own art and detailed description - find one on each scene!
[*]12 Wallpapers ("Posters")
[*]6 Replayable Mini-games
[*]6 Replayable HOS
[*]6 Music Tracks, can be saved to your computer
[*]6 Concept Art
[*]Bonus Chapter (prequel to main story)
[/list]
Although the story felt a bit ho-hum to me, the visuals are gorgeous, and the gameplay varied and fun.  Recommended to IHOG-lovers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970060568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1540971981}
review:
I started playing these hidden object games when I got pregnant, I figured it’s a good way to pass the days while I’m lethargic. My husband suggested that I start reviewing these while I’m still in my “down time”. Hey, why not? I’ve got some time on my hands.

I find that I tend to enjoy this genre of games when they are either ridiculously bad, and I mean noticeably so, that it makes me laugh a little too hard; or when the story grabs my attention. I’m assuming the stories are stand-alone, I’ve encountered a few games where they aren’t but, as a rule, I tend to think each game needs to stand on its own merit. Under that assumption, the story of Clockwork Tales lacks depth. I’m not even sure what the tremor machine was supposed to do. It causes tremors, I got that part. Living in volcanic regions will do the same thing, we’re not sending super secret special agents to stop earthquakes in Hawaii.

On the bright side, graphics are pretty good, facial distortion is a nice quick animation trick and these were done pretty well. I’m not into steampunk but I can see how it’s an appealing aspect of the game.

The meat of the game is the hidden objects. I tend to look at the consistency of the picture, meaning, are the objects to be spotted consistent with their surroundings? In this game, yes. I truly appreciate that. I’ve seen ones that have pixelated pictures overlaid onto a background. So, thank you for that. As for the puzzle games, I’m patient most of the time but I play casual because, well, I’m pregnant, hormones and patience don’t go hand in hand on most days. I’d say I won’t hit the hint button 90% of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188578901', 'num_games_owned': 2526, 'num_reviews': 956, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1548104485}

author: {'steamid': '76561198382638092', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1536263887}
review:
Fairly good hidden object- and puzzle-game. Mechanics are pretty similar to the actual ones from the same publisher, which is not necessarily a bad thing. Story is decent, visuals and sound effects too. Can recommend this without a doubt.

The only thing that annoyed me and destroyed a lot of the mood of the game is the voice acting of the antagonists. It's sad, cause the rest of the ingredients of this game fit together pretty well in this steampunk setting.

Some word on achievements: pretty easy and 100% possible in a single playthrough; the bugs that are to be found are placed very obviously. Unlike in other games like Endless Fables or the like. I played it through twice, one time for story and the second time for the remaining achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142496032', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1535920029}
review:
Good hidden object game with a little story, i actually learned something new about electricity from the story.
The mechanics are nicer than other hog i've played before this one. For example, sometimes you need to open something and you will have to use a [spoiler] screwdriver and both a hammer to wiggle some room to open it [/spoiler]. 
Not to difficult, you can play this if you are tired. Not to easy either that it's boring. The hidden objects minigames are not the whole game, you also have many different types puzzles and some (easy to skip) scenes to get through the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1535322689}
review: Typical Artifex Mundi for the most part. Weak story that only exists as an exuse for puzzles and HOGs. Significantly fewer 'find this list of items' style HOGs and more 'find items with these shapes' style HOGs than other games I've played. The bonus chapter makes up for it though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233896856', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1533858662}
review: Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink to jedna z ciekawszych gierek "znajdźkowych" w jakie grałem. Bardzo przyjemna szata graficzna, dobrze dopasowana ścieżka dźwiękowa i dosyć ciekawa fabuła. Gra jest bardzo wciągająca. Dla mnie była to pierwsza gra tego typu i bardzo się cieszę, że w nią zagrałem. Gra bez wątpienia zasługuje na polecenie oraz na zakup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198810795654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1533111744}
review: Śliczna i przyjemna gra w steampunkowym klimacie. Pełno wszędzie pary i mechanicznych części, muzyka jest miła dla ucha, a oprawa graficzna wygląda jakby była namalowana pędzlem bądź kredkami - bardzo fajny zabieg, dzięki któremu wszystko nabiera jeszcze bardziej specyficznej atmosfery. Fabuła jest bardzo prosta (jak we wszysktich grach Artifex Mundi, z którymi miałam do czynienia), co nie znaczy, że gra jest nudna - wręcz przeciwnie. Próba uratowania doktora Inka, a później świata przed Generałem Inżynierem oraz jego maszyną, dostarcza prostej, acz przyjemnej rozrywki. Zagadki są proste (jest to chyba najłatwiesza gra od AM, w którą grałam do tej pory). Całość rozgrywki zajmie, co najwyżej około 5 godzin, co nie zmienia faktu, że przez owy czas będziesz się bardzo dobrze bawił.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284900110', 'num_games_owned': 2863, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1532972624}
review: «Искалка» пополам с квестом. Лично я люблю такую смесь жанров (если сделана добротно). Тут вполне увлекательный сюжет со стимпанковской атмосферой. Простой, но внятный, без лишних выкрутасов. Приятная графика (арты в подобных играх стараются рисовать на совесть). Зачастую персонажи в таких играх статичны, но тут ещё и неплохо анимированы. Геймплей квестовый, опять же без заморочек: все предметы применяются логично и понятно (для особых торопыжек есть подсказки). Голову ломать предлагают в мини-играх. Они тоже весьма занятные. Самая казуальная часть игры – «поиск предметов». И в целом в каждой из трёх больших локаций «поисков» немного, это тоже плюс. Причём видно, что авторы стараются разнообразить процедуру. Большинство предметов из списка требуется как-нибудь доработать (дорисовать эскиз, что-то совместить). Каждый такой «поиск» даёт ключевой предмет для дальнейшего прохождения. В общем, игрушка на редкость приятная. Изредка такими себя побаловать очень даже можно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017825520', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1532209804}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026722388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1454102970}
review:
[h1]Verdict: 5/10[/h1]

One more of Steams many standard HOGs. I give it the thumbs up because the graphics are better than average, and mainly because I find the in game puzzles are also above average.

At 8€, I would wait for a sale.

[h1]PrivateJoh’s personal (re)view:[/h1]

[i] Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] is a HOG by the book, no more and no less. If you like the genre, it won’t disappoint you. You will find the usual stuff… An a bit extra: good quality graphics and some interesting puzzles (at least and in my opinion, better than the average HOG). Apart from that, standard stuff.

[b]In summary:[/b] a solid HOG, with better than average graphics and puzzles, that will appeal the fans of the genre. Nothing special. A bit pricey, wait for a sale.

For more PrivateJoh’s personal (re)views you can check [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32042143-PrivateJoh%27s-personal-%28re%29views/] HERE [/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1527100798}
review: This is a decent point-and-click adventure game that although good, is a bit short and besides the setting, has nothing that makes it stand out from the competition. The game has 3 main chapters plus a bonus prologue that you unlock in the end, some collectibles and a few achievements. You can also choose between 3 difficulty settings. If you’re new to genre, while this is a friendly game, I suggest you to look for a game with more content maybe. If you want more, then this is a good option when discounted or bundled, make no mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198436855269', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1639311649}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065321545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1525600189}
review:
[h1]El misterio de los terremotos de Gottland[/h1]
Siguiendo la estela de títulos anteriores, [b]Atifex Mundi[/b] nos trae una nueva aventura centrada en la resolución de puzles y la búsqueda de objetos ocultos: [b]Clockwork Tales: of Glass and Ink[/b] ([i]Fábulas del Tiempo: de Cristal y Tinta[/i]). Una serie de terremotos asolan diversas ciudades del mundo de Gottland una tras otra y el renombrado científico, el [i]Dr. Ambrose Ink[/i] ha descubierto el epicentro de todos ellos en el pueblo de Hochwald y en éste a su causante, [i]Gerhard Barber[/i], Ingeniero General de Gottland, cuyo castillo familiar se encuentra en las montañas a las afueras del pueblo. A sabiendas de lo descubierto, el Dr. Ink pide ayuda a su buena amiga, la agente secreta [i]Evangeline Glass[/i] (a quien nosotros controlaremos) para resolver la peliaguda situación.

Pese a que el planteamiento es cuanto menos curioso, la historia nunca llega a cuajar y no deja de ser una vana excusa para ir de un lugar a otro. No se le da ningún tipo de razón a la forma de actuar del villano, ni tampoco se ahonda en él. El mismo trato se le da a los protagonistas, Glass e Ink, y su relación. Es una pena porque podría haber dado mucho más de sí.

Jugablemente es otro cantar. La aventura, aún no siendo muy longeva (unas cuatro horas) está repleta de puzles, todos ellos variados en su planteamiento y, aunque un tanto sencillos, son tremendamente entretenidos de resolver. En ocasiones también tendremos que echar mano de nuestro fiel compañero [i]Matthew[/i], un ave mecánica, para que nos ayude a alcanzar objetos demasiado alejados. Además de esto también nos encontraremos con pantallas en las que buscar una serie de objetos ocultos y en muchas de ellas deberemos resolver pequeños puzles para sacar a la luz algunos de esos objetos a encontrar. El juego dispone de tres niveles de dificultad cuya mayor diferencia es el tiempo que se tarda en poder usar el botón de pistas o para poder saltar los mini juegos, algo que definitivamente todo el mundo debería evitar para sacar el máximo provecho.

Gráficamente la aventura nos lleva por tres zonas completamente distintas, todas ellas dibujadas a mano bien recreadas y distintivas, manteniendo el buen acabado artístico propio de la compañía, y una temática [i]steampunk[/i] que le sienta muy bien. Las animaciones, sin embargo, se encuentran un tanto limitadas pero cumplen su cometido.

El juego se encuentra completamente traducido al español pero con voces únicamente en inglés. El trato a las voces de los protagonistas es bueno, por desgracia no se puede decir lo mismo de los secundarios, pero estos son, en muchas ocasiones, los pormenores propios de doblar un juego por completo. La música que nos acompaña durante la aventura cumple su cometido, aunque durante la resolución de puzles impera el sonido de un reloj (imagino que en referencia al título) que nos puede poner un poco nerviosos ya que, aunque no sea así, parece que la resolución de estos conlleva un límite de tiempo.

Tras terminar la historia principal tendremos acceso a un episodio extra a modo de prólogo en la que nos pondremos en la piel del Dr. Ink en su llegada a Hochwald para descubrir qué y quién está detrás de todo. Es un capítulo corto, de apenas media hora que no ofrece nada nuevo con respecto a la aventura principal pero que tampoco hace nada mal. Un buen añadido.

En conclusión, como muchos de los juegos de este tipo, [i]Clockwork Tales: of Glass and Ink[/i] es una recomendable aventura para un fin de semana o de la que echar mano cuando se quiera desconectar de otros títulos de carácter más intenso. No es de las mejores en su género pero resulta muy entretenida.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197768', 'num_games_owned': 3607, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1522428063}
review:
Clockwork Tales est un hidden de bonne facture.  Composé de puzzles, scènes d'objets cachés et d'un insecte à découvrir par décor. Si on ne tient pas compte du résumé quelque peu erroné de l'éditeur avec l'intrigue palpitante, le gameplay d'aventures varié (en fait on résout des puzzles et il y a une cut scène) et le côté steampunk du jeu qui est archi vu et archi connu, on obtient un bon jeu au final. Et c'est même cela que l'on pourrait critiquer, c'est un jeu calibré pour faire ce qu'il faut pour plaire et rien de plus.
Pour autant, il n'y aura pas de déception mais mis à part avoir passé un peu de bon temps, c'est pas un jeu qui restera en mémoire très longtemps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2410, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1520649746}
review:
This is an interesting HO game. It has a steampunk theme, with some nods to our world (for instance, in the prequel [unlocked by completing the main game], you find a bunch of saints... who are scientists from our world). Anyway, the plot is engaging, if a little cliched (I mean, there has to be a reason you are doing all these things, and since the HO games tend to be the main draw). The HO games themselves are challenging, and the other minigames are fun.

Well worth the price. Though the fact that at least some of Artifex's catalog is usually on sale each week... I guess you can wait for that, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027686399', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1666728403}
review:
One of my favorites from ArtifeX Mundi, and I've played maybe 15 of their games so far? I LOVE the Steampunk flavor of it. I love the cute little mechanical bird helper. I liked the voice acting pretty well. Artwork is excellent as always. The puzzles were just challenging enough. There was one that I actually found quite difficult, which is uncommon for me in these games. Usually where I fail to get achievements is because I didn't see one of the collectibles. But this one puzzle was hard enough I really had to think about it and take my time.

All in all, one of the best purchases I've made from Artifex.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004233477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1517734858}
review:
I don't like Steampunk, but I enjoyed this game. That's how good it is.

My gripe with steampunk is it's mostly stuff painted brown with gears slapped ontop. Artifex Mundi's Clockwork Tales features a setting that's a mix of fantasy and sci-fi, with a Victorian/Industrial flare, in which the steampunk elements both play a role in the plot and a role in the puzzles. That's what I want in a good steampunk work, and that's what Artifex Mundi delivers.

The heroine of Clockwork Tales is an inventor's ward/apprentice/sort of daughter. She's trying to save him from the dieselpunk Nazi? standins, and has a mechanical bird who helps her along the way. Expect to solve puzzles like making a set of glider wings out of scraps and smashing robots with chandeliers. 

There's a good number of puzzles and hidden object puzzles, which are all around middle to hard in terms of difficulty. Apparently, it took me 5 hours to finish this game 100%, so I'd say this is a medium-long length game for Artifex Mundi and a really good value. At least a few of the puzzles are uncommon types of Artifex Mundi puzzles, so if their games are getting repetitive to you (from having played so many of them), this is probably the game for you.

There are collectibles that aren't super hard to find and do match the theme of the game (cute bejeweled robot bugs).

There is a bonus adventure, and from what I remember, it's a little challenging.

If you prefer Gothic over Steampunk, check out Scarlett Mysteries, also by Artifex Mundi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1516571309}
review:
[h1]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/h1]
...is a hidden object puzzle game. Evangeline Glass sets out for the town of Hochwald to find her surrogate father, Dr. Ink, who has been investigating tremors happening across steampunk Gottland.

[h1]⚙ [u]Game Description & Mechanics[/u] ⚙[/h1]
You begin your adventure in the town section, eventually moving to the castle section, and finally the volcano section. Within each section, you can (and are often required to) backtrack to find inventory items. A fourth section, under the guise of a prequel, is available once the main game is completed.

Puzzles are varied, such as moving panels, rotating gears, table labyrinths, maths, and, of course, the staple Hidden Object puzzle where you have a fixed scene filled with trinkets in which you must correctly identify some from a list at the bottom of the screen.

[h1]☺ [u]What I enjoyed[/u] ☺[/h1]
Hidden object puzzles have additional variety to them. Sure, you have the usual list of items to find, but others will focus on finding pieces and parts in order to build bigger parts, or a series of interacting objects until you are left with the item you need. All of these result in inventory items you use elsewhere or with other object in traditional point & click style.

Animations, while simple, respect the gorgeous hand-drawn aesthetics of the game. Hidden object scenes are also well drawn, with little-to-no distinction between removable object and the background panel. If a scene is used twice, objects removed the first time won't magically reappear on the second use.

The background music adds to the atmosphere or mystery, helping you feel you're in a foreign region or time, and the voice acting of main characters is sufficient to avoid breaking the immersion (with some notable exception, such as Mr. Rotten Apple).

[h1]☹ [u]What bothered me[/u] ☹[/h1]
It's too short, shorter than other games of the genre. My 5 hours of play include me being away from my computer for a while, as well as being stuck on two of the more difficult puzzles. The quantity of scenes isn't the problem, but you barely spend any time in many of them. The story is short as well, the speampunk setting isn't exploited enough.

With the exception of a few puzzles, most of the game is extremely easy. There's not as much clutter as you'd normally expect from the hidden object puzzles, most of which you'll need to do twice (with even less clutter the second time). The hidden steambugs are very hard to miss. Most inventory-based items are used immediately after finding, in many cases the game prevents you from picking them up until you actually need them.

[h1][b]My Verdict[/b]: ★★★☆☆ - [i]"It's up to you."[/i][/h1]

It's nice to play another [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] game after a few disappointing hidden object games. However, it is not the best game in their collection. This is why I'll only recommend [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] to real fans of the genre, keeping in mind there are some better ones out there.

—————————————————————————
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

review:
모바일용 포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤처의 이식작. 딱히 신선한 시스템이랄 건 없다

이 게임 회사의 어드벤처 게임들은 스팀 외의 번들 사이트 등에서도 가끔 파격세일을 하니 잘 찾아보자

author: {'steamid': '76561198280967403', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1516538912}
review:
剧情方面，总体剧情不错，和本公司的其解谜他游戏一样，剧情槽点很多，尤其结局烂尾了。
谜题方面，谜题过于简单，适合新手玩。[spoiler]我一度怀疑自己玩的到底是不是专家难度	[/spoiler]
翻译方面，汉化还好，没有影响游戏体验的大错误，比起本公司其他游戏真的好了很多。
成就比较简单，一周目就可以拿全成就。[strike]全成就之后卡牌只掉落一张我只好挂卡	[/strike]
总体来说勉强及格，有兴趣的推荐较大折扣时入手。
游戏特色方面，如同陆夫人总结的一样[spoiler] 破布玻璃刀，钻石玻璃刀，铁锈用油浇，女主爱锻造	[/spoiler]

review:
52번째 완전정복 게임


Artifex Mundi 의 세번째 게임입니다

엔지니어 장군을 저지하려는 잉크 박사의 도움 요청으로 찾아갔지만 잉크 박사는 곧 납치되고 마는데...

업적의 난이도는 다른 작품들에 비해 쉬운편입니다. 전문가 모드로 힌트 없이 퍼즐만 깨면  한번에 완료가 됩니다

중간중간 좀 뜬금없는 숨은그림찾기 때문에 짜증이 나지만 그 외에는 할만한데.. 결말이 좀 부진하네요...

Average story, too easy puzzles, to easy hidden objects scenes, music and sound effects are ok. Average game. Worth of buying only on sale for low price. 4.5 hour's of play. Nice idea with the bird. Average graphics.

Overall: 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076328268', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1508673165}
review:
Przyjemna HOPA w niezbyt często spotykanym w grach steampunkowym uniwersum. Może fabuła jest banalna, bez żadnej próby twistu, ale mi to nie przeszkadzało.

Dla mnie pozytywne jest to, że ani sceny z hidden objects nie są przesadzone z ukrywaniem, ani wiązanie ze sobą poszczególnych elementów w grze nie jest całkiem na bakier z logiką, a łamigłówki są w większości lekkie i przez to dające się sprawnie rozwiązać.

Miłe jest też to, że autorzy pozwalają zdobyć 100% achievementów przy jednym przejściu gry. 

Czyli dostałem to co chciałem: relaksującą, odstresowujacą, casualową, dosyć krótką grę (to że krótka dla mnie nie musi być wadą, a przy takiej sztampowej fabule zdecydowanie nie jest). Polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007627220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1509617075}
review:
[h1]Хороша игра в жанре «Поиск предметов».[/h1]
В альтернативном мире в стиле паропанка происходят странные землетрясения и доктор Инк отправляется в маленький городок выяснить причины этого. Он выясняет что-то интересное и вызывает свою помощницу Гласс на помощь. Но вскоре после её приезда Инка похищают и дальше разбираться придется уже самим.

Сама игра – классический представитель жанра. Ходим, ищем, применяем.

Картинка очень хорошая – нарисовано всё тщательно и ярко, с кучей деталей. Все персонажи озвучены, музыка не запоминается, но и не напрягает. Сцены поиска простые, все предметы видны хорошо.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1166377093

Из недостатков можно отметить только то, что игра очень короткая. Спокойно проходится за 2-3 часа. Игру рекомендую – проходиться быстро и впечатления после себя оставляет хорошие .

author: {'steamid': '76561198075274719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1510934496}
review:
[h1] [/h1]

- 짧은 플레이 타임

[h1]평점 [/h1]
4/10

[h1]단순하게 엔딩까지 [/h1]
누구나 가볍게 즐길 수 있는 퍼즐 어드벤쳐. 다만 퍼즐 속에 나오는 물건들이 모두 옛날 물건들이라 시대차에 따라 이해를 못할 수도 있다. 

가끔씩 퍼즐의 개연성이 떨어지는 단점이 있는데 상관 관계도 없는 곳을 들낙거리며 단서를 찾는 경우가 허다하다. 그렇지만 난이도가 쉬운 편인 퍼즐을 재밌게 풀면서 이야기를 즐길 수 있는 가벼운 게임이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389944545', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1508117469}
review:
I felt a bit mislead at this game being called a HOG when there were so many puzzles to solve and much object gathering and combining, but I enjoyed the story enough to overlook that.
I found the main story to be good, but felt that the Ink's prequel was the best part of the story.

Pros
I love the Steampunk theme!
You get Matthew, an adorable clockwork bird, as a helper. Honestly, I wasn't sure how I would feel about a mechanical bird but over the course of the adventure he really grew on me. :)
Beautiful artwork of a snowy remote mountain village and an inventor's castle
I liked searching for the steambugs in each scene
I liked the navigation by map, where you could walk to where you needed to go or just double click on the map and go directly there
There's no time limit on the game, you can take as long as you want/need.
No creepy horror or supernatural themes (like SO MANY other Artifex Mundi games, ick!)

Neutral
I like how the characters mouth and face move as they "talk" to you, but the voice acting is average.
The music fit well with the scenes and didn't jar me out of the game, but it wasn't especially memorable. If you like the music, there's an export option that gives you wma files. I'm on a Mac, so I used Switch to convert them into MP3 and they play fine.
Puzzles have a (delayed) skip option available so you're not forced to endure the puzzles unless you're collecting achievements.

Cons
I felt there were far too many puzzles and not enough hidden object scenes. (Yes, I do know that there's a skip option.) Some puzzles (the dollhouse, reflecting mirrors) were fun, and others (rolling balls, guide the pin) were just mind numbingly tedious.
And the biggest negative for me ... after all of the endless back and forth, gathering objects & boring puzzles to solve, the game just ... ends. [spoiler]Totally abruptly, you are informed that you destroyed the machine, you and Ink escape, Barber gets punished, and all is right in the world again. After all of the long journey Evangeline went through, the ending was just so jarring and abrupt. The ending cutscene just really didn't seem to fit with the story, like a sudden forced wrap up rather then a natural conclusion.[/spoiler] I would have appreciated an ending that was more satisfying and celebrated your accomplishments.

Overall I enjoyed the story, and I would recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041856540', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1507984978}
review:
A solidly B-class HOPA game. Not a clear Recommended, more of a Mixed.

[h1]The good:[/h1]
+ Beautiful painted art style and atmospheric music, as per usual Artifex Mundi quality
+ The usual gameplay from the genre, with nicely crafted HO scenes
+ Steampunk theme

[h1]The bad:[/h1]
- Extremely overdone German accent for the enemies' voiceovers. I'm not even German, but I felt insulted as a player by the sheer badness of it. Also heavily invokes the [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GratuitousGerman]Gratuituous German[/url] trope. Plus the main enemy's logo is [i]really[/i] reminiscent of the nazi eagle. There's such a thing as overdoing a theme.
- Cheesy and banal plot with a rushed ending
- Creepy-looking facial animations. Dr. Ink constantly looked so evil to me because of it, I half-expected for him to betray the protagonist before the end of the game :P Artifex Mundi haven't quite reached their current quality of facial animations with this game yet.
- Didn't care for the animal companion. Give me something fluffy next time :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198293997461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1566442840}

author: {'steamid': '76561198322801125', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1511501656}
review:
어릴때 구몬 학습지나 게임잡지 구독시 보내주던 그런 게임과도 같은 느낌입니다.

플레이 해보시면 아시겠지만, 숨은그림찾기와 간단한 퍼즐들이 주를 이룹니다.

또한 일러스트나 음악 등등 모두 고려해 보았을 때 만 12세 정도의 초~중학생이 플레이하기 좋습니다.

요즘 배틀그라운드나 롤, 오버워치 등 다른 사람의 캐릭터를 죽여야만 하는 자극적인 게임들이 유행인데요

그런 종류의 게임을 하지 말라고 하는것 보다는, 이런 게임을 직접 사 주고 이런 게임을 하게 하는것이 오히려 애들 키우는데 도움이 되 보입니다,



결론 : 자극적이지 않은, 건강한 느낌의 게임

가성비는 그대로 만원에 사셔서 플레이 하셔도 좋고, 저 같은 경우에는 세일받아 3천원에 샀습니다.

돈이 아깝다는 느낌은 들지 않네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104739523', 'num_games_owned': 4230, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1507470500}
review:
[h1]一款上手简单的寻物元素解谜游戏[/h1]

· 游戏为三种难度，初次玩这种游戏的可以使用休闲模式，上手很容易。

· 相较于很多寻物游戏，解谜的元素更多一些，有丰富的小游戏。

· 这个游戏的背景算是在机械时代，剧情线清晰，故事设计得不错。

· 背景音乐和过场动画还可以，界面略丑。

=====总评：8/10=====

author: {'steamid': '76561198263685513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1473589985}
review:
Jeder der die Vorschau und Screenshots des Spieles sieht, kann wohl erahnen, mit was für eine Art Spiel er/sie konfrontiert ist. 

Letztlich ist ein erweitertes Wimmelbild-Spiel, mit ein paar Adventure-Aspekten, in einer kleinen Geschichte mit Steampunk-Elementen, bösen Buben, einem kleinen Helfer und einem wirren Professor verpackt. Es ist ein simples Spiel, mit übersichtlichen Rästeln und einer charmanten 2D-Umsetzung. 

Es ist alles andere als ein nennenswertes Meisterwerk oder ein Unikat, sondern ein weiteres Spiel dieser Art unter vielen, welches in wenigen Stunden (ca. 3 std. Spielzeit) zu bewältigen ist. Mir ist dieses Spiel geschenkt worden, und ich habe es gerne gespielt, da mir persönlich gelegentlicher "stumpfsinn" ganz gelegen kommt. Ob es mir aber 8€ wert gewesen wäre, wage ich zu bezweifeln. 

Im Grunde macht diese Review hier keinen Sinn, aber mir ist halt langweilig. Wer Schachspiele nicht mag, wird wohl kaum irgendein Schachspiel kaufen, da es im Grundprinzip nunmal Schach bleibt, und so verhält es sich mMn auch mit diesem Wimmelbildspiel. Hinzu ist die Geschichte zwar nett, aber nichts aussergewöhnliches oder etwas, dass dieses Spiel einzigartig machen würde. Es dient nur als Mittel, um den Spieler von einem Puzzle/Such-Screen zum anderen zu führen. Letztlich macht dieses Spiel nur zu wenig falsch, um es negativ zu bewerten zu können und ist so generisch, dass es eine positive Bewertung, die Wertung innovativer und einzigartiger Spielumsetzungen herab setzen würde, die selbst jeweilige Genre-Muffel vielleicht doch begeistern würde.    
Gerade aus der letzten Überlegung heraus, und weil man gezwungen ist eine Wertung der Review an zu hängen, bewerte ich dieses Spiel negativ. Es ist nett, aber so allgemein und tausendfach reproduzierbar, dass es mir eine positive Bewertung nicht wert ist.    

*-* *-* *-* *-* *-* *-* *-* 
In Kurz:
Es ist ein Wimmelbild-Spiel mit etwas Story und ein paar Adventure-ähnlichen Rätseln. *Wuhoaaa* Diese Art Spiele müssen einen ansprechen oder halt nicht, und dann mag man das Setting und die Geschichte oder halt nicht. Wer diese Art Spiele grundsätzlich mag und den Preis bezahlen mag, macht sicherlich nichts falsch. Wer aber besonderes erwartet sollte weiter suchen.

review: 一款蒸汽朋克风格的解谜游戏，玩家们将进入蒸汽时代，在这里有各种高级的机器人与宁人费解的毁灭现象，我们要通过自己的努力去寻找博士被抓的秘密。游戏中玩家进入的时代虽然以蒸汽为动力，但是却能创造出各种神奇的机器人，大家要潜入海底与怪物战斗，又或者滑翔于天际逃脱追击。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119219362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1495743556}
review:
It's like taking the idea of James Bond, covering it in shiny brass and copper steampunk fittings, and adding the clockwork bird from Clash of the Titans. That's a steampunk Iron Bond with a Mach 5 bird scout, holy shit! You get to highjack a zeppelin and the villain has a mechanical arm, robot army, and a crazy Evil Lair! You can even play a bonus story from Professor Ink's perspective.

Collect ALL THE BUGS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198125545259', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1503770893}
review:
This is just a dull point'n'click game most of the time. A game with a horrible story, and nonsensical  chores (backtracking, and most of the puzzles), you as a player have to do... 

I play Hidden Object games to relax, and this one was annoying, and frustrating... 
A bit disappointed with the usually competent dev studio :(

Not recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198278293337', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1503382322}
review:
整个游戏都有一种蒸汽朋克风，机器人，机械乌鸦机械昆虫，有一种很细腻的感觉。
剧情就是女主为了救出教授阻止BOSS的阴谋。
话说这种游戏都是主角救XX然后阻止XX的阴谋的模板啊=口=！
小游戏有几个有点难度，我解了挺久的，剧情流程4-5小时……中间穿插着各种动画，挺有意思的。
我比较喜欢的就是这种细腻的风格了233333，里面的东西都描绘刻画的很细，尤其是那种机械齿轮的东西，让人看了很舒服。
另外，这个游戏有两条分支线路！推完本篇之后还有博士的外传，虽然很简短，但是感受到诚意了……
成就系统让人眼前一亮呢，像拼画一样，很有心。

author: {'steamid': '76561198038776903', 'num_games_owned': 7260, 'num_reviews': 3813, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1571201609}
review:
自带官方中文的寻物解密游戏，过程中穿插了一些解密小游戏。没有太多突破创新。
同类竞品多，受众群体明确，适合新手玩家，主要以画面和浅显易懂的玩法吸引新手玩家。
当然在你无聊之余，也可以作为调剂品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198241170120', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1503159725}
review:
劇情還不錯，謎題難度與關卡都很好，沒有莫名其妙的解法出現。
場景切換順暢，完全不卡。主線+前傳實際跑完時間大約 3 小時多，其他時間是在解成就。
簡中翻譯沒什麼大問題，有些微瑕疵，但全部都很通順，屬於滿意的質量。
蒸汽龐克+休閒解謎，很推薦的遊戲。

我在前傳看到一關要解名人科學家頭像與身體搭配的時候，都要崩潰了...
想說是能有多少人記住這些科學家的頭部特徵與事蹟搭配？
...結果只需要無腦硬換就能輕鬆過闗了 XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198282335679', 'num_games_owned': 5099, 'num_reviews': 878, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1502730248}
review:
畫面與視覺效果極佳
配音極差(搞甚麼? 真的很難聽, 而且有些人講話超慢...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198135403043', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1502043170}
review:
[h1][b]文末有通電(接水管)和五色球移位解謎圖分享[/b][/h1]
[h1]類型：[/h1]
點擊互動式劇情解謎
[h1]要素：[/h1]
收集品，物品組合，尋物，解謎，蒸汽龐克
[h1]中文：[/h1]
官方中文。本作翻譯大致上無問題
[h1]劇情：[/h1]
一般。劇情完整性不錯，但故事略短，屬於短篇的解謎遊戲。若能多些較刺激或令人回想的轉折會更好～例如來個回馬槍，女主角救了英克，卻讓世界陷入毀滅，或者在抓壞人的途中，機器人產生人工智慧殺了壞蛋，機器人變成最大頭目？！
[h1]畫面：[/h1]
不錯。雖然不到壁紙等級，但蒸氣龐克的畫風有充分的表現出來，還蠻不錯的！
[h1]音樂：[/h1]
不錯。音樂還蠻好聽的，旋律順耳。但種類有點少～不過這好像一直是Artifex系列的通病
[h1]難度：[/h1]
一般。本作的解謎難度前半段簡單，到拯救英克後半段時，難度有較高，但還在能解開的程度。尋物部分較為複雜，時常會看到眼睛脫窗啊，因為許多物件都是相同色調，只是外觀混在一起，有點像是保護色一樣
[h1]操作：[/h1]
簡單
[h1]優化：[/h1]
順暢
[h1] 娛樂：[/h1]
好。娛樂性在於稍短的劇情體驗加上有趣不難的小遊戲解謎+尋物解謎。遊戲畫面上，人物和場景的繪製水準有比去年(2012)的作品再更提升。以短篇解謎遊戲來說，算是不錯的作品！
[h1]重玩：[/h1]
一般。本篇完成後還附贈英克篇，非常良心。（音樂桌布都提供下載！場景桌布還不錯看）
[h1] 入手價格：[/h1]
－８０％，NT＄５８
[h1]總結：[/h1]
[u][h1][b]解謎黨推薦。劇情部分，依舊有Artifex系列的通病 "劇情略短"。但個人認為Artifex的解謎遊戲，較著重解謎成分，若故事太長，解謎會太多，玩起來會很累（若是以劇情為主的解謎則要相反，解謎少，劇情就要長些，才不會空洞）。但本作劇情內容較完整，以蒸氣龐克為要素，有著不錯的故事架構。
本作是2013年的遊戲，和2012年的Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden相比，感覺畫面已經開始有提升，不只氣氛，畫面的精細度及豐富度，都有顯著的提升。解謎部分也不難，中等難度。由於個人是剛玩完Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden，所以有兩個最大的優點改變就是，地圖可以直接傳送了，解謎及拿取物品的場景集中在同一區域了。個人玩Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden的時候，實在是非常感冒這兩個大缺點啊（沒地圖傳送，還外加物品散放各個非常遙遠的場景，遊玩時間都花在走路），本作沒有了這兩大缺點，實在是非常棒的改變！
個人是－８０％特價入手的，才NT$５８元，而且本篇玩完還附送英克篇，等於附贈ＤＬＣ...這根本佛心來的遊戲啊！若喜好解謎，又想體驗一下劇情，對於尋物解謎不排斥，個人是非常推薦本作的！[/b][/h1][/u]

[h1]缺點：[/h1]
１。起伏轉折若能在更刺激一點會更有趣，例如可以設定女主角是孤兒，在解謎的過程中，要毀滅世界的大壞蛋，竟然意外的是遺棄自己的父親?!
２。音樂可以在刺激一點，有點緩緩的啊！
[h1]３。最後的用粉筆畫六角形解謎，說明有誤。不是每個點只能點一次，是每條線只能畫一次，路線不能重複[/h1]

[h1]優點：[/h1]
１。地圖可以檢視未完成的謎題，而且最重要的是可以傳送了！省去了走來走去過場景的時間
２。有中文就是讚！
３。外篇中提供音樂及桌布下載，連小遊戲都可以先試玩XD
４。動畫和劇情結合的的還不錯，氣氛和帶入感有掌握到。解謎場景會隨劇情不斷推進。不會有之前令人詬病的重複走來走去的工具人解謎
５。本作的畫風蠻不錯的，個人喜愛


[h1]遊戲附圖，第二和三張圖為通電(接水管遊戲)開關+四色球移位解謎正解[/h1]
[url]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1102243605[/url]
[url]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1102470494[/url]
[url]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1102493722[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198173457771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1501997013}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1501451671}
review:
Glass & Ink dans le titre, c'est amusant, c'est aussi les noms des deux héros du jeu. 
Evangeline Glass, que le joueur incarne, rejoint son ami le Pr Ink sur les pentes enneigées de Hochwald, au pied du château de Gerhard Barber, pour enquêter sur une mystérieuse histoire de tremblements de terre. Le maître du (haut) château se révèle être une sorte de nazi dans un genre d'univers steampunk.

Le jeu associe quelques scènes d'objets cachés avec de la recherche d'objets, quelques mini-jeux et des insectes à collecter. On évolue dans des zones restreintes qui changent avec l'évolution du scénario et étonnament ça ne pénalise pas tellement l'exploration et ça limite surtout les aller-retours. En plus, la carte permet de faire des déplacements directs. Le journal comporte la carte et une liste des objectifs mais l'un et l'autre ne sont pas nécessaires tant on ne peut pas s'égarer dans ce jeu. Les voix sont en anglais mais sous-titrées en français et tous les textes traduits.

Les graphismes proposent des dessins sympas mais avec une animation malheureusement minimale et les voix ne sont pas toujours convaincantes.  L'histoire est simpliste et anecdotique et le méchant manque d'envergure pour qu'on le prenne vraiment au sérieux. Dommage également que l'oiseau mécanique qui accompagne l'héroïne ne soit pas davantage exploité. Enfin, on peut regretter la courte durée de vie mais l'expérience de jeu est intense car on ne perd jamais de temps à tourner en rond ou à trop cogiter sur un mini-jeu.

Au final, un jeu très correct dans cette catégorie qu'on doit au studio Artifex Mundi qui est coutumier du genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050552857', 'num_games_owned': 2290, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1439213944}
review:
무난하게 할 만한 Artifex Mundi사의 세 번째 게임 

+ 지도를 통한 빠른 맵 이동이 가능한 점 
+ 새로운 퍼즐과 적당한 난이도 
+ 엔딩 크레딧에 나오는 뒷 이야기 그림 
+ 공식 한글화 

- 먼가 엉성하고 급조한듯한 배경 스토리 
- 전작에 나온 몇 가지 퍼즐을 다시 사용한 점 
- 여전히 한번 시작하면 재시작을 할 수가 없는 점 

리뷰 점수: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1499747647}
review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is an extremely well crafted Hidden Object adventure set in a steampunk world, featuring beautiful graphics, a good soundtrack and strong voice acting. It comes with a bonus chapter that serves as a prequel to the main story.

You play an investigator trying to get to the bottom of a mysterious series of earthquakes with a side-plot of rescuing your mentor along the way. The features a variety of puzzles and the HO scenes alternate between the usual finding objects based on a list and finding objects based on their outlines.

About the only negative I had, and it's a small one, is that the puzzles although varied, were a little on the easy side.

At 3 1/2 hours to beat including the bonus chapter, if you are a fan of the HO genre, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1499441188}
review:
Un mélange d'objets cachés et d'énigmes plutôt simple (je n'ai calé que sur un des mini-jeux) ce qui lui donne un rythme de jeu assez soutenu qui colle bien avec l'histoire, Bah ouais quand il s'agit une enième fois de sauver le monde en échappant aux méchants qui grouillent, on va  pas prendre le temps de réfléchir des plombes.

Plaisant et sans prétention, un bon moment de détente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120567690', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1491344814}
review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a quite unusal hidden object game set in a steampunk (there are industrial steam-powered machinery literally everywhere) environment and also in what seems to be a fictional version of 19th-century Prussia (which explains why some of the characters use a strange mixture of english-german language). The game is nice to look at and ticks all the right boxes for a HOG, but for me it still seemed somehow half-finished plotwise.

We play as Evangeline Glass, a special agent (who else) who receives a letter from her old mentor requesting assistance: somewhere in fictional Prussia an unnaturally large number of earthquakes shake the ground lately. According to him, these tremors occur near the village of Hochwald, so we travel there right away and quicky discover that a local tyrant/inventor, who seems to be giving orders to the military, is oppressing the locals and is behind the earthquakes. When our scientist friend is kidnapped, we must take matters into our own hands.

The game starts off good with the beautiful snowy highland area and the tense, action filled segments with the soldiers on the zeppelin. The second half though gets uninteresting pretty fast and defeating the villain (whose goals are never revealed) is underwhelming. The game is still fun though since apart from the story (almost) everything seems to be all right.

It is one of those games where we have a helper, a mechanical bird which first we have to repair to make it work again. Besides the usual fetching capability, it also has a camera function, so it can give us information about what we are up against.
In addition to the HO scenes there are fragmented object scenes as well, where we have to reassemble objects (finding missing parts). The puzzles are imaginative and plentiful, ranging from easy to some really hard ones, for example the one with the balls, where we have to roll 5 different coloured balls into their corresponding slots - not only it is hard, but tedious as well (if one of the balls gets into the wrong hole or location, we have to start it all over again).
There are 3 chapters with different looking collectibles (steam insects) for each plus a bonus chapter that precedes the main story in which we have to play as Dr. Ink, the scientist who sends for Evangeline.

The main problem is with the second half of the game in which there's hardly any action and we learn nothing about the madman's further intentions, there's no grand finale, no catharsis, we just solve puzzle after puzzle. The endgame consists of basically a simple wire puzzle. Considering our character is actually a spy, this clueless investigation and lack of resolve is especially annyoying.
I also didn't like the fact that I had to click very precisely on objects so the robot bird would interact with them. It's annoying to realise that you were on the right track, you just didn't click on the right spot and gave up the idea.

As for graphics, the game looks very good, the artwork is unique with all the snowy and steampunk environments. I also liked minor little things such as how the vision changed when I had to put on a gas mask helmet. The music is forgettable and apart from the main characters, the voice-over was terrible. I really mean it, it sounded as if they asked a few people from the studio to provide voices and they were making a feeble attempt to reproduce german accent. I think asking people from the street would have been a better idea. On the other hand the lip syncing looked surprisingly good.

So does this mean I didn't like the game? No. Would I recommend it? I would, since it does almost everything well, all the things people like hidden object games. But if you value a good storyline as much as I do, and expect to play a game that remains exciting all the way, this isn't the best HOG for you.

PROS
+ great steampunk artwork and graphics
+ lots of puzzles and fragmented object scenes
+ mechanical bird helper
+ engaging first half
+ pretty good bonus chapter

CONS
- uninteresting second half, unsatisfying finale
- some puzzles are tedious
- poor voice acting

RATING
6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198029181769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1501073640}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106448921', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1493635953}
review:
貌似还没有中文评测？那我来做第一个好了。
游戏不长，大概4、5个小时就可以通关。剧情还是 Artifex的一贯尿性，女主角的好友被坏人抓走，女主角前去营救。

本作难度不大，画面比较有特色，突出了发条、齿轮一类的特色。不过剧情方面就有些不合逻辑了，比如反面角色为什么要制造灾难，而看似工业革命的背景下居然出现了爱因斯坦的塑像……仿佛完全是为了这个游戏类型作出的应付剧情。

全成就很简单，因为没有“不允许使用提示”这个成就，所以在游戏过程和谜题中可以尽管使用提示。建议打两遍。第一遍休闲模式，不跳过小游戏，找物品时尽量拿到一次无失误。

这里有一个游戏流程（youtube的），如果谜题不会过的，可以看看这个：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5cskHapprrU&t=5088s

此外找虫子的可以看看这个。本作的虫子都很大，而且都在动，所以很好找：
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=501848073

总之，这个游戏比较适合休闲放松。建议打折时购买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198173941151', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1493301712}
review:
I received Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink as a gift from a friend. I had never played a point-and-click before, and wasn't expecting too much as I headed into the game. I figured I'd probably just be bored, with no real story or challenge to the game.

But I was pleasantly surprised!

I'm not going to rid my library of all RPGs and platformers, but I very much enjoyed Clockwork Tales. It's a very different kind of game, a quieter & more thoughtful one. Not something I'll play every night, but when I'm in the mood, it's perfect. As a matter of fact, this is the first game on Steam that I replayed to get 100% achievements, which I'm rather proud of.

The story isn't Pulitzer Prize quality, but it's entertaining and interesting enough to keep you playing. The puzzles aren't difficult, but they do require some thought at times. The graphics aren't overwhelmingly fantastic, but I enjoyed them.

Clockwork Tales was a highly enjoyable play, and I would recommend this to anyone who hasn't tried a point-and-click before, or to anyone who enjoys them.

FINAL RATING: 6/7

author: {'steamid': '76561198345603158', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1492546202}
review: Una delle prime produzioni Artifex, ma piena di qualità. Anche se manca la lingua italiana, è comunque giocabile con soddisfazione utilizzando una delle lingue che vi sono più “affini” (io ho usato lo spagnolo). Nulla da eccepire: storia coinvolgente in stile “steampunk”, scene con oggetti nascosti facili da affrontare, mini-giochi complicati al punto giusto, filmati ben fatti, così come le musiche e le immagini. Il capitolo bonus è semplice ma comunque apprezzabile. Molto simpatica l’interazione con Matthew, un volatile meccanico che vi aiuterà in più occasioni. Complessivamente, lo consiglio. Ovviamente, per noi italiani vale la pena acquistarlo se è a un prezzo scontato…

author: {'steamid': '76561198035509552', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1492829665}
review:
This is my first puzzle game from Artifex Mundi, & I really enjoyed it!! Clockwork Tales is a point-and-click puzzle game with a steam punk theme. The art is very beautiful, & there are lots of very fun puzzles. Only 2 of the puzzles were any challenge at all however, so if you are looking for brain-benders then you will be disappointed. The steampunk theme works great for this puzzle game, & because of this most of the puzzles felt very natural in their placement rather than shoe-horned in. There's a good balance of Hidden Object Puzzles along with the other puzzles.

The music is also beautiful, but there are only 3 tracks and it gets VERY repetitive. The game wasn't really long enough for the repetitiveness to get on my nerves however, & the puzzle music track in particular is very pretty! The voice work was also very good. 

The only thing that was a disappointment really was the story. It is a fairly simple, linear plot with no character development. There was just enough of a story to connect the puzzles & I just didn't care about Glass or Ink at all really, so it's a good thing that the puzzles were so fun!

Completing the Prologue and the main story took me 6.6 hours, but I wasn't in any rush & took my sweet time so you could probably run through it much faster if you actually focused lol. I bought this on sale at some point but I don't emember what I paid. Definitely was worth the buy for me though.

I recommend this game for someone who likes fun, creative, casual puzzle games, appreciates lovely artwork, & digs the steampunk aesthetic. Since there are no adult themes or language, & the story is simple, with the puzzles being not too challenging, I would also recommend this game for kids. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197973678032', 'num_games_owned': 3240, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1489988385}
review:
[h1] Overview [/h1] 

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a point and click adventure game where you play as Evangeline Glass, a women who is sent to the far off village of Hochwald on a mission to rescue your mentor, Dr. Ink, and solve the mystery of what is causing so many earthquakes to rattle the foundation of the mountain village. 

For those that have played other Artifex Mundi games, or any hidden object games in general, Clockwork Tales follows the typical game progressions; you’ll have to solve an array of puzzles ranging from painfully easy to somewhat challenging in difficulty. The puzzles probably were the strongest section of the game, combining different elements to create some genuinely interesting puzzles to overcome. However, the story, or lack thereof, and general progression of the game felt hurried and jumbled together like so many disconnected puzzle pieces; it left me wondering when the characters were going to be fleshed out and dissected or when the plot would even be marginally explained. Once the credits rolled, only then did I realize how much this title left out. Let’s review…

As Evangeline Glass, you arrive in Hochwald, a small mountainous village to meet with Dr. Ink. Shortly after your arrival, Dr. Ink is kidnapped by a giant robot  oddly reminiscent of “The Iron Giant”, and whisked away to a fortified castle own by Engineer Barber and his mechanized cronies. Here’s where I had a real issue with the game; the story consists of a thinly veiled plot that tells the reader everything, leaving nothing to be discovered. Let me explain…

The earthquakes are abnormally frequent because they [i]tell[/i] you so, the guards are corrupt because they [i]tell[/i] you so, this town isn’t what it used to be because the citizens [i]tell[/i] you that’s the case. The player doesn’t really figure out any of this for themselves; it’s all stated as fact. The worst trope that the game follows is that the soldiers are the “bad guys” so the game clads them in black, gives them a German accent and slaps on a mustache on them. Combine that all together and you've got the recipe for a generic criminal enterprise to topple.

It might sound a bit harsh, but when you factor in that the paramount points behind these types of games are the puzzles and the story, it makes a bit more sense. One without the other causes the player to lose sight of what they’re doing either due to a lack of interest of a lack of understanding. As mentioned above, the puzzles are the game’s strong suit, while the plot is the weakest portion of the game and ultimately why I cannot recommend it.

For those not interested in plot spoilers or have already played the game, when Dr. Ink is inconspicuously kidnapped by Engineer Barber's 50ft robot in the middle of town and nobody seems to notice but you, you’re tasked with saving him. You dawn a soldier’s Wolfenstein-styled uniform, barter for a helmet, board a zeppelin, repair a mechanical glider out of a box of scrap, infiltrate the castle, defeat a few robots to save Dr. Ink and disable Engineer Barber’s machine with some blueprints, a piece of chalk and a hexagon, thus ending the game. 

The only parcel of information that is revealed at the end of the game is that the machine Engineer Barber controls was created by his father, who constructed it to [i]prevent[/i] earthquakes from occurring. However, it has been reverse engineered to produce them instead; the reason for this never being explained. Then again, the backstory in its entirety is never explained. We’re not told who Dr. Ink is, how he discovered this place, why he cares, who Engineer Barber’s father is or why this contraption exists in the first place. At the end of the game, you simply disable, not destroy, the earthquake machine and leave Engineer Barber alone to simply rebuild and continue his work. There’s seemingly nothing stopping him from fixing the damage, firing some security personnel and investing in a gun to put you down the next time you crash land in his courtyard. The plot is just an intangible mess from beginning to end. 


[h1] Pros [/h1] 

[list]
[*] Some of the puzzles are actually quite tricky. 
[*] The artwork, layout and general theme of the game is well done. 
[*] No bugs, glitches or progression issues were experienced during gameplay.
[/list]

[h1] Cons [/h1] 

[list] 
[*] The story is short and much of it is left unexplained.
[*] The voice acting is dreadful. I clicked on the old lady constantly in the tavern just to laugh and annoy my husband.
[*] The characters are very two-dimensional [personality].
[/list]


Overall, Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is just one of many hidden object games on Steam. There are better ones out there, several from the same developer and I’d suggest taking the time to look into those instead. With forgettable characters, atrocious voice acting and a subpar plot. If you enjoy hidden object games, I’d suggest looking elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245005894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1489750992}
review:
三周目结束后回来写评测。[strike] 地下的虫子找不全实在不想四周目了生气。[/strike]

这部比较感动的是3D人物居然看起来很流畅，然后额外的是有一只机械鸟陪着你。全程时长还可以[strike] 不然我也不会有三周目[/strike]但是这种游戏同样的情节不能快进玩多了真的会反胃……所以我放弃了全成就，在还差一个的情况下删了游戏。

剧情不想评价，整部的揭秘部分和小游戏都很良心，最良心的是中文翻译[spoiler] 玩过乌鸦森林之谜会觉得所有中文都特别亲切，真的！[/spoiler]所以作为点击累揭秘“小”游戏来说，打折的时候入一份，是很合适的。

最后，找虫子一生黑（手动再见）

author: {'steamid': '76561198075429360', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1625072480}
review:
This was my first Hidden Object - Point and Click game ... and it got me hooked on to the genre.

I needed around 20 mins to get sucked into the atmosphere .... so give it some time before forming an opinion.

Very well made. Great illustrations. Good story. Keeps you engaged throughout with new puzzles and new constructs.

It just costs around the price of a lunch or a movie and is a great value.


After the first 2 hours things got easy and so changed the difficulty to the highest. It's cool they allow you to do that in-game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980376608', 'num_games_owned': 1318, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1488497966}
review:
Если в «Бездне: Духи Эдема» Artifex Mundi предложили нам головоломочную версию Биошока, то в Clockwork Tales перед нами ненапряжный стимпанк-point’n’click квест-версия Dishonored. Шучу. Наверное. 

По сюжету нам достается в протагонисты восторженная барышня, которая наглоталась барбитуратов и решила, что она профессиональная шпионка. А тут ей как раз местный Дамблдор из местного Хогвардса письмо написал, мол, помоги, фашисткие хулиганы зрения лишают, механических птиц ломают и не дают торговать алкоголем после 20:00. Барышня приехала, навела шороху, сломала отель, починила кукольный дом и помешала главному злодею захватить мир с помощью землетрясительной машины. 

{Все этой такой отборный бред, что никто даже не воткнет, что я сечас выдал жесточайший спойлер}. 

Гласс с ним, с сюжетом. Что запишем в графе «Итого»? А вот что. Это, конечно, не Syberia, но это больше, чем просто нарядная казуалка.  Правда, по качеству картинки она весьма неоднородна. То видно, что вся графика нарисована с любовью, то попадается раздражающая глаз откровенная халтура. 

Лицевая анимация тут тоже неоднозначная. Если у доктора Инка она выглядит прекрасно, то у других персонажей как-то не очень. Девочка с ее песенкой про котенка будет еще долго вам снится в кошмарах, поверьте.
 
Уж не знаю, кто занимался локализацией этой поделки, но получилось тоже так себе. Ошибки в переводе не критичные, но досадные. Чернильница вместо чернильного пятна, зерно вместо кукурузы, сито вместо дуршлага, стаканы вместо бокалов, труба вместо курительной трубки – это лишь малая часть допущенных огрехов, которые, мягко говоря, в поисках предметов не помогают. 

Зато здесь есть легко выбиваемые ачивки и карточки. Мелочь, а приятно. Да в целом послевкусие недурное. Тем, кто еще только открывает для себя подобные игры - советую. Искушенным игрокам - Clockwork Tales, скорее всего, покажется очень вторичной и слишком легкой.

언제나 재미있는 방 탈출형식의 게임입니다.
이 작품 또한 재미있게 플레이 하였습니다.
하지만 이번 작품에서는 단서를 찾는데 연관성이 부족한 느낌이 들었고 플레이하는데 조금 답답한 면이 많았기에 기에 조금 아쉬움이 남는 부분이 많이 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349195327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1527089898}
review: Very nice classic point and click game with several good puzzles of varying difficulty. Glad I never had to break out a walkthrough like I've had to with many other point and click games, the developers have really found a nice balance between being clever but not being too farfetched. The only criticism I have is that the face animations for speaking characters are a bit creepy and goofy, but that's just an esthetic problem. The game itself is great and the artwork is nice as well.

review:
Making my way through a lot of picture find games and this one has a fairly decent storyline and minimally cheesy dialogue. The voice acting isn't too bad. Make sure to play it on expert. It gets more challenging as you go but not to a point where you will be too frustrated. Recommend playing if you're looking for an intersting storyline and a variety of puzzles (not just picture finding scenes).

Pros:
 - Good storyline / likeable characters
 - Decently challenging puzzles (make sure to play on expert)
 - Variety of puzzles

Cons:
- None

review: Ein Mechanisches Abenteuer aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi, es ist wirklich gut gemach die Landschaften sind schön und auch gut durchdacht. Die Story ist finde ich hier ein klein wenig zäh, die Rätzel sind dafür sehr knackig und auch sehr gut gemacht. Das einzige was für mich schade war das es selbst auf der Schwierigen Einstellung nicht zu schwer war sondern genau so als habe ich es auf Normal durchgespielt, das andere war das die Wimmelbilder hier mehr Lustiger Natur waren fand ich zu mindest, aber dafür gibt es alles keinen Punkt ab zu sondern eine Kaufempfehlung man muss es gespielt haben!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077644574', 'num_games_owned': 1351, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1452057138}
review:
This is a very nice little point and click game with good puzzles. It's in a Steam Punk society with a... you guessed it, German villain. Or at least the villain and his men are made to very much be a parody of the Nazi's. 
I found this quite enjoyable for a point and click puzzle game. Some of the puzzles are easy, some are quite difficult. But all in all this is not too easy nor is it so difficult you want to slam your fist into the screen.

I do highly recommend this for cheep if you want a laid back puzzle experience to last you a few hours. It's great to first play through it on easy and maybe then try your hand at a higher difficulty level.
