author: {'steamid': '76561198066202521', 'num_games_owned': 3403, 'num_reviews': 683, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1438827210}
review:
[h1][b]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/b][/h1]
Clockwork é um dos melhores jogos da Artifex Mundi, eu posso dizer que foi um dos melhores jogos de objetos escondidos que já joguei.
Nesse jogo você controla Evangeline Glass. Ela recebe uma carta do Dr. Ink que está conduzindo uma pesquisa sobre o aumento de terremotos na área. 
A arte é muito bacana, pessoalmenteeu gosto desse da arte por ser steampunk, o que eu acho fascinante, as animaçôes são bem legais, a história também é bem legal, os quebra cabeças são bacanas. E neste jogo também é possível utilizar a ajuda de matthew um passáro de metal, para pegar objetos e outras funções.
Eu recomendo este jogo.

[b]Nota: [u]9/10[/u][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198123049425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1453018957}
review:
One of the good Artifex Mundi titles. Excellent voice acting, beautiful art, cute steam-bug collecting achievements, interesting mini games and a fairly compelling plot. Awesome alliance between a young white woman (Evangeline) and an older white gentleman (Ink) and no annoying romances. For a Hidden Object / Point and Click / Casual, it's nice. I love Matthew, the mechanical crow, as the "helper" character.

The only lazy piece of the storytelling was making Germans the Bad Guys. Thanks to World War II, this is still something I readily accept as a plot in a game, but I found myself getting philosophical about it. None of us plan to forget - the Germans included - so does the stereotype serve a useful purpose in 21st century gaming?

author: {'steamid': '76561198163926961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1452808181}
review:
"Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink" to świetna gra HO. Postacie są przyjemne dla oka, miejscówki także, historia ciekawa, wciągająca, zagadki pomysłowe i nie za trudne, a ta muzyka... Godzinami mogłabym słuchać głównego motywu :D No i przeuroczy mechaniczny Mateusz :* 

Szkoda tylko, że gra jest taka krótka :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198242504012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1537201160}

author: {'steamid': '76561198199042451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1452082685}
review: Достойный представитель своего жанра: в меру сложные головоломки, поиск предметов без напряжения глаз, как всегда у этой студии отличная прорисовка локаций. К несомненным плюсам - стимпанковский сюжет, что, к сожалению, редкость. К минусам - несколько ошибок в русском переводе предметов для поиска.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072002990', 'num_games_owned': 1602, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1446517094}
review: I enjoyed this game - but in saying that I love point and click chill kind of games. The puzzles in this were relatively easy, but not all things to find were.. I enjoyed the story and all the bits and pieces that you had to place together in order to move onto the next section.. There were some super hard puzzles which was great.. The only real disappointment might have been the ending -- I felt as though there was a build up and I felt a little mmm cheated at the final scene.. Regardless, fun short game to play :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000866096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1451493384}
review:
Добротная казуальная стимпанк-головоломка со своим интересным сюжетом на несколько часов.

[h1]Графика[/h1]
Более чем приятна. Сюжетные вставки смотрятся симпатично и органично.

[h1]Логическая часть[/h1]
Необычные и разнообразные головоломки не дают заскучать мозгу, да и сам поиск предметов не вызывает никаких затруднений.

[h1]Локализация[/h1]
Но вот перевод некоторых предметов подкачал, особенно когда "из этой кучи" нужно найти несколько определенных предметов.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1403458169}
review:
Evangeline Glass is called by her friend, Dr. Ink, to the city of Hochwald, after a series of earthquakes threatening the region are detected. Unfortunately for her, he disappeared and Evangeline must face an enemy set to conquer the world!

Clockwork Tales is for me perhaps one of the weakest games produced by Artifex Mundi. Yeah, true, the plot is enjoyable and I don't mind the steampunk world, rarely visited in HO. But it doesn't have the same magic that goes with the other titles.

However, the gameplay is still the same: puzzles, hidden objects, etc.. Here, you'll have also a little companion, a mechanical bird, that can find stuff out of your reach. It's a nice addition.

What I loved the most in the game is the soldier's design. I loved the uniform, maybe because it's kinda making me think to Darth Vader or the Combines. But what is also fresh in this game is that the city isn't a big steampunk town but a little village in a snowy mountain. Besides, you'll also visit a castle, so, it's maybe a steampunk world but you're not drowning in it.

Anyway, as any AM's game, this one can be bought eyes closed. Given the number of times it has been in a bundle, I suggest you to wait for one of them if you don't really want to buy it at 8 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116279086', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1451269535}
review:
Uma sequência de estranhos terremotos está fazendo com que as cidades de todo o mundo se desmoronem em ruínas. O Dr. Ambrose Ink uma das principais mentes da revolução tecnológica pretende expor a causa destes fenômenos e começaa sua investigação... As coisas se complicam e o Dr. Ink desaparece, e você assume o papel de sua amiga de longas datas, Evangeline descobrir a causa dos terremotos e uma forma de salvar o seu amigo.
A história é bem interessante, possui elementos de ação, espionagem, e uma série de outras coisas que por vezes nos remetem ao mundo steampunk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159193354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1459200839}
review:
[b]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/b], another gem designed by Hidden Object Games (HOG) masters, Artifex Mundi, offers a lot of story at a reasonable enough pace. The game can be completed in under 5 hours, on expert mode, so it's not too demanding where you can't still play it casually. Does that even make sense...? 

The story begins in a small town known as Hochwald - presumably somewhere in Germany. While a once peaceful town, you will quickly find that that is the case no more. Agent Evangelie Glass is summoned by her friend and mentor, Dr. Ink, who is on a mission to uncover the mysterious secrets of the Barber family. Hochwald has, ultimately, been plagued by increasingly powerful tremors, and Dr. Ink has landed himself in trouble by attempting to sabotage "master inventor Barber", the latter of whom does not have the town in his best interest. With the help of a little mechanical bird, named Matthew, do you have what it takes to thwart Barber's evil plans?

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+  If you're into them, achievements are very easy to obtain
+  The graphics are easily some of the best that I have seen for a HOG
+  The way the story is laid out is good. It is paced evenly and nothing was rushed
+  Voice acting was done extremely well - one of them did make me go, "really?", however
+  Hopefully you don't find the puzzles too difficult. On average, they probably took me about 3 minutes to do. However... (continued in neutral)
+  Play with the music and sound on - do as they recommend; it is amazing and you can tell that they really put in a lot of effort to create a good audio experience for the player

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
±  ... one of the puzzles was giving me trouble and I couldn't get past it for a good 20 minutes. Lack of instructions wasn't too helpful (no kidding), but I eventually got through it

[h1]Con[/h1]
-  The game is extremely short. Even after playing the 2nd half of the game - [b]Ink's Story[/b] - I still ended up with a completion time of under 4 hours. So I would recommend only getting this game once it's bundled or under $2.00
-  I know this is steampunk, but some of the items felt really out of place, especially for the time period. It's like they attempted to fit the 1600s in with some 2010 elements. I can't remember what item I saw (it was during a hidden object scene), but it made me question the time frame; there were actually a few items

While on your mission to save Dr. Ink and the whole town from thheir demise, you will uncover a beautifully told story, wonderful adventures,  and stunning graphics. Give it a good go, and [b]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/b] will most definitely not disappoint.

Overall:
[h1]8/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198168259630', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1450039510}
review:
8.5/10 Very casual game, but a lot of fun all the same. I really enjoyed the steampunk style and the voice acting was surprisingly good. The amount of gameplay you get is not very long unless you try to get all of the achievements (which I did). I also did some of this while eating lunch or dinner, so I was able to eke out a little more time. It's definitely worth the money, because you also get an extra hour of gameplay playing an additional story that prequels the original once you're finished with the first game. For those who are wondering this is the Collector's Edition which is normally sold for twice the price at other download sites.

As always, because there is no ESRB rating, I'll give my own, trying to closely follow the ESRB rating system. 
Everyone: Mild Violence and Alcohol

author: {'steamid': '76561198262567533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1450017614}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074691072', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1510770106}
review: Хорошая и более чем достойная игра для поклонников Artifex Mundi и Hidden Object в целом. Очень красивая графика, в лучших традициях компании: волшебные ролики, арты, задники. Лицевая анимация только немного подкачала - лица очень уж неестественно дёргаются при разговоре, но на это можно просто не обращать внимание. Все задачки интересные и не особенно сложные, некоторые, вроде зарядки батареи от молнии прямо-таки поражают (не пытайтесь повторить это дома! - должны были сказать разработчики, но скажу за них я). Да ещё и стимпанковый сеттинг со всеми вытекающими: механическая птица, много всяких разных и прекрасных механизмов, даже альтернативная религия есть, с поклонением Тесле, Ньютону, Менделееву и Эйнштейну - в общем, атмосфера отличная. Недостатка я нашла всего два: игра достаточно короткая, на эксперте и с бонусной историей её можно пройти часа за четыре; и второй - сюжетная линия довольно скомканная. Ощущение, что нас выкинули по середине истории, ничего толком не объяснив, поэтому главные герои обо всём знают, а вот мы - игроки - не очень. Каковы мотивы и цели главного злодея? Как Инк и Гласс вообще на него вышли, откуда узнали? Неясно. Впрочем, для меня финальный арт основной истории все недостатки искупил вполне.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016225906', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1449512330}
review:
[h1]Plus:[/h1]


+ wciągająca historia

+ klimatyczne lokacje, szczególnie początkowa górska wioska o nazwie Hochwald

+ atmosfera grozy

+ steampunk 

+ zróżnicowane zagadki, wymagające od gracza skupienia

+ ciekawe zadania

+ pomocnik w postaci mechanicznego kruka

+ przepiękne, ręcznie rysowane grafiki

+ przyłożenie wagi do najdrobniejszych szczegółów 

+ długość gry, razem z dodatkową przygodą daje nam to około 5h zabawy w trybie eksperta

+ niska cena


[h1]Minus:[/h1]


- mała liczba notatek, ksiązek do czego przyzwycziły nas poprzednie produkcje


[h1]Ocena: 3/5[/h1]

1 – gniot, którego dotknięcie patykiem powoduje długotrwały uraz 
2 – można zagrać ale niekoniecznie 
3 – ciekawa pozycja ale sporo jej jeszcze brakuje do ideału
4 - solidna pozycja, zapewnia świetną zabawę na długie godziny, posiada minimalne błędy 
5 – trzeba zagrać, tytuł zasługujący na miano gry roku

author: {'steamid': '76561198254143766', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1448937575}
review:
Bundle Stars包包入手此系列，这家出品的游戏都是良心作啊，自带简体中文

蒸汽朋克风格的解谜游戏，流程短，也不难，很休闲，杀时间利器
很喜欢里面各种各样的小游戏谜题
本传通关后还会有外传

一周目其实可以直接上专家模式的 没什么区别= = 
为了成就再二周目太蛋疼了 玩了一会儿只好作罢

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198131524068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1448804654}
review:
A really handsome click and point game with a European, historical steampunk setting. It's clear a lot of care has been taken on this, and especiallly on the little clockwork bird who helps you during your puzzles in the game. The bird's design is particularly nice and it was always enjoyable to send your flying friend off on some task, throughout the whole game.

It's more of a puzzle game than a hidden object one, which suited me fine. Al]though there are bonus hidden object screens unlocked at the end of the game, if you're left wanting more.

Pros:
- Great art, especially the backgrounds and that clockwork bird.
- The story is pretty light, but the writing is good. I felt in safe hands.
- I found the puzzles to be just right. Professor Layton level, although simpler in setup.
- Enjoyably competent female main character, but one who doesn't suddenly start shooting people or killing them with big swords out of nowhere.
- Emphasis on solving problems through intelligence, not violence.

Cons:
- If you like hidden object games, you might be a little disappointed since the game is mostly puzzles.

Definitely recommend, and I look forward to seeing more in this series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981803517', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1449085654}

author: {'steamid': '76561198210814135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1448441933}
review: 游戏介绍写的很好啊，蒸汽朋克风……朋你妹啊！你管这叫蒸汽朋克？就是个机器世界说的那么好听！剧情凑合，音乐还行，但最最让我忍受不了的是这作可使用物品处没有提示！我选中物品移到能用的地方物品应该会变大或者发光，这家公司其他的游戏都能变大发光，可这作没有！他们是忘了弄还是怎的？导致我拿着物品却不知道判定区域在哪只好满屏幕的点，这游戏我花了3小时通关，其中一个半小时都浪费在四处点点点寻找判定区域上！

author: {'steamid': '76561198071871382', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1449000697}
review:
전체적으로 높은 퀄리티라고 생각합니다. 숨은그림찾기도 중간중간 스토리와 연관된걸 찾는걸로 나와서 좋았어요.
스토리흥미유발도 좋았는데, 이번에는 너무 이전맵을 사용하지 않아서 아쉬웠고,  너무 혼자 독고다이식의 주인공이라 재미가 다소 반감됬네요. 또한 악당이 왜 그러는지 더 모르겠음....
미니게임도 몇개는 꾸준히 사용한 퍼즐 나온것도 아쉬웠던  부분.
그래도 아주 재밌게 플레이했습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1448912278}
review: Ever since the first Artifex Mundi game I played (Enigmatis 2) all the others have seemed to be somehow lacking. I have been trying to workout if this is simply because I am now familiar with the format so they don't seem as fresh and exciting or if I did happen to play the best one first. This game made me think it is the former, this game has the great artwork, story and puzzles that Enigmatis 2 had yet I was not as enamoured with it. This is definitely one of the better hidden object games I have played and well worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192015041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1449061994}
review: 非常值得推荐的文字冒险游戏，但结局非突和短暂，有点美中不足。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030006913', 'num_games_owned': 6544, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1448892306}
review:
스팀펑크 배경에 이래저래 기획자의 노력이 잘 보이는 엄청 잘 만들어진 포인트 앤 클릭 게임.
전체적인 완성도가 무척 높고 퍼즐도 처음보는 신선한 것들이 많으며 난이도도 크게 높지 않고 억지도 적어 유저가 자연스럽게 플레이 가능하다.
또한 볼륨도 적당하고 뭐 이래저래 단점을 찾기 힘든 게임


장점:
스팀펑크 스타일의 아름다운 그림들
완전한 음성 더빙
신선한 퍼즐들
크게 어렵지 않은 난이도
정확하고 빠른 힌트
뺑뺑이가 적음
업적 100%를 쉽게 달성할 수 있음
전체적인 완성도가 높음

단점:
스팀버그 하나라도 놓치면 처음부터 해당 버그 있는데까지 찾아가야함.
힌트 없으면 찾기 힘든 부분이 조금 있음
불쌍한 병사들(..)

author: {'steamid': '76561198178127090', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1448675373}
review: HOG게임 입문용으로 적절하다. 스토리나 퍼즐은 특별할게 없기에 제작사도 그외의 요소들 (스팀펑크 세계관, 일러스트, 음악,풀보이스 더빙)에 신경을 꽤 썼다. 퍼즐이나 스토리는 심심하지만 앞서 언급한 요소들때문에 차 한잔 마시며 플레이 하기 안성맞춤. 다만 아티픽스 먼디의 다른 게임을 또 한번 해보고 이렇게 나쁘지 않은 평가를 내릴진 의문이다. 아마 하나 더 구매해보면 알수있을것 같은데 아티픽스 먼디는 이런걸 노리는것 같다.(HOG공장 제작사)

author: {'steamid': '76561198114094483', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1458753062}
review:
总体态度是推荐，那么就先说说缺点吧：
[list]
    [*][u][b]流程过短[/b][/u]，不能尽兴
    [*][b][u]结尾仓促[/u][/b]，剧情圆的有点勉强
    [*][b][u]谜题偏向简单[/u][/b]，模式化
[/list]

但毕竟对当时的我来说，
这是一款黑5期间纯粹冲着低价购入，
拿来[strike]舰C秋活精污捞船时[/strike]，点一点舒缓精神的，
本身就是怡情小游戏，要求不能太高[spoiler]但齐柏林太太赛高！[/spoiler]

 [h1]所以喜欢机械朋克风格的玩家，这款游戏仍然值得你在steam各大折扣季时选择入手[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198197883394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1467692748}
review: 剧情内容还可以，不过本人认为剧情偏短。游戏总体难度不是很高，玩到通关竟然一张卡牌都不给，无语。本人通关游戏时间3小时，还是比较长的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198036140078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1448678754}
review:
Gorgeous game, very good up to the end and then it falls flat on its face.  The ending is very abrupt.  One minute you're immersed in the adventure and the next, the heroine is telling you, "Oh we escaped and the villain got his comeuppance" It barely works as a conclusion and you're left feeling like someone left the last page intact in a novel but tore out the preceding 10 pages.

Still I do recommend it for all fans of Hidden Object Games and Steampunk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026806776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1448679654}
review: "Of Glass and Ink" is a solid, polished example of the hidden-object genre with no significant flaws, if you forgive the absurdly one-dimensional characters as a normal part of the genre.  I recommend playing on "Expert" here, even if you don't do so in most HOGs; this series leans to the easy end of the spectrum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069877806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1447102762}
review:
That was truly  a fun adventure from casual games masters Artefix Mundi. Apart from stunningly beautiful graphics the atmosphere was really cool. I liked the retro mechanical world with German-like stylized soldiers and that accent ;-P
Definitely would like to see another adventure set in this world of glass and ink :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198076379491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1424951311}
review:
I really like the setting because it's different from other Artifex Mundi's games :) Action happens in winter and also in the sky at one point, there's lots of clockwork stuff.
Graphics, music, climate and puzzles are great as always but to me there was very little action (everything was ... peaceful) and when the final came, it happened fast :/
In my opinion it had potential no one made use of, but it was pleasant to play anyway :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198079176393', 'num_games_owned': 1543, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1446809739}
review:
[h1]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink - приключение в сеттинге стимпанка,основанное на поиске предметов и решении головоломок.[/h1]

[u]Плюсы:[/u]

- Геймплей - радует обилие разнообразных головоломок и поиск множества предметов для их решения
- Графика - очень симпатично прорисованная картинка до мельчайших подробностей

[u]Минусы:[/u]

- Неудачная локализация - некоторые предметы переведены неправильно,и это усложняет их поиск.
- Небольшая продолжительность - игру можно пройти вдоль и поперек за 5-6 часов.

[u]Вывод:[/u] Игра однозначно заставит напрячь извилины для ее прохождения + часто продается по большим скидкам = брать непременно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058407520', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1446139965}
review: Para aventureiros que gostam de hidden object é uma ótima pedida em gráficos, história e puzzles. Puzzles simples mas história envolvente e que te prende até o fim, vale a pena conferir :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197997615828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1446028064}
review:
Carino e originale questo hidden object. E' diverso dai soliti HO, più vario ad essere precisi. Si passa da puzzles a scovare gli oggetti e a combinarli attraverso precise mosse e non risulta mai noioso. Non ci sono particolari difficoltà con gli enigmi e li ho trovati sempre tutti facilmente risolvibili (perfetto per chi comincia con le avventure grafiche). La storia è interessante e si gioca tutta d'un fiato anche se il finale non è nulla di particolare e poteva essere decismanete sviluppato meglio. Bellissimi i disegni. Musiche ripetitive effetti sonori nella norma e parlato in inglese scarso a volte davvero pessimo, diciamo altamente "amatoriale".
Per finire lo sviluppatore Artifex Mundi è sempre un sinonimo di qualità sugli HO e anche se in questo caso qualche cosa è un gradino qualitativamente più basso, mi sento di raccomandarlo lo stesso.
A patto che si compri in sconto, quindi aspettate le continue offerte che ci sono su questi tipi di giochi, non solo su Steam ma anche in altri siti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043305797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1446481536}
review: Интересная игра на один раз, как интерактивную книжку прочитать. Главное много от данного жанра не ждать ))

author: {'steamid': '76561198005701579', 'num_games_owned': 2413, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1445018413}
review:
Another nice hidden-object game from Artifex Mundi. Recomended to every fan of this kind of games, especially during a sale!

Pros: + Nice steampunk setting, very good and quite original (at least for this kind of games) story. 
+ Very nice graphics, atmospheric music and good voice-acting
+ Good variety of locations to visit.
+ Variety of hidden-object scenes/puzzles and some of them are quite challenging.
+ The use of the mechanical raven to reach distant items is a nice addition.

Cons: - I didn't really like the animation of the characters' faces while they speak.
- You interact with a small number of people.
- Very short duration - it took me 3.5 hours to fully complete it, while playing in the extreme mode and using the hint button 3-4 times (and all of them because I didn't think to check the h/o scenes twice).

author: {'steamid': '76561197987358915', 'num_games_owned': 3006, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1444670558}
review:
Probably the best Hidden Object so far in terms of presentation. 
Although the repeating of puzzles is clearly obvious when you played  other Artifex Mundi games. 
The game is also quite short and the end feels abrupt and seems to be lacking something lost in development. 
My 7hrs of the games consists of 3 playthroughs of the main game and 1 playthrough of the bonus content. 
Highly recommended otherwise though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092914308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1443957664}
review:
面白かった！
４，５時間でクリアした。

がっつりゲームはしたくないけど、何かしたかった時にプレイした。

クリックで謎解きして進めるアドベンチャーゲーム。
公式で日本語化されてて安心。（UIと字幕のみ）

最初は簡単、中盤から難しいのもあって、程よい難易度。
行き詰ったり、飽きたらすぐ止めた。
頭がすっきりしてて、やりたくなった時にやるとすっと解ける。
そんな風に進めた。

唐突に始まって、あっさりしたエンディングで最後は盛り上がりに欠けて、突っ込みいれてしまう。

とはいえ、丁寧な絵柄と音楽が雰囲気あってグッド！
ウィンドウモードの少し小さな画面のほうが、引き伸ばされず綺麗だし、気軽に出来ていい。
場面に合う耳に残るようなＢＧＭも最近のゲームではあまりなくなってきたから心地よかった。

格安セールで買うならおすすめ！
たまにはこういうゲームもいいね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198250357448', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1444060509}
review:
Классическая игра для этого жанра. Рисунок мне показался несколько грубоватым, зато колоритным. Нет вычурности и слащавости. Злобный стим-панковский фашик, профессор, как водится немного чокнутый, алкаши-аборигены в пабе - всё очень мило, правда.
Музыка и звуки не раздражают точно.
Инвентарь не перегружен, предметы быстро используются по назначению. Не комбинируются.
Сцены поиска авторы постарались разнообразить.
Загадки тоже типичные, несложные в основном.
Есть интерактивная карта и питомец. Подсказки. Достижения. Карточки. Бонусная глава.
Недостаток, собственно, только один: игра коротковата, приключений, локаций будет немного.
В общем и целом крепенький такой середнячок, 7 паровых жуков из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988440660', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1443653120}
review:
Очень хороший, но короткий (часов на 4~5) квест в стим-панковском антураже. Есть сюжет, по которому постоянно показываются ролики и рассказывается история. Загадки по большей части привязаны к повествованию, так что своей "типичностью" они не надоедают (кроме бонусной главы, в неё, похоже, запихали все те загадки, которые не смогли адекватно привязать к основному сюжету). Есть вполне сложные загадки.
Отличная викторианская стилизация, музыка (с контрабасом и тикающими мотивами), всякие бегающие механические букашки, паровые роботы, шестерёночные механизмы и даже часовой компьютер!

P.S. Шрифт русской локализации не соответствует оригиналу (игру проходил на английском). Как и положено порядочному стим-панку, главный злодей повелевает армией паровых големов, имеет шрамы на лице, носит монокль и одна из его рук -- механическая!

author: {'steamid': '76561198151263963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1443161935}
review:
Очередная игра для девочек. В этот раз мы ни много ни мало спасаем мир от чудовищной машины и злодея, в роли которого выступает конечно же недалекий мужчинка-солдафон, который толком то и своей землетрясной машиной не умеет пользоваться, зато хочет всех поработить, убить, веселье запретить и вообще по максимуму всех обидеть. С этой целью он окружил себя бездушными роботами способными выдержать его жестокость, они же воплощают в жизнь его зловещие планы. Игра ни сюжетом, ни сложностью загадок не блещет, единственный плюс за стимпанк.
Рекомендую девочкам\девушкам, желающим хоть где-то показаться умными и самоутвердиться над "тупыми" мужиками.

Итог: 5 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157783798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1443377173}
review: Приятный линейный квест от первого лица с простенькими головоломками, которые можно пропускать. Аркадных моментов нет. Точки поиска явно видны и открываются /закрываются по мере необходимости. История для детей младшего школьного возраста. В общем, разок пройти, чтобы утолить квестовый голод, можно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996590081', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1442916005}
review:
I recommend this game based on the fact I play A LOT of hogs (hidden object games) and Artifex Mundi continue to show that they are competent developers as this is but one of their games in this genre. I'll keep it short and sweet:

[h1]+++++[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Much like Artifex Mundi's other games, Clockwork Tales is visually pleasing to look at, probably not as pretty as some of their other games, mind.
    [*] The game has a decent plot, as far as HOGs go!
    [*] Achievements are varied and aren't too punishing to achieve, allowing easy 100% completion for those interested ;)
    [*] Features include several supported languages and steam trading cards. There are 6 cards to collect, so it's not too bad a grind to complete a set for the badges.
    [*] Fairly decent completion time, doesn't feel overly long.
[/list]

[h1]-----[/h1]
[list]
    [*] A couple of the puzzles may have you tearing your hair out for a while, I was forced to cheat and look at a walkthrough for one of them (although this may because I have the dumb).
    [*] Not enough hidden object parts for my liking but perhaps the game will suit people who prefer puzzle and exploration elements better.
    [*] Some games are purely reskinned versions from other Artifex Mundi games and don't include many puzzles that stand out in the genre - although this is a common feature among a lot of HOGs!
    [*] When not on sale I think the price may put some people off for what is essentially a small amount of game time, although established fans of the genre probably won't be deterred by this at all.
[/list]

What a boring review, I do apologise ;_; Anyhow, not to sound like I'm overly fond of Artifex Mundi or anything but the game is a solid HOG, I've played better but I've also played worse. Clockwork Tales does feel like 'just another HOG' in a way if you play a lot of them, nothing particularly stands out but It's a fun way to spend a few hours, especially if you like games that are easy to 100% or want something that's suitable for all ages (except me at 25 being unable to solve some of the puzzles... ;)).

author: {'steamid': '76561198154837109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1443256585}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968357064', 'num_games_owned': 11834, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1442855084}
review:
Dalsi povedena a stylova adventura od Artifexu, ktere se snad da vytknout jen jeji kratkost. Max za pet hodin budete mit hotovo vcetne bonusove prequelove kapitoly. Zpracovani se ale neda nic vytknout. Malebne zasnezene prostredi jakesi pseudonemecke visky, do ktere se vratil mistni slechtic s militantnimi plany vyuzit jistou ultimatni zbran na ovladnuti sveta. Aspon tak nejak to chapu z toho, jak je stylizovan do jakehosi "nazi" barona, protoze (to je 2. minus) cile hlavniho padoucha nejsou blize vysvetleny. 
Kazdopadne je jasne, ze ho hrac musi zastavit. Pomaha mu v tom (podobne jako opicak v jine hre Artifexu - "Dark Arcana") pomocnik, zde mechanicky havran, ktereho lze vyslat na nedostupna mista. Klasickych hidden object screenu (HOS) s hledanim dle textu je pomerne malo, coz beru jako plus. Doplnuje je skladackove hledani dle ikon a samozrejme hadankove minihry, ktere mozna lehce prevazuji, ale jsou pomerne snadne a zadny zakys jsem nemel.
Vizual je moc pekny, jedna se o steampunk, takze je zde spousta mechanickych pristroju a udelatek. Na stenach muze pozorny hrac najit easter-eggy v podobe obrazku ze hry "Enigmatis". Jedna hadanka v Inkove kapitole je zase kopii puzzlu ze hry "Abyss". Celkem fajn detaily. Hudebni motiv se take velmi povedl. V teto CE edici hrac klasicky dostane wallpapery, OST, zminenou bonusovou kapitolu ci par artworku. 
Achievementy jsou tentokrat bezva - zadna nutnost dohravat hru dvakrat, takze hned napoprve je muzete mit vsechny. Dokonce zde nejsou zadne "na cas", jako udelat minihru ci HOS do minuty apod. To je podle me plus. Jsou prevazne pribehove a jen jeden by mohl delat problem - hledani mechanickych brouku rozmistenych ruzne ve hre. Pokud ovsem hrac moc nespecha, ani tento achiev neni problem hned napoprve. Steam karty ma hra taky, jen kdybyste chteli hru v cestine, musite opet stahovat z Alawaru...
Jako celek velmi prijemna kratka adventura, ktera ma jen pomerne mdly zaver. Vizuelne ale pritazliva a oddechova.

70%

author: {'steamid': '76561198023073191', 'num_games_owned': 6290, 'num_reviews': 629, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1442002342}
review:
スチームパンクアドベンチャーゲーム
とは言っても、ボリュームは少ない（だいたい4～6時間ぐらい目安）ので、期待する程のゴテゴテのスチームパンクさは、それほど敷き詰められてはいない
ここが販売元の作品は、相変わらず気軽にプレイはしやすいので、その点はおすすめ

プレイに関してのまとめ
サクサク進む展開とゲーム性もあり、前半に至ってはかなり出来が良いが
後半気になった部分としては、終盤の一部分とボーナスステージに関しては、御都合主義というかなんというか
無理やりな展開と有り合わせで作った道具を使ったりする部分があったため、その辺りが少々分かり辛く、マイナス点か

デバッグに関して
終盤、バケツに水を入れれないバグがあるが、画面切り替えで直る
あとボーナスステージの男の博士が、ちょこちょこ女言葉で喋るのだが
邪推としては、恐らく翻訳家の人が、主人公が女であるという前情報を聞いて、ボーナスステージもそのまま同じように翻訳したのだろう

それほど酷い出来でもなく、秀逸という程でもない
プレイは苦ではないが、一押しする程の見所のある面白味は無い
個人的にはセールの時にでも買えば損はしないだろう作品

author: {'steamid': '76561198154580303', 'num_games_owned': 2805, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1441939866}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023246857', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1447358469}
review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink was the first HOG I have ever completed in my gaming history. I was beginning to feel attracted for the genre and decided to try this one out, due to it's reviews. I must say, I was surprised. This title shines in so many ways, from the art, to voice acting, soundtrack and puzzle originality. The art utilized in Clockwork tales is beautiful and lines up perfectly with the steampunk-ish universe where the story is set up. Voice acting is of high quality and never fails to impress.
 As I mentioned before, this is the first HOG game I've finished, but from the puzzles I completed, I was mostly pleased with their originality, never making gameplay repetitive in any way possible. I was also awed with the animation style and how movement actions are carried out.
 At your disposal, you have a mechanical bird, Matthew, that can be used to reach objects located in, otherwise, unreachable places. the main characters are interesting but due to the small playtime they aren't deeply explored, which leaves you, the player, to acknowledge only superficial information about them.
 Replayability is encouraged due to the existence of achievements such as: complete the game in expert mode, find all hidden bugs and don't misclick in any HOG segments. The bonus chapter, also a prequel to the title's events, is a nice addition and provides background on Professor Ink.
 
[h1]Conclusion: A must have for gamers who enjoy the HOG genre, and an excellent option for some who never played any titles of this nature. Low playtime, but high replayability. Great story, beautiful art and pleasant character design. Interesting steampunk-ish universe, and expanded by a bonus chapter (prequel). Recommend![/h1]

[h1]Screenshot: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=513878318[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198083097958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 371, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1441560267}
review:
結論言うと面白いです。

内容はファンタジー絡みのアドベンチャーと言ったところでしょうか？
週末に軽く楽しむ、短編や中篇程度の小説のように楽しむことができます。

総当りクリックのアドベンチャー・ゲームに特有の同じ場所を行ったり来たりして時間を費やされる事も、
ヒント機能が非常に充実しているのでテンポを崩さず物語に集中できます。
次の行き先やアクション、パズルにもヒントは適用されるのでまずストレスが溜まるということもないでしょう。
パズルについては面倒ならスキップまでできてしまいます。

興味があれば購入しても損は無いと思いますよ

author: {'steamid': '76561198139328230', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1441498167}
review:
I have to admit that [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] went and snatched the first place among my favorite Artifex Mundi games so far. I wonder why I haven't played this earlier. I knew I was getting myself a satisfactory HOG when I bought this, but I had no idea that I'll be having this grand a deal in HOG genre!

In a fictional steampunk version of 1700 Prussia, we take the role of Evangeline Glass; Dr. Ink's protégé and engineer extraordinaire. We hit the road to meet with the good doctor in Hochwald, part of Habsburg Monarchy at the time, on a letter that we receive from him earlier. Dr. Ink has been making a research on the alarmingly raising number of earthquakes that were dominating the area. He claims that he has proof that a corruption in local authority is responsible: General Engineer is abusing a dangerous machine to create these earthquakes and he should be stopped at once!

At this point, we all know what kind of game that we should be expecting from Artifex Mundi: beautiful artwork, genuine animations, charming setting, and a curious story. Above all our common expectations, [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] covers a narration and a period so dark, yet envelops it with fair music and an atmosphere straight out of fables. The marriage of Austrian culture with Enlightenment science gives birth to this amazing game. As a personal favorite, I couldn't avoid to mention the puzzle of Saints during the bonus chapter, which is a direct example of this marriage. Did I mention the artwork? I know I'm trying my chance, but even the achievements interface itself is an artwork, made of stain glass!

Gameplay is ordinary, yet the adventure elements of assembling machines are fairly imaginative. There aren't many HOG scenes, rather FROG - fragmented object game - scenes dominating this particular game. There is little to no backtracking, and a full functioning map. Puzzles are the kind that we are used to by now. As a change, in this particular adventure, we have the luxury of utilizing Matthew, a mechanical crow that we send out to gather items out of our reach, which spices the gameplay a bit up. We are also entitled to enjoy a bonus chapter at the end, to experience Dr. Ink's short adventure before Evangeline's arrival. The game is pretty short, being 5 hours or so with the bonus chapter.

Once I've completed the bonus chapter, I wholeheartedly wished there would be a series of Clockwork Tales games. I usually prefer downright fantasy or at least mythological elements in storylines, but [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] is an elegant exception that I'll let myself be enthusiastic about. As a side note, I'm in love with the steam machine crow named Matthew!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971341065', 'num_games_owned': 3377, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1441237949}
review:
As you would expect from any AM HOG, this is a fairly well polished game (for the genre), which is easy to play and has a decent storyline, in this case set in a steampunk fantasy world. While the game isn't particularly long, it is otherwise hard to criticize - the story moves along reasonably well, the gameplay is solid throughout - the HOG scenes are good, the point and click and puzzles all flow fairly well and make sense.

Probably the main area it could have been improved would have been better characterization or development of the three main characters, you barely interact with the main bad guy, and you only talk to your mentor a couple of times, so most of the story is developed through the protagonist narrating what is happening. Despite that, this is one of the better HOG games around, so it is an easy one to recommend for those that like this type of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073239792', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1440937580}
review: good puzzle game

author: {'steamid': '76561198123054255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1437864593}
review:
As much as I love Steampunk settings, this is the weakest of the HO games by the same developer. 
Graphically beautiful like the others, this features initially with absolutely atrocious voice acting -yes, even worse than the others-, and develops the Steampunk setting almost too much in a hurry. There isn't enough time to see exactly where we are, there isn't much sense behind the puzzles and the hidden object minigames, and the story itself makes little to no sense at all.

The ending, moreover, is particularly abrupt, and disappointing, which -in the case of these kind of games- is extremely bad. It looks good, but nothing else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243715774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1441250118}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034341138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1441051652}
review:
Admittedly the story in this one isn't as good as other Artifex Mundi games I've played. It's very pretty and the puzzles are good, but I did feel like this one was easier than some of the others they made and I was playing on Expert. There's also a pretty terribad German accent going on here. 

But for mindless relaxing and pointing and clicking it's great. Also the cat who won't help you in the main game, helps you in Ink's story, so that made me happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049977444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1446973966}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1561783103}
review:
"Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink" is one of Artifex Mundi's best casual adventure Hidden Object Games (HOGs).  The story is quite good (especially for a HOG) and the voice acting is actually good too (only some of the peasants with their single line to say are cringe-inducing).  The graphics are good and the puzzles OK.  My only real complaint about the puzzles is that very few of them are actual HOGs.  Most are Fragmented Object Games (FROGs). It took me about four hours to complete the main game and another hour for the Bonus Chapter.  So, five hours of good gameplay to get 100% Achievements.

I'm definitely recommending this game.  But, I'd suggest waiting for a sale.  If you can find it for around $5, spring for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075962090', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1440002338}
review:
[olist][i]这是我的第一个全成就的游戏，游戏的画风感觉像是英式童话和蒸汽朋克的结合体。[/i]

                     全成就攻略：
    [*]建议两周目，第一周目简单级，把昆虫全收集，剧情和人物对话细看，小游戏能跳过就跳过。
    [*]第二周目专家级主要解小游戏（小游戏难度不变）值得一提的是有一个一笔画的问题很有意思。


    总体分析：简体中文好评！bgm还不错，不过衔接的不太好，总是有断了再放的感觉。游戏性也可以，为了成就二周目值得上。
     个人评分 8/10
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198157077681', 'num_games_owned': 1562, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1439827154}
review:
发条传说这部作品让我玩出了蒸汽朋克风和二战风，敌人BOSS的造型总让我联想到斯大林+希特勒，小兵的配音加上军服一股德械师伪军的味道，总体剧情可圈可点，让我印象颇深的不是女主角，而是博士和一位抗命的军人，本传期间只能看到博士各种没用被抓和指手画脚，外传期间操作博士就是各种劳累奔波，尤其是在停机坪小屋那边可以看到有博士的通缉令，一位老人在遭到通缉追铺的情况下依然能够坚持不懈实在很令人敬佩。在教堂会遇到一位奉命前来抓捕博士的士兵，但他很明白自己的所为违背自己的本心，毅然抗命离去，在本传中女主角可以看到他在酒馆，抗命被解职的他在酒馆，可以用酒和他换头盔，他还是坚持自己的所为，给个好评。
   剧情方面虎头蛇尾，最后一幕艹艹收尾，BOSS完全没体现他的能力，那一裤衩的机器人部队呐，那些德械师伪军呐？你自己呐？让人觉得制作团队是不是闹了矛盾或者大鱼钱不够了…………、
收尾部分生生给这部作品扣了好几分，如果不是后面这部分剧情的关系，我相信STEAM的评分好评率可以在95以上的

author: {'steamid': '76561198063349176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1439491751}
review:
The good: Enjoyable ambient sounds, voices, and music. Has a fairly good art style; more light fantasy steampunk for most of the game (as opposed to some of the dark gritty steampunk types you can find). You can turn the visual hints for puzzles on or off depending on the difficulty. Some of the puzzles are challenging, and the hidden objects puzzles are fun (although on the easy side). 

The bad: It's rather short (I have 10 hours on record, but most of that is because I walked off to get lunch and stayed away from my computer and forgot to exit out of the game). The game takes certain tools out of your inventory once you use them; I guess it's not uncommon with this type of game, but I find it really annoying when I have to go hunt down another tool to do a job when I just had one that could have worked and it was taken away because reasons. 

General info: Gameplay is a linear point-and-click story with logic/hidden object puzzles thrown in every so often. The story is a little cliché, but otherwise ok. 

Overall: If you like point-and-click puzzlers or hidden object games, this is a fun little afternoon jaunt; I would recommend it.

System Specs Used: Intel Core i7-3610QM, Nvidia GeForce GTX 670M / 3GB GDDR5, DDRIII 12GB RAM, Windows 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198014442793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1438714423}
review:
I'm not the sort to prejudice games over things like their being hidden object puzzlers; and the Artifex Mundi games are by far the best examples of the genre. Nonetheless A.M. has followed the method of if it isn't broke don't fix it, meaning they reuse their puzzles with cosmetic variations from one game to another. This has the unfortunate result that if you've played one of their games you've played them all.

That's O.K. if you think of the games as more visual novels with bonus puzzle content. Granted the writing isn't amazing; but it isn't bad either. I know I've yet to play an A.M. game I could make myself stop playing before the end. That's, on average, over 3 hours in one sitting. And, most of their games include a bonus chapter that extends gameplay another hour.

They do manage to do this without unnecessarily padding game length that overstays its welcome. I know that doesn't sound like much in an industry with triple AAA titles that boast hundred of hours of gameplay. But, for cheap casual games this is an achievement.

My recommendation, because of the "if you've played one you've played them all" problem, is pare your selections down to their better games. That would be Enigmatis 2 (but not the mediocre Enigmatis: the Ghosts of Maple Creek) as a top pick, Grim Legends 1 & 2 if you liked that, and the Nightmares from the Deep trilogy if you just can't get enough of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016427463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1439239136}

author: {'steamid': '76561198144593917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1437923918}
review:
Although Clockwork Tales looked pretty good to me and had a lot of potential, I have to say that I didn't really like it overall. It has a nice mixture of point and click, puzzle, and hidden object elements, and it has an intereseting setting, but beyond that it disappoints.

They went with a Steampunk-ish setting with clockwork robots, etc., but they did a cutesy, little-kid, Disney-ized version which was silly and off-putting.  The villain is a cartoonish caricature, the story is simplistic and disappointing, and I just felt unsatistfied in the end.

I could see how some people might enjoy this game (especially younger gamers, around 10-12 maybe), but I wouldn't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982233892', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1438364859}
review:
Vorweg:

Hin und wieder spiele ich sehr gerne das eine oder andere Wimmelbildspiel. Die meisten beziehe ich von der BigFish Games Seite. DIeses Spiel war ein bestandteil des IndieGala "Hidden Mysterie Bundles".  Ich habe das Spiel mit freude installiert und gestartet, musste aber dann doch feststellen, das dies im vergleich zu einigen BigFish Games dann doch nicht mein Fall war.

DIe Punkte kurz zusammengefasst:

- Spieldauer zu Kurz
- Geschichte Langweilig
- Hab schon bessere Animationen bei Wimmelbild spielen gesehen.
- Auflösung zu gering. Wirkt ark schwammig.

+ Achievements
+ Sammleredition
+ Minispiele waren Okay (Standardkost)
+ Wimmelbilder sind in Ordnung

Ich hätte dafür keine 7,99 € Bezahlt. Und da dies zum Hidden Mysterie Bundle gehörte, war der Preis des Spiels somit i.O. (Je nachdem was man bezahlt hat)

Grundsätzlich würde ich es nicht empfehlen in anbetracht, das ich schon besseres gesehen und gewöhnt bin. Letztendlich muss aber jeder für sich entscheiden, ob er das Geld dafür ausgeben mag oder nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019812735', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1437405934}
review:
Another lovely HOG from the minds of Artifex Mundi! Clockwork Tales is definitely a good game for those who love the steampunk aesthetic, as well as hidden object games! Albeit a bit short, the game has a certain charm to it that I've yet to see in this genre. But, without further adieu, on to the review!

[b][h1]=Complete Review=[/h1][/b] (TL:DR version and Conclusion at the bottom)

[h1]=The Story: 3/5=[/h1] The story is a bit interesting. Your old friend, Dr. Ink, has made a discovery correlating to the mysterious earthquakes around the world, and Hochwald, a small mountain town close by to the mysterious castle of the Barber family. You play as Evangeline Glass, and it's up to you to save Ink, and put a stop to the cause of the earthquakes.

 While not overly groundbreaking of a story, it's still certainly a little treat. The game is sadly a bit short, in comparison to other games I've played from Artifex Mundi. But, fortunately like other games of theirs, Clockwork Tales provides a prequel story for extra play and to learn more about one of your allies. 

There -was- a scene that was a bit... Odd in my opinion, regarding one of the characters having a bit of a unexpected change of heart in it. But, It was just one of those 'come-and-go' moments. Not a reoccuring theme in the game, fortunately. 

[h1]=The User Interface: 3/5=[/h1]  With the user interface I was a bit disappointed with the lack of a more in-character journal-keeping function, like the ones in the Enigmatis games. However, having the clockwork bird, Matthew, to aid in puzzles and add a extra bit of actual functionality to the game made up for it. 

The UI is also well designed, and has it's own artistic flair to it, which I've come to expect from the skilled hands of these developers. So while there isn't an abundance of bells and whistles, there certainly is some eye-catching beauty to the interface itself, down to the pointer. 

[h1]=The Gameplay: 4/5=[/h1] The gameplay is pretty standard, and as you'd expect from a hidden object game. Artifex Mundi's games are very good about making sure things don't look horribly out of place in scenes, and this is no exception. So while it's not a ground breaker (pun not intended) among their own games, it's still a cut above most the HOGs I've seen and played.

A fair amount of the puzzles in the game I've seen and played before, but that's not necessarily bad. A little lacking in originality, but you know what they say, "Don't fix what isn't broken". And they do have a couple puzzles in here that I've yet to see in the other two games of theirs I've played, which is always a treat.

For those looking for a little more challenge, or to make things easier, there are three different difficulties. Being Casual, for those who are more interested in the story than gameplay. Advanced, for those who want more challenge, but not too much. And Expert, for the people who don't want things to be all that easy on them. The difficulties mainly affect how easily you can see where to go, and how quick your hints recharge. I myself prefer Expert, as I prefer to do no-hint runs.  

[h1]=The Graphics: 3/5=[/h1] While the story isn't too impressive, the graphics make up a bit for it. As stated before, Artifex Mundi is good about making both objects and background work together in harmony. So you don't have to worry about seeing horribly stretched images that look like they were swiped off of google. Everything works well in it's environment, and doesn't stick out horribly. 

The places you get to explore look lively, and nicely drawn. From the snowy outdoors with storms in the distance, to the vibrant warmth of the inside of the tavern with it's patrons sitting down to warm up. 

My only downside, as seems to be common with Artifex' games, would be the talking animations. Which, I'm really hoping they've worked on in their latest games. They did a good job of making sure the person speaking moves their head, as one would do when speaking. But it still looks a little... Odd? Definitely not one of their strong points. 

[h1]=The Audio: 3/5=[/h1]  The music is quite charming, and it's enjoyable. Not exactly the kind of thing you'd get addicted to listening to, but it has a elegance to it that is nice on the ears while you concentrate on the game. 
The sound effects work nicely, and for the most part, match what is 'triggering' the sfx. So that's always nice. I hope I'm not the only one who finds it so annoying when the sound doesn't match what is supposed to be making the sound. So finding out that this game doesn't have that problem is nice. 

The voices were rather well done, and fit the kind of people in the setting pretty well. Some of them weren't exactly.. Well... My cup of tea... But, I won't deny that they at least fit the character speaking. And I'm happy that the game at least has consistant voice acting, rather than some characters being voiced and others not. 

[h1]=The Atmosphere: 4/5=[/h1] I personally love the atmosphere of the game. I'm not one of those kinds of people who are in love with the steampunk aesthetic, but I do have to admit it's a pretty cool style and concept. And the game certainly does keep in touch with the aesthetic, with blimps, and clockwork bugs (which you have to find) as well as steampunk inventions abound!  

There aren't really any items that logically would not be in that time period, which I've noticed that this developer is particularly good with. You'd be surprised at how many HOGs can't get that sort of thing down. A cellphone in a middle-aged castle, go figure. Fortunately none of that sort is in this game.  

It's definitely a lighter-hearted steampunk game, so it's not all that gritty. The bright artstyle helps to enforce this. It concentrates mainly on the inventions and the victorian stylistic, which is common with Steampunk. So those who are looking for a darker-and-edgier steampunk esque game would not find such in this game.

[b][h1]=TL;DR/Pros & Cons=[/h1][/b]

[b]Pros[/b]
UI is well crafted, and has a clockwork bird companion (once you fix him).
Lovely Steampunk aesthetic, makes for a nicely styled HOG.
Backgrounds and Hidden Object scenes are nicely executed.
Three different difficulty options to allow players to pick their level of play.
Fully voiced dialogue with characters, which is always a plus.
Achievements! Boy I love me a game with achievements. 
Clockwork. Bird. Companion. I think that deserves another mention.

[b]Neutral[/b]
Lighter-toned Steampunk Game, not much nitty-gritty here.
Voice acting! Kinda a "Your mileage may vary" thing.
Story wasn't all that intense.

[b]Cons[/b]
Game felt way too short, which is the major problem with this game.
Not many puzzles or hidden object scenes. Pretty big downer since that's the point of this genre.
The talk animations... Oooh boy... Do they definitely need some work.
The very weird and kinda OOC moment in the Prequel story. Still has me scratching my head.

[b][h1]=The Conclusion: 6.5/10=[/h1][/b] All in all, it's a charming game for sure. However the short-length and lack of more puzzles hits this game's rating [b]real[/b] hard. If Steam had a neutral rating, I'd definitely pick that for this game. As there's plenty of good points, but bad points as well. So I'd say this is a lower-end positive rating. If the game's on sale for real cheap, it'd be a good idea to grab. But the bad points make it hard to justify buying it full-price.

I appreciate your time, and thank you for reading this review~.

review: 对于成就党和解密党来说算是一款茶余饭后的佳作，没有需要反复玩才能获得的成就，包括找寻隐藏的昆虫（隐藏物品）游戏中也非常清楚， 静下心来花个5~6个小时基本就能完美通关，Artifex Mundi的解密游戏几乎都自带中文，翻译的质量还可以，游戏的剧情也十分简单易懂，大体是说游戏的主角（女特工）帮助自己的养父（工程师）打败邪恶的总督，破坏了总督的地震机的邪恶计划的故事。对蒸汽朋克机械风有兴趣的同学可以考虑在打折的时候果断入手~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198195589879', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1437051384}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031542514', 'num_games_owned': 3875, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1436715193}
review:
恒例のパズルゲームアドベンチャー
どっかのバンドルの作品とは思います
今回は難易度低め、実績もそんなに難易度高くないけど
久しぶりにやるとかなり楽しめました。
でも定価で買うのは微妙かな..

初回エキスパートはつらいけどそれでも
なんとかなるかもしれません。

シナリオがないといってもないままいろんなパズルをやらされるのは
それはそれで微妙だし..

まあ一度でも触ってない人で気楽に
FPS以外のゲームもやりたいけどどれがいい？
ときかれればいいかもしれませんね..

実績的には特に問題ないけど
社交家はみんなに話かけないといけないが
誰を含むかはいまいち判らなかった..
虫退治はそれほど難しくなく動いているので判りやすいです

author: {'steamid': '76561198028216179', 'num_games_owned': 2423, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1436149553}
review:
Another solid Artifex Mundi game. If you're a fan of hidden object/point and click games then this should be in your library.

Story is solid, though a tad simple but engaging enough to keep you playing. Artwork is gorgeous, especially if you're into steampunk. Voice acting is solid enough. Only con I would say is that the game can be a little easy at some points, even on expert, and I would have enjoyed more hidden object scenes.

I wouldn't say this is a top tier Artifex Mundi game but it's a good play none the less and far better than many other games in this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125664030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1434952663}
review:
通关撒花，发条传说：格拉斯与英克，话说这个翻译的名字也是醉了，还不如直接叫玻璃与墨水了。

一时冲动买了HB的简体中文解谜9刀大包，已跪。游戏本身素质当然是不错，这个公司出品的都是良心游戏，全部支持简体中文，可是同一个类型的游戏玩多了真的会吐的，捂脸。

不过还是推荐大家买一两个这个公司的作品来尝鲜的，毕竟语言支持在，游戏性有，杀时间利器，而且尤其适合妹子玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1520547884}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink" Collector's Edition is a Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. The game was developed and published by Artifex Mundi.

Since this is a collector's edition game, it comes with extra features that are not available in its' counterpart; the standard edition.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are nicely done with a painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are three different game difficulty modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced and Expert.

The notebook keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly without having the need to constantly backtrack. It also indicates that there are a variety of tasks that can be completed at various locations within the game. The interactive map is automatically given at the start of the game.

There is a padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary.

The hidden object scenes consist of the following: Fragmented items; Shadows items and Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require a little or no interaction. Most of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them. Some of these puzzles can be replayed in the game's extra feature section as well.

There is a helper in the game: Matthew (a steampunk mechanical bird.) Matthew can help the player with certain tasks that they cannot complete themselves.

There is a collectible in the game: Steam Bug. They are scattered throughout the game for the player to find.

Since it is a collector's edition game, there is a bonus chapter, but it can be accessed only after the main story is completed.

There are nineteen different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

The extra features in the game: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Bonus Puzzles; Soundtracks; Concept Art and Wallpapers. Most of these extra features can be accessed only after the entire game is completed.

There are six different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070733862', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1433467807}
review: 画面精美，故事很紧凑，谜题设置也很有趣，唯一不足的是流程有点短，难度可以再大一点

author: {'steamid': '76561198090366497', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1433078046}
review:
A nice and simple mix of point and click, puzzle and hidden object elements. There's nothing overly challenging here, but this type of game tends to fit into the more relaxed category. The story is quite nice, the achievements work. There's an integrated hint system in the unlikely event that you do get stuck (and all the puzzles are skippable if you have problems with them). There are some nice collectibles in the form of mechanical insects as you progress through. The bonus chapter is, as is usual with these titles, a case of throwing the storytelling out of the window in favour of jamming in a  large number of hidden object scenes for no particular reason and just makes you backtrack over areas you've already been in the hope that a new one has suddenly appeared with the item you need to progress. Thankfully the actual game has these integrated into the storyline nicely.

If you like this particular subgenre of hidden object/point and click games it's a nice one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159192969', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1432142587}

review:

总之剧情也是不错的~推荐入手。
8.5/10（怨念的是最后的一个成就没达成，不过也无所谓了……）

author: {'steamid': '76561198168924363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1432594479}
review:
This was a good game. I was surprised by how many types of puzzles there were besides traditional hidden object ones, but it was still fun. Clockwork Tales is my favorite puzzle game that I've played so far. The story is engaging, which is an attribute that can be hard to find. Things like collecting the bugs and the crow mechanic were nice touches that made the game feel unique and fresh. 

I would recommend this game if you can get it on sale and like puzzles/HOGs. I feel like $10 might be a bit high for 4 hrs of play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036498823', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1546530007}
review:
(Copy and paste is your way to get the Doctor)

It is Artifex Mundi. "If you played one, than you know them all." which in this case is one of the few times in gaming where it comes to be the most positive thing about a point&click "slash" hidden object you might ever hear.

10/10 Artifex - You make me droll - Mundi

author: {'steamid': '76561198037092141', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1431735598}
review:
This is, so far, the best HOG I've played on steam or anywhere else.

You control Evangeline, who has been summoned to help her old mentor with his secret project. You arrive just to see him being kidnapped and you have to get him back from the evil robot-controlling villain and save the city. You fix your mentors clockwork bird companion Matthew and he helps you throughout the game.

There is a bonus chapter after you finished the game that is a short prequel to the main story.

The art is beautiful, the voice acting is really good and the music is atmospheric. The one problem I had in this game was the sounds in the engine room, which got irritatingly repetitive, but that might have been partially my fault for being slow.

The steampunk-clockwork world has a really good atmosphere and many neat detail, such as the 'church of science'. 

The hidden object and other minigames have a good difficulty, and there's no achievement for not using hints, only for not skipping, which makes life easier.

There is a map and it can be used to teleport. Throughout the game you can collect steambugs, which seem to only be good for the extra challenge and the achievement.

Highly recommended for any gamer, its the kind of game I almost feel bad about buying on sale because it deserves all my moneys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124154053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1431889528}
review: Krótka gierka, taka akurat na niedzielne popołudnie. ZAkończenie mnie trochę rozczarowało, ale warto mimo wszystko zagrac dla fantastycznego klimatu: muzyka i grafiki dostają u mnie najwyższe noty,

author: {'steamid': '76561197984658005', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1431874800}
review:
Die ungewöhnlichen Ereignisse in dem kleinen Bergdorf Hochwald, verleiten Dr. Ink Nachforschungen zu betreiben. Doch alleine kann er diesen Fall nicht lösen, doch Agent Glass ist bereits informiert.

Insgesamt bietet Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink eine interessante Hintergrundgeschichte, die zwar nicht sonderlich komplex ist, dafür aber gute Unterhaltung bietet. Genre-typisch gibt es Logikaufgaben, sowie einige Wimmelbild-Aufgaben, die allesamt kreativ gestaltet wurden. Die Schwierigkeit der Rätsel bewegt sich auf einem leichten bis mittleren Niveau, ohne den Spieler zu überfordern. Genre-Fans sollten in gut 3 bis 4 Stunden durch die Hauptgeschichte kommen, wobei die Bonusaufgaben mit Dr. Ink zusätzliche 20 bis 30 Minuten Spielspass bieten.

Als Kritik sei nur gesagt, dass der Einsatz des kleinen Dampfvogels Matthew zu sporadisch ist - hier wäre noch zusätzliches Potenzial gewesen. Ebenfalls sind einige Sprecher eher schwer zu ertragen, wobei Agent Glass und Dr. Ink sehr gut vertont wurden. Auch sind die Spracheinlagen der Soldaten des Generalingenieurs witzig anzuhören, da diese ein gebrochenes Englisch mit deutsche Begriffen sprechen.

Wie gewohnt liefert Artifex Mundi Premium-Qualität im Wimmelbild/Adventure-Bereich, was auch an den tollen Hintergründen liegt. Freunde ruhiger Abenteuer sollten definitiv einen Blick riskieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008615723', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1431812635}
review: Nice puzzle focused adventure game happening in a steampunk world. Great graphics, funny puzzles. It's quite short though - around 3 hours of gameplay. There is an in game "hint" system implemented that tips you where to go next when you are blocked - cool feature for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015956371', 'num_games_owned': 1392, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1671694061}
review:
Este é o meu terceiro jogo do gênero Hidden Objects, sendo que é o primeiro jogo da Artifex Mundi que joguei e zerei.
De fato a Artifex Mundi é conhecida por seus belos jogos neste gênero e eu diria que o ponto mais alto da desenvolvedora é na parte gráfica (arte) do jogo. É simplesmente impecável e cada local do jogo é incrívelmente bonito.

O jogo tem um enredo bacana, a trilha sonora é muito boa, a arte é incrível, o trabalho de voz é bem fraco, os puzzles são bacanas (tem de todos os níveis) e o jogo está totalmente em Português.

É uma ótima pedida para o jogador que procura um jogo casual e divertido quando não se tem nada para fazer e quer passar o tempo.

Recomendo pegar na promoção!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114567519', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1432498784}
review:
Super Spiel!

Also für Wimmelbildspielfans ein richtiges Muss. Die Animationen nicht schlecht und nicht überflüssig, die Charaktere ausgefeilt und sehr nah dran an der Realität! Ich finde es ist mindestens genauso gut wie grim Tales!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131925313', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1471267666}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995004507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1431651795}
review:
Ein sehr kurzes doch sehr schön gemachtes Puzzlegame.
Hat mir wirklich Spaß gemacht. Für alle Puzzle fans, wird es wohl sehr einfach sein, jedoch ist es schön gezeichnet und die Geschichte ist für diese Kürze auch sehr nett.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981855195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1431604554}
review:
The game features a great steampunk setting and is an overall quite a well done hidden object game, as typical for Artifex Mundi. The pacing of the story is a little bit more speedy and actiony this time around, which is a welcome change.

However it is just barely three hours long and only two hours of that are for the main game. The story just feels a little incomplete overall and a lot of stuff never gets fleshed out. So overall it's not a bad game at all, but it feels more like half a game, then a full game. It's really good, there just isn't nearly enough of it to make a satisfying experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192354910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1431471527}
review: Puzzles are great- not a great story line though

author: {'steamid': '76561198008547205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1431395721}
review: All around an excellent game. Love the music and the story, the puzzles were exciting and interesting, great artwork, above average voice acting (while still not great, much better than usual). Far and away among the better hidden object games I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971074683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1431066484}
review:
I thought that this P&C/Hidden Object game was one of the better I have played. It is a little on the easy side so playing on the highest difficulty is best. The story is fine, but it is the polish that really worked for me. The music and graphics are solid and the hidden object puzzles are actually scenes that make sense instead of a random assortment of meaningless objects. That attention to detail is rare.

In addition, the bonus content for the game is really added playtime. It is not just a rehash of the places and puzzles you have done before.

Overall, a really good game in this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032239028', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1430578999}
review: Worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142270848', 'num_games_owned': 1211, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1429524785}
review: Ok..I really don't bother with doing a review with most games..Kind of like "If you have nothing good to say, don't say anything at all"  which was the way I was raised..But anyways......This game is so worth my time to give you feed back..It's one of my fav's far as HOG's go...Which by the way saves me, cuz I play alot of strategy games which can sort of melt your mind in higher levels, so it's nice to have the laid back feel of a HOG!...This has a pretty good story..but where this shines is the voice acting and puzzles, add this to very nice graphic's and you got a winner!..So from one HOG lover to another, this is not a let down (even if you pay full price)..Hope you enjoy it as much as I have, CHEERS ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198161165938', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1429544363}
review:
[h1] Glass and Ink [/h1] 

Ambrose Ink adındaki doktorumuzun, yaşadığı kasabanın çevresinde olup biten olaylar üzerine ,neredeyse manevi kızı diyebileceğimiz, Evangelina Glass'tan yardım istemesiyle birlikte oluşan olaylar zincirini anlatan kısa ama güzel bir yapım.
Oyunun bulmacaları çok fazla sizi zorlamıyor, üstüne de ipuçları da alabiliyorsunuz. Biraz da ingilizce bilgisi isteyebilir, ola ki zor seviyeyi açarsanız (ki bu ihitimal her oyuncuda düşüktür:)
Sanki sanat eserinden (resim gibi yani :P) fırlamışçasına yapılmış görselleri ise esas bu oyunu alma nedenlerimden biri. 
Bir diğer neden ,aslında daha önce demosunu oynamış olmamdı. Bu oyunu alacaamm o kadar dememe rağmen, Windows store'da 15 TL gibi (yanılmıyorsam) bol keseden para isteyince uzun bir oynanışı vardır diye düşünmüştüm. Steam'de baktım ki indirime girmiş, hemen kaptım oyunu :) Sonuç mu? hüsran. Daha uzun beklerdim.
Gerçi bu incelemeyi yazarken aklıma geldi, ek görevi de vardı; ama yine de 15 lira gibi bir paraya göre oldukça kısa bir oyun.
Oyunu size ancak şöyle tavsiye edebilirim: İndirimdeyken alın :) 15 lira çok fazla...

author: {'steamid': '76561198060616666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1453943394}
review:
Definitely one of the best games we've played in months and one that you shouldn't miss.
Expect alot of puzzle solving and investigation as you search for your friendly professor.
Luckly you wont be alone as you can take your mechanical bird friend once you fix it.
We've been playing the game on [b]Windows Phone 8[/b] rather than play it on Steam
but we'll definitely play it on Steam too now that we've finished the android version, just to show you
how much we love the game and [b]Artifex Mundi[/b], one of our top companies out there.
We never though Artifex Mundi was on Steam but once we saw it we immediately got this games and
we'll definitely get the others too for another month of pure fun.
Definitely a must have for puzzle lovers and crime solving minds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047412737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1412785573}
review:
Je l'ai fait en entier. Une histoire sympa, j'en garde un bon souvenir.
