author: {'steamid': '76561198075038343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1419278262}
review:
O gameplay, inicia após alguns terremotos, que estão provocando a destruição de várias cidades. O Dr. Ambrose Ink, uma das mentes científicas mais importantes, prometeu acabar com este fenômeno natural. Após diversas investigações, as pistas apontam para o Castelo Barber.

No entanto, pouco depois de chegar a cidade, o jogador, se depara com o sequestro do Dr. Ambrose, agora cabe ao jogador, encarnar a Agente Evangeline, para salvá-lo.

Iniciando um rápido gameplay, com diversos puzzles, bem simples, que irão levá-lo a plantinar o jogo em uma média de 4 a 5 horas. as conquistas Steam, são fáceis e rápidas, exigindo apenas um pouco de atenção.

Ótimo jogo para aumentar seu índice de conquistas. Vale apena adquirir quando em promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057335415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1427028242}
review:
이런류의 게임은 처음 해 봤는데 간단히 즐기기엔 나쁘지 않네요.
하지만 한번만 플레이를 하면 끝나는 스타일이라 할인할때 구매하면 괜찮을 것 같습니다.
첫 인상은 솔직히 별로였지만 하다보니 나쁘진 않네요.
예전 플래시게임의 방탈출 게임같은 느낌이네요.
개인적으로는 너무 퍼즐이 힘든 어드벤처는 싫어 하지만 이건 그냥 간단히 즐길수 있는 난이도입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000422352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1425861252}
review: I picked this game up when it was $5. I wouldn't recommend paying more than that for it, but for $5 it was a decent game. It is a bit short, even with the added second storyline of the professor. The puzzles were a bit easy, but still enjoyable. The storyline was a tad disapointing. I was hoping for a deeper story, especially with the bad guy and the history with his dad and being unable to figure out his dad's machine.. but none of that came to a point. The art is nice. I'd pick up another game from this studio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005767937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1426463696}
review:
Juego entretenido con una buena historia, lo recomiendo a los que les gusten los point & click y resolver puzzles.
Lo malo es que es muy corto (me lo pase en una tarde en nivel experto) y los puzzles son demasiado fáciles, sobre todo para los que están acostumbrados a este tipo de juegos. Yo recomendaría comprarlo cuando esté rebajado, porque es tan corto que te dara rabia pagar lo que vale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127202056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1426437083}
review: A nice point-and-click adventure but the story is a bit boring.  Especially the end. I'd only buy it when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162327827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1427674391}
review: A good hidden object mystery game with an interesting plot. Great voice acting though the animation of the people talking is a bit off putting. Simple enough to figure out what to do but challenging enough to keep it interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080522092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1425937954}
review: I have played and enjoyed Artifex Mundi games on my phone in the past so I was glad to play this one, which as other reviews have stated is very typical of Artifex Mundi hidden object games. However because of the increased price and not being a phone app, I felt this game was too short (only about 4 hours long) and the plot wasn't interesting enough to be worth it. I'm glad I got it when it was on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177194457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1425997497}
review:
I truly enjoyed this game. There is a cat in Ink's Story (the bonus episode). You give him catnip. 

This game is exactly what you'd expect from Artifex Mundi-  an entertaining story, fun puzzles, some funny references, and some cute animals throughout! (Wish there had been more of the latter, alas) I enjoyed this game- and there were bugs (hence the achievement "Too Many Legs", but they were all mechanical, so I will not complain). Matthew, you're mechanical bird helper, is adorable, and helps out in some silly, but altogether needed ways. 

The game is overall easy, and doesn't take long to complete, which may be a selling point to some. It has a fun story, and interesting characters- one of which sings "Soft Kitty" from The Big Bang Theory- huh? All in all, I definately recommend this game! My only gripe (and again, this is a game with robot creepy crawlies) is that at one point I had to throw a snowball at an innocent, bystanding owl. Not cool, Artifex, not cool. Other than that devastating act of wildlife abuse, I was delighted in the overall gameplay.

Just another reason I will always trust in Artifex Mundi! (Just remember AM, there's no such thing as too many cute animal friends)

author: {'steamid': '76561198173582085', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1425883744}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134370684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1424706716}
review:
이런 장르의 게임은 상당수가 스토리에 나사 하나가 빠져있어서 살짝 찜찜합니다.
예를 들면 이 게임은 나쁜 아저씨가 왜 나쁜 아저씨가 되었는지에 대한 설명이 없고, 어떤 나쁜짓을 했는지, 그게 게임 속 인간들의 삶에 무슨 악영향을 주었는지에 대한 설명이 없어요.
그러니까 스토리에 너무 몰입할 필요는 없습니다.
다양한 퍼즐과 보너스 게임이 있으니 할인할 때 질러서 즐기시면 됩니다.
숨은그림찾기 싫어하는 분은 암 걸릴 수 있으니 주의.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063193728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1489249866}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988075191', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1423740791}
review:
Le moins que l'on puisse dire, c'est que Clockwork Tales est une vraie bonne surprise.

En soi, le jeu ne paie pas de mine : c'est un Point And Click de facture assez classique et dont le gameplay est surtout basé sur la résultion d'énigmes variées à la difficulté croissante (mais qui restent à la portée de tous) ou sur la recherche d'objets cachés dans les décors parcourus (rassurez-vous, ce n'est pas du Pixel Hunting pur et dur).

Côté scénaristique, l'histoire est somme toute assez classique et est très linéaire. Pas question de faire des choix moraux, ici. On se laisse juste porter par ce petit conte écrit dans la plus pure tradition Steampunk tout en étant bercé par des musiques plutôt agréables.

Incontestablement, la plus grande réussite du jeu, c'est son aspect graphique : chaque niveau est un véritable tableau intéractif et animé qu'on croirait peint à la main. Et le moins que l'on puisse dire, c'est que c'est très beau et très réussi. Chapeau de ce côté-là.

Après, il faut quand même savoir que le jeu a malgré deux petits défauts. Le premier, c'est le voice acting, pas toujours au niveau de ce qu'on pourrait attendre. Ça passe parce que c'est un petit jeu réalisé par un studio indépendant, mais quand même, ça nuit parfois un peu à l'immersion.

Le deuxième défaut du jeu, c'est sa durée de vie assez faible : selon votre façon de jouer et selon que vous cherchiez à débloquer tous les succès ou non, il faut compter entre 3 et 7 heures de jeu, tout en sachant que la rejouabilité est assez limitée (une fois le jeu terminé en mode Expert, il n'y a plus rien à faire). Un peu plus de densité et de contenu n'auraient pas été malvenus.

En conclusion, pour peu que vous aimez le style Steampunk et/ou que vous appréciez les Point And Click, Clockwork Tales méritera vraiment le détour. Ne reste que le problème de la durée de vie assez faible qui pourra justifier pour certains d'attendre une éventuelle promotion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018943325', 'num_games_owned': 1913, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1423509626}
review: Po dlouhe dobe super adventura s opravdu promyslenym ovladanim. Rozhodne doporucuji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006600581', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1708407470}
review:
Clockwork Tales is another great Artifex Mundi title. This game is great for those who love Clockpunk or Steampunk themed games. The atmosphere and graphical content is pretty incredible for such a short game. Clockwork Tales is one of Artifex's shorter titles, but the gameplay is core. While the story is short, the puzzles tend to be more challenging than many other Artifex Mundi games. 

All in all this is a fun game all around, and if you're familiar with the Artifex Mundi engine, then you'll know your way around just fine. Althought it is a short story, the content is rich and the environment is beautiful. 

[b]6.5/10 [/b] - Recommend to Artifex Mundi lovers, Clockpunk + Steampunk fans, and HOGers.
(On a conservative scale)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004118634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1423316737}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078482246', 'num_games_owned': 10603, 'num_reviews': 328, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1423146778}
review: 超级喜欢这种风格，不过这游戏玩起来感觉很老很老。这公司的游戏都超级棒，中文+通关解锁额外内容简直良心！

author: {'steamid': '76561198047005657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1422678556}
review:
The game itself is short, about 2 hours of playtime if you're halfway good at solving hidden object puzzles. 

The story is mostly there, but has some strange gaping holes in it. There's a lot of stuff that simply isn't explained at all, you're just plopped into the middle of it with no real attempt at backstory or even logical explanations of stuff. The villain is a ridiculously shallow stereotype and there's no real character development.

But, I still recommend it. Mostly because it's beautifully drawn, and while there are holes the atmosphere is immersive and enjoyable. With hidden object games like this, the visuals count for more than anything else in my view, and that's where the game succeeds best.

There's a hard mode for people who are REALLY good at these things (I played through it before trying hard mode and still couldn't get through one of the puzzles) but also a nice and simple casual mode that lets you skip puzzles that just aren't your thing. I'm big into that being important in games like this where I hate being stuck because of one single puzzle.

I liked the voice acting, it's not perfectly timed, but it wasn't awful.

Pros
+ Beautiful art
+ Diverse puzzles
+ Different level settings
+ Atmospheric

Cons
- Shallow story
- Flat characters
- Hard mode is ridiculous

author: {'steamid': '76561198067361850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1422969635}

author: {'steamid': '76561198130321496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1419857235}
review:
Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o.	算是著名移动端解谜游戏公司，最大的特点是游戏全部有中文。本作我个人觉得在他家的游戏中算是不错的，附送的福利也是相当多；虽然也有玩家反映Steam端有闪退和Bug的问题，不过喜欢这类游戏的筒子依然可以在移动端尝试一下。

本作的剧情很简单，依然是女主救人+拯救世界的老套路，正片+DLC全成就通关也只有2-3小时左右，不过作为小游戏也不能太挑。画面比较优秀，属于精致的厚涂风；蒸汽朋克的元素在游戏各处都很明显，适合喜欢这种风格的筒子们。音乐和配音中规中矩，总体来说在小游戏里算不错的。

作为典型的 Hidden Object类游戏，本作的解谜个人觉得类型还算丰富，就是稍嫌简单了些。游戏中的找物品和剧情的关联性很好，而小游戏虽然没什么新意但还算有趣。本作有难度设置，不过直接上最高难度也能轻松通关；而且自带提示系统，因此不用担心卡关的问题。

最后，本作自带的福利很多，不仅有收集元素，还有免费的DLC、壁纸和BGM。虽然Steam版的价格不算太实惠（好像最高也就75 OFF），但是各位Hidden Object爱好者们和成就狂们可以考虑入手看看。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102539759', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1421353508}
review: A really good Artifex Mundi game. However, I noticed that it was a bit shorter than the other ones. I finished it in approx. 4hrs but it it was really fun! Good graphics, story and original puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043585656', 'num_games_owned': 4440, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1421324357}
review:
Очень красивая игра, оформленная в стиле стимпанка.
_____________________________________
В игре весьма продуманный мир (есть даже святые - Исаак с яблоком и подобное :D), несколько нестандартных для жанра решений (механическая ворона-помошник, например).
В игре разнообразные мини-игры, правда все они оказались весьма простыми.
Сюжет коротковат (3 часа = полное прохождение игры на двух сложностях со всеми достижениями). Есть дополнительная компания (предыстория).
В игре присутствуют бонусные материалы (концепты, заставки, бонусные мини-игры).
Также отдельно нужно отметить хорошую озвучку и отличную рисовку.
_____________________________________
Я бы рекомендовал эту игру всем любителям жанра визуальных квестов (с поиском предметов и головоломками) а так же всем любителям стимпанка. Если же вы входите в обе категории - покупка даже не обсуждается :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198012093560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1421094677}
review: ABSOLUTNA REWELACJA W GATUNKU! Gra tak rozbudowana, że przypomina "poważne" tytuły point'n'click, a nie casualowe HOPA. Piekna, zachwycająca grafika, muzyka, a klimat gęsty od przejmująco mroźnej zimy. Wszystko to w steampunkowym stylu (sam nie przepadam, ale może dla kogoś to będzie dodatkowy atut). Gra się płynnie, fabuła potrafi nawet zaciekawić, a zwykle nie jest to mocna strona tych gier. Najlepszy i najbardziej dopracowany jak dotąd produkt studio Artifex Mundi i jak dla mnie najlepsza gra HOPA ever! Bije na głowę nawet Enigmatics 2. Na zdecydowany minus trzeba jednak zaliczyć bodaj dwie łamigłówki karygodnie żywcem przeklejone z poprzednich produkcji AM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101115250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1429760584}
review: If you get this on sale, a solid point-and-click/hidden object/puzzle game. Not as good as some other Artifex Mundi titles - it's a tad short, some of the interactions are annoyingly unintuitive, and your bird companion is sometimes just a copout - but it offers similarly dynamic story and atmosphere and decent puzzle elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025115329', 'num_games_owned': 11800, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1420938185}
review:
간단한 HOG (Hidden Object Game) 입니다.
복잡한 퀴즈없이 간단히 머리쓰면 해결되는 퍼즐만 있습니다.
그래픽과 영상미는 이정도면 괜찮은듯 합니다.
음악도 괜찮네요.

오랜시간 걸리지 않으니, 틈봐서 한번 해보시는것도 나쁘지 않을것 같습니다.
저도 처음해본 HOG 였는데, 가뿐하게 즐길수 있어서 나쁘지 않았습니다.

[b][도전과제완료]01/11/2015[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198055239225', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1708550909}
review: A very good HOA game, interesting storyline, challenging puzzles with all the steam punk clockworks you could ask for. When I say challenging puzzles I mean challenging enough not to bore me to death but without making me run to a guide in desperation. Graphics are well done and atmospheric and the music is complementary and non-intrusive. If you liked this game you should try The Clockwork Man and vice versa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125033411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1427570768}
review:
Adoro o genero "hidden objects" e  Clockwork Tales com elementos de mistério, ação e aventura  consegue te distrair por horas a fio sem cansar. A estória do jogo é bem envolvente e os mini puzzles pelo caminho as vezes fazem a gente perder alguns minutos quebrando a cuca!
Indico não começar pelo modo iniciante, pois as dicas acabam se tornando apelativas, quebrando rapido os mistérios. No mais o jogo é bem divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127376377', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1579456360}
review: Gra jest lekka i przyjemna. Grałem z dziewczyną i oboje jesteśmy zachwyceni. Miło można spędzić przy niej czas, no i klimat steampunkowy sprzyja rozgrywce ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970887820', 'num_games_owned': 4531, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1409383081}
review: A really good HOG game, good artwork and voice acting and a story that grows on you. Artifex Mundi once again prove that they have this style of gameplay mastered. If you are at all interested in this style of game then get this title. If nothing else it might encourage the devs to do second game set in this world. And trust me, we want that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048980407', 'num_games_owned': 2513, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1420418710}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101802351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1420402085}
review:
Мир стимпанка, немцев и спрятанных предметов. 
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink - хорошая игра от Artifex Mundi, делающих отличные игры в жанре "поиск предметов". В этот раз они использовали интересный сеттинг, похожий на стимпанк (хотя и не в чистом виде). Сюжет довольно интересный, хоть и без чего-то выдающегося. Понравилось хорошее соотношение "головоломки/поиск предметов" - обычно вторых больше, здесь же наоборот, больше головоломок, что делает игру более разнообразной. Рисовка хороша, чего нельзя сказать об анимации, которая выглядит странной. А еще здесь есть девочка, которая заставила меня криповать :D
Кстати, если говорить о минусах, то тут их два. Первый - малая продолжительность игры, чем страдает большинство игр в этом жанре. Второй, более существенный - неудачная локализация, особенно это заметно во время поиска предметов. "Corn" перевели как "зерно", хотя нам надо найти кукурузу, также вместо бокалов в списке числятся кружки, да и еще есть пара таких примеров неверного перевода. Мне особо не помешало, но все же это важный минус.
Игру рекомендую любителям жанра и тем, кто ищет простенькую игру для расслабления. 6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970934254', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1540763838}
review:
First time playing a point and click (or hidden object) type of game. Played this title with another--although only one person controls game--both of us enjoyed the title, taking turns controlling the game.

Have you ever looked for hidden objects in the Highlights magazine? This game features many similar hidden object finding puzzles, along with other types of puzzles, and adventure like object finding to move the story along.

Certainly will be looking for other good hidden object titles in the future do to enjoying this one so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160042778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1420245774}
review: I had a blast playing this game. Couldn't drop it until the end. It is both a hidden object and a point and click adventure game with beautiful graphics and storyline. I loved the music and the atmosphere, and I recommend it for all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049101018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1420227798}
review: Me ha gustado bastante. Tiene buena duración, las EOO no son muchas, pero sí variadas. Tiene muchísimos puzzles, desde luego ninguno es muy difícil, pero sí son entretenidos. En general es un juego que está bien para distraerse un rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1418831991}
review:
[h1]Short version: 86%[/h1]
A steampunk spy story set in an alternate universe pre-WWI Prussia, Clockwork Tales knows how to cater to both the adventure and hidden object game fans, even if only for a very short while.
	
[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a thrilling spy adventure set in a world best described as classic steampunk meets imperial Prussia somewhere around the start of the 20th century. The plot follows a female agent on the trail of her kidnapped mentor, only to find a sinister plot devised by a clichéd spy movie villain, which she naturally promptly foils. It’s cheesy and predictable, but written extremely well and acted out even better… just pure fun!

The video game aspects are done in the usual Artifex Mundi manner. If you know this developer, you will know most of the puzzles and hidden object scene types; although they may provide a few surprises as some of them are devilishly difficult.

But even the difficulty won’t help the short length (3 chapters with only a handful of locations), which makes Clockwork Tales less of a hidden object title and more an interactive adventure movie with puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123888324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1450351662}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998510952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1686641647}
review: A straightforward Steampunk puzzler, focusing more on puzzles than on hidden-objects games. While the story is simple, both the voice acting and artwork are top-notch. Unlike other Artifex Mundi games, the story only took about 2½ hrs to complete. Certainly worth buying while on [i]sale[/i] if you are looking for a relaxing and modest puzzler.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971043455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1439071655}
review:
I love snow covered landscapes, and the artwork in this game is really nice. You are immediately wrapped up in its atmospheric scenery. Unfortunately, that doesn't help you overlook the things that made me give this game a "thumbs down" rating.

Okay, so the bad immitation of a German accent you encounter in this game made me giggle, as German is my first language. Just, please, when you use elements of a foreign language in your games, make sure they are grammatically correct and also pronounced correctly -- which wasn't the case here. (For instance, it's "kleiner Spitzel" not "klein Spitzel".)

Apart from that, the game started out promising, but for the first time with any Artifex Mundi game, it quickly got boring. It just doesn't capture the real feel of steam punk for me, sorry. Some of the puzzles were challenging, although most of them seemed repetitive if you have played other Artifex Mundi adventures before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1419730386}
review: A good hidden object adventure game mixed with some good puzzles to solve.  There's nothing extremely difficult about this game or its puzzles, it's a casual game through and through.  However, the storyline is interesting and is fun to follow.  The puzzles are also well embedded to compliment the storyline rather than taking you away from the reality that the story creates.  Fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071033840', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1508541704}
review: 和发行商的其他游戏比起来，这个多了个鸟，有些场景需要鸟来帮助玩家获取一些不方便得到的物品。虽然用到鸟的情况不多，但也是一个不错的思路。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102948932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1514466483}
review:
同社の作品群の中で最優秀賞に位置するほどの傑作だとおもいます。

　古代人型機械、鳥型機械が空想寓話をひきたてる。
　茶色と橙色に統一された画風も美麗。

「あ、終幕か。ここまで謎解きもつまづかないで順調だったな。
　たのしかった。最後の敵と對峙して。。」
　と餘韻を感じていたら製作者名簿が流れて

　えっ？！

　完結

　びっくり。

author: {'steamid': '76561198151485566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1419128429}
review: It's ok, I wouldn't pay more than the 2€ I spent for it.,, The story is nice, only the ending was a little abrupt. What I disliked most is that the game was sooo short: I played the casual mode and only skiped one puzzle in the bonus part and got through in 2 1/2 hrs. Also there were smaller lags, e.g that the pointer was a little slower and sometimes highlighted areas which then couldn't be used. As I said, it's ok but there are really far more nicer and challenging games. I wouldn't recommend it for the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038596718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1419127496}
review:
You will like this game if you like other HOGs. It is on the shorter side (the main story took me around 2 hrs to complete, which is about half the amount of time I've spent on other Artifex Mundi titles), so keep this in mind, as such a short game may not be worth the $$ to many. This game is different from other similiar games in that it is heavy on the puzzles, light on the hidden object scenes, which could be a good or a bad thing depending on which you prefer. I also found it to be much easier and less complex than other HOGs I have played. If you are familiar with Artifex Mundi, you will also notice that some puzzles were taken directly from other games they've made (or perhaps the other way around...). 

Another issue, which I've found to be true with other such games, is that sometimes in the hidden object scenes, you will be directed to find, for example, a "hook," and there will be like 5 hooks in the scene, and you just have to keep guessing until you find the one they are referring to. An annoying oversight on the part of the game makers. 

In general the artwork and voice acting are both above average, and the story is super basic but acceptable. But you don't play these games for the story, you play them because you're bored, procrastinating on your work, or you don't feel like playing a "real game." It passes the time... not much else to say.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120752244', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1419093216}
review:
This is a steampunk-esque puzzle game, which is relatively easy. Rather than the game focusing on hidden objects, i found that there were more puzzles and this suited my style of play. The story in the game is compelling and well written, and I enjoyed the challenge of finding out the truth and exploring the surroundings. The value of this is game is way too expensive, but if it goes on sale, and you are looking for a game to chill to late at night, i would pick this up. Overall impressive but slightly expensive and rather short.
Whitty's rating: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013714810', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1471111250}
review: Great game. Having fun playing game with my child. i also suggest grim legends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025263525', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1401032423}
review:
Steam. Steam is everywhere. Bells, whistles and winter. Good story, slowly building itself through gameplay up to trembling grand finale. Leave player unsatisfied (more! give me more punk!).  

All puzzles are logical, there is no need to use solutions or hints from web. Was able to find all bugs, and made it perfect with all achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059372519', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1416884165}
review:
世界各地で相次ぐ地震の謎を解明したであろう博士が、発端と思われる地で行方不明に。
主人公は博士を救出し、彼と共に事件解決へ立ち向かう！というお話。

ヒドゥン・アイテムのパズルゲーム。
ビッグ・フィッシュではコレクターズ・エディションにあたります。
機械仕掛けのビジュアルが個人的にはナイスでした。
難易度選択有り。
カジュアルモードでは気軽にさっくさっくと進めるので、ちょっとした気分転換や暇つぶしに最適。
また、コンセプトアートが楽しめるのはとてもお得気分でした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044602606', 'num_games_owned': 7495, 'num_reviews': 544, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1418599007}
review:
This is another of a multitude of games that has become fairly standard bundle fare. That said, this one was still pretty good. It was on the very easy side as far as point and click adventures go, with only two puzzles that I can think of that really provided any challenge at all. That said, I think this was meant to be a more casual game, and so it succeeds in that regard. It's not a game that anybody is really going to get stumped with. It looked nice. The graphics were pretty and well done for the most part. The voice acting was not notable (neither good nor bad), and the story was decent. The Steampunk setting was pretty cool overall.

Overall, I give this game about 6.5 out of 10. not a must play, but the 4 hours or so it will take you to complete it wont be something you regret either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994885', 'num_games_owned': 1826, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1418591128}
review:
One of the best 'hidden object' games I've played.
Whilst it's not actually got many hidden object segments in it, it still feels like a through and through hidden object game, and that's what is great about it. I'm not the biggest fan of HO games but have played quite a few and usually after the 5th or 6th time of finding stuff it starts to get boring. This does not get boring and was completed in one sitting.

The gameplay is great and the main reason it's one of the best hidden object games, the animation is consistent all the way through (Some HO games tend to have 3D cutscenes making it look all cool and then boom, 2D generic HO scene) as well as it's got a bigger variety of puzzles then most HO games. In fact it probably shouldn't be refferred to as a HO game. I'll stop referring to it now.

This is a great puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160838312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1417923159}
review: Very nice game. Short but beautiful and smart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975259789', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1423717487}
review:
This is the first Artifax Mundi game I've owned. The story is lacking (nothing was really explained regarding the bad guy's motives) unless this is actually in a series of which I'm not aware; however, I found this to be a very addictive combination of logic puzzles and hidden object as long as you can get past some weak voice acting and accents. 

You can probably finish this game in about 3-4 hours, but the music and the hand-painted art gave it a sense of charm that I didn't expect. It's not particularly difficult, but it's still a value for a few hours of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144037701', 'num_games_owned': 1487, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1419617434}
review:
Artifex Mundi의 포인트 앤드 클릭 게임! 시계장치 이야기입니다. 이런 게임은 아주 부담없이 즐길 수 있는 재밌는 게임이죠.
어두운 전설이나 심해의 악몽처럼 숨은 그림 찾기 하고 퍼즐 풀고 하는 게임이죠. 
그런 단순한 게임임에도 정말 재미있다는 거. 물론 이런 장르를 싫어하시는 분들은 거들떠도 보시면 안되겠습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035057348', 'num_games_owned': 1068, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1418272736}
review: I really enjoyed this game. The puzzles were challenging but not too difficult, and the story was interesting (if a little far-fetched.) For instance,[spoiler] charging a battery with lightning? Leaving an airship with no pilot in the air during a storm? A machine that can both induce AND prevent earthquakes[/spoiler]? Come on. But I'll forgive them those quirks because the game was genuinely fun. The bonus chapter was a nice addition as well - the "saints" all being great scientists was cool. This game changed my mind about this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996694804', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1628469611}
review:
This game has been one of my favorite Hidden Object games so far. As far as gameplay goes it's pretty much your typical HO game with a few unique gameplay elements, which I like. My favorite part of this game is the artwork, which feels a lot more up-to-date than some of the other games where it just seems a tad bit cheesy.

I played this game all the way through on Linux (Ubuntu 14.04) and it works flawlessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104781556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1461632602}
review: one of the top five artifex  mundi HOG/adventure games for sure

author: {'steamid': '76561198036338106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1417533376}
review:
I hesitate to call this a "hidden object game" in the traditional sense because the first real HOG screen doesn't appear until over halfway through the game.  They toss in a handful of FROG (fractured object) puzzles, and they give you a "find a bug in each location" challenge, but for the most part this is an extremely casual point and click adventure that happens to have a few hidden object puzzles contained in the mix of mini-games.  (This is not necessarily a bad thing, however I expected something a bit different after playing several of Artifex Mundi's other titles.)  

Speaking of the mini-games, I noticed at least three of them were directly copied from "Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden."  I understand that a company needs to meet deadlines, but ripping off your own past work to flesh out your current game is a pretty disappointing tactic.

Due to the sparsity of HOG's, there was no alternate puzzle solution option for this game (such as dominoes or mahjong).  While this is a significantly more simplified level of gameplay than I have come to expect from this studio, it does allow the player to complete all of the achievements in one playthrough.  They also did not include any time challenges for this game.  

Aside from the puzzles, the adventure game elements were fairly intuitive, there wasn't too much backtracking, the story was decent enough, the art was good, the character designs and voice acting were well done, and there was even a bit of humour thrown into the dialogue.  I also liked the inclusion of an animal companion who doubles as a special use item (something that seems to be a bit of a trend with this studio's more recent titles).  However, the game is not entirely immersive, and many of the challenges feel like a means to an end, rather than a fun progression of the plot.

Overall I would have to give this game a 6/10.   If you are expecting a HOG, you will be disappointed, but if you are just looking for a casual steampunk adventure game, it fits the bill well enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025120297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1417539360}
review: Too little variation. Pick up things, go back, go forward, assemble, puzzle. Gets boring really quickly. Nice story, but there was a lot more potential here. Recommended only if you like repetitive puzzle solving. Also, some of the puzzles were buggy. They were correctly solved, but the game failed to recognize it and I had to use the cheat option. A few other times I experienced bugs in the AI as well. Not impressed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051945854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1417304888}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015010443', 'num_games_owned': 3180, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1418042994}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072110088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1417262009}
review:
Clockwork Tales ist ein Wimmelbildspiel von Artifex Mundi im Steampunk-Style.
In rund 3 Stunden Spieldauer erlebt man ein sehr spannendes Abenteuer, in dem man das Rätsel von mysteriösen Erdbeben lösen muss. Die Story hat dabei zwar wenig sehr überraschende Wendungen, ist aber insgesamt stimmig und spannend.
Grafik wie immer schlicht, aber überzeugend, die Musik sehr passend, insgesamt mal wieder eine sehr dichte Atmosphäre, die AM in diesem Spiel geschaffen hat.
Manche Rätsel und WImmelbilder haben mich teilweise echt in die Knie gewzungen, aber nicht unlösbar oder so kompliziert, dass man das Spiel frustriert ragequittet. War ein harmonischer Mischmasch von kniffligeren und einfacherern Rätseln, so wie ich es persönlich gerne mag,
Jeder der das Enwticklerstudio Artifex Mundi und Wimmelspiele ansich mag, lege ich diesen Teil an's Herz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092065417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1417142988}
review:
Standard HOG from Artifex Mundi, although it did seem a bit shorter than previous games.  Similar puzzles to previous games with a few exceptions.  Graphics and objects as always seem polished, and even though the voice-acting still seems to be off it seems to have become slightly better than other games. Speech doesn't flow well, but I think their English voice actors are from countries where English is not the primary language...either that or they're continuing to get amateur actors.  Subtitles and descriptions still occasionally have typos.

Overall, interesting setting and graphics, short game time, lack of replayability.  Worth a buy, but like the other HOGs, buy on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143419568', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1511546974}
review: Artifex Mundi twórca tej, jak i innych "takich samych" gier, o innej oprawie graficznej, zadania sa identyczne w kazdej grze (poskladaj misia, ptaka itp.) nawet sa w tych samych miejscach tylko w innej grafice klimatycznej danej gry :), jezeli ktos to lubi to polecam ;)!:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015377357', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1660115619}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981356193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1416971214}
review: Clockwork Tales: Of Glass And Ink is a an easy point and click adventure with hidden object and logic puzzles.  I've personally cleared every puzzle without any assistance on the hardest difficulty level.  I'm not trying to brag, but rather I'm the same guy who can hardly solve any puzzles in 7th Guest or 11th Hour.  On the flip side, the puzzles aren't too absurd or abstract, so you're never in a position to randomly guess at a solution.  As for the voice acting and the animated transitions, they are welcoming to break up the monotony of solving puzzle after puzzle.  The overall story though is lacking in material.  The game feels like a chunk of a bigger unwritten story.  The prequel story only creates more questions than it answers.  Overall, I had a great time, even if it was pretty short.  If you like creative puzzles without being overwhelmed, give this a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015538422', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1416661224}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035054806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1416234601}
review: Simply put, this is the best hidden object game I've ever played. Consuming plot that totally sweeps you in. Moderate challenge even on the easy setting. Complete gold of the point an click genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063544488', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1416018460}
review:
Szczerze mówiąc gra szału nie robi, spodziewałem sie na prawdę czegoś lepszego jak za 6 funtów. 
Czy ją polecam ? Nie wiem, jak ktoś lubi szybko przejść grę w 3 godziny to gra jest idealna dla niego.
Fabuła nie jest aż taka zła, ale spodziewałem się czegoś lepszego. No i co jeszcze mi się nie podobało to zbyt uproszczona gra, podpowiedzi są na każdym kroku, oczywiście samemu można kliknąć i zobaczyć, no ale jest tryb "ekspercki" gdzie przyciski "porady" i "pomiń" ładują się długo. Na prawdę lubie wasze gry, ale ta nie przypadła mi do gustu. Oczywiście kupię kolejne wasze tytuły ponieważ mam nadzięję, że będą one tak fajne jak "Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart" tu była bardzo ciekawa fabuła i aż chciało się ją przejśc odrazu, ale jak to się mówi są gusta i guściki, mi się podoba średnio a ktoś może ją poleci znajomym. Ocena to 50/100

Plusy:
- Dosyć ciekawa grafika
- Fajna muzyka 
- Ciekawe zagadki 

Minusy:

- Kiepski dubbing 
- Strasznie krótka (3h)
- Marna fabuła
- Zbyt uproszczona gra

author: {'steamid': '76561197995031584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1415788543}
review:
Quite an excellent Hidden Object/Adventure hybrid, with very well-done graphics (including all of the HO scenes), a plot seemingly straight out of a Jules Verne book, solid item puzzles and mini-games that mostly aren't too easy or difficult (although a some are obvious rehashes of common cliches), pretty good voice acting that covers nearly all conversation, and suitable music. Best of all, care was taken so that HO scenes reflect your last search the next time you need them; it's a personal pet peeve when they're just randomly generated every time. It's quite hard to see how it's related to the terrible "Lost Civilization" by the same company.

Definitely recommended to HO lovers and Adventure puzzlers looking for a casual evening.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115367328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1417438338}

review: 오오 정말 재미있는 게임입니다. 이게임은 너무 몰입하지 않고 간단히 짧게  끝나는 퍼즐 숨은그림찾기 게임으로 상당히 재미있는 부분이 많습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977594570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1415341443}
review:
If you like the Artifex Mundi style, then you'll probably like Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink. I have to admit, this developer has changed my opinion on hidden object games in general because their titles consistently manage to combine an engaging story with puzzles that are challenging but not taxing or tedious, quality artwork, and music and voice acting that suit the story well. Clockwork Tales delivers, and is probably one of my favorites in this genre.

I really like the Steampunk aesthetic, personally, so I thought it worked nicely into the format of a hidden object game. The bad guys here are militaristic fanatics with suspiciously German-sounding accents, so it's pretty obvious what imagery they were trying to evoke, but (pseudo-)Nazis blend well with the Steampunk style.  I was amused by the effort to include a bit of a science/geology theme in some of the puzzles and in the story, and I also appreciated that (like several of the other AM games I have played) the protagonist of the story was female.

Clockwork Tales is not terribly difficult or long, and the game probably lacks much replay value, It's still pretty entertaining and I enjoyed the few hours I spent playing. The achievements can be won in just a few hours of casual gameplay, so if that's your thing, then this is your game. It's also a family-friendly game as most of the puzzles aren't too difficult and the theme isn't very scary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001959192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1415135054}
review:
★★★★☆ - Hodnocení v rámci žánru Hidden object

Kupoval jsem za 2.59 euro a mohu doporučit. Dohrál jsem na nejlehčí obtížnost bez HINTů a přeskakování miniher za 5 a půl hodiny.

Pěkná steampunková hledačka od Artifex Mundi, normálně bych dal i 5 hvězd, ale jelikož jsem u tohoto vývojářského týmu zvyklý na precizně odvedenou práci, musím tentokrát jednu hvězdu ubrat. Grafika, hratelnost, hudba, dialogy, videosekvence, nové nápady, puzzle, bonusy a další, to je vše opět parádní. Bohužel v tom všem jsem dvě vady na kráse našel. 

Kromě psaných skrytých objektů, zde občas hledáš i předměty, které jsou pouze zobrazené v dolní HO liště. na tom by nebylo nic špatného, kdyby zobrazení předmětů nebylo tak malinké a neurčité. Člověk tam pak šilhá jak exot a ani neví, co vlastně hledá. Druhým nedostatkem je naklikávání u některých objektů a puzzlů. Občas je potřeba na něco kliknout víckrát, než to hra akceptuje. To samé se děje i u některých puzzle miniher. Je to matoucí a frustrující. Naštěstí takových situací není ve hře příliš, ale jsou tam.

+ Přiměřená rozsáhlost celé hry
+ Nové nápady
+ Rychlé přesouvání pomocí mapy
+ Grafika
+ Příběh
+ Dialogy
+ 3 stupně obtížnosti
+ Minihry
+ Bonusy po dokončení hry
+ Achievementy
+ Sběratelské karty

- Zobrazení některých předmětů (neurčité a matoucí)
- Akceptace správného kliku (někdy je potřeba kliknou vícekrát na předmět, případně na jiné místo předmětu)

author: {'steamid': '76561198017977574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1415058422}
review: Carino, corto e facile, buono per chi vuole provare questo tipi di giochi. Lo consiglio quando è scontato poiché non è molto longevo ed una volta giocato non ci rigiocherete. Gli enigmi sono passabili e mai troppo difficili. Un "entry level" per principianti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041639460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1415048008}
review: Un jeu de SOC et de casse tête qui passe bien le temps, un monde original et fantaisiste. Graphismes corrects, très colorés. Une grande impression de déja vu mais la durée du jeu est assez courte (5h) et on a pas le temps de se lasser. A recommander aux amateurs du genre. A la fin on a la bonne surprise d'avoir une aventure bonus où l'on joue à la place du professeur durant une courte mission. Prix cohérent avec la qualité/durée du jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001301038', 'num_games_owned': 5747, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1407373514}
review:
Hidden Object Game/ casual/ relaxing 

Unless you're a big fan of HO-games I would only recommend 1 of the many Artifex Mundi-titles. I was in the mood for some steampunk chillness so chose this title (played an hour every couple of days with some hot coco before bedtime)
Anyway Artifex Mundi nailed the casual feeling of a HOG. Mildly challenging puzzles, good atmosphere, nice music and drawings. If i had anything bad to say it would be my dislike for the morphing rubber face technique they applied, just looks goofy and out of place.

A solid HOG game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971749573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1543448739}
review:
Hidden Object games do get a lot of flak, and I must admit to being one of their harshest critics.  This is primarily because some companies who once made standard point and click adventures have instead jumped ship to these games.  Focus Multimedia are an example taking the Art of Murder and Chronicles of Mystery series from point and click to Hidden Object games in their later instalments.

The trouble is that a lot of these games are made on a budget, one that is very tight and they often look it.  The gameplay is often usually a few scenes and some random objects in a list.  There are exceptions however in this genre and I'm please to say Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is one of these.  DON'T go in expecting a point and click, it is still an HOG but at least it appears to be of decent quality and the game length isn't bad.

I got hold of this in a sale on Steam and it was worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058810024', 'num_games_owned': 5970, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1413731261}
review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink

Para los que les gusta el genero de Aventuras, Puzzles, es mas que recomendado, un juego con una historia bastante lograda, original, con una muy buena dinamica, la dificultad es la justa y necesaria para un juego de este tipo.
Ademas al terminarlo comienza una pequeña precuela del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987406707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1413017118}
review: I like this type of games. Especially from Artifex Mundi. Graphics is nice as usual. Story is simple, but I can handle it. Except the end, it make no sense. What is absolutely wrong is that game is ridiculously short. I get through the game two times in seven hours in casual and expert mode. It looks like half of the whole game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021115940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1558906618}
review: combines 6 types of puzzles along with lots of regular thinking ( expert mode ). the voice acting is good and one character is really bad ( find him\her yourself ). I found it a bit short, though. good game for it's worth ( with a coupon ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198134708941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1412546996}
review:
Очень милая и интересная игра в атмосфере стимпанка. Загадки интересные, но не напрягающие даже на высоком уровне сложности (хотя про сложность даже как-то говорить стыдно). Сюжет прост, но разве для подобных казуалок много нужно? Красивая рисованая графика, неплохая озвучка, да и всё, пожалуй. Любителям игр подобного жанра взять стоит, остальные же... если пройдёте мимо, то ничего не потеряете.
Тащемта, 6 из 10, господи, 6 из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067411046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1412426831}
review:
コレクターエディションでした。
これで定価600円は安いとおもいます。
steam 実績/トレカに対応しているのも嬉しい。

ゲーム内容はよくあるタイプの物さがしメインのカジュアルなアドベンチャー。
マップ表示など親切設計なので、この手のゲームに慣れていない人にもお薦めです。

これまでこの手のゲームはBigFishGamesで購入していましたが、
steamでもっと取扱いゲーム増えないかなぁ。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972799416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1527238204}
review:
Picked up Clockwork Tales: Of Glass And Ink during a sale, right after completing Nightmares Of The Dark: Cursed Heart from the same game publisher.
You play a female secret agent investigating the disappearance of a steampunk scientist in a small mountain town. It quickly becomes clear he has stumbled upon a great danger for the entire world.
The main game is a point & click adventure, combined with some sub-games; mostly, which are usually not too difficult to solve. Second there are the hidden object games, where you need to find a list of objects in a single scene. 
I still recommend this game as it is still quite entertaining, but this certainly isn't the best game in its genre. The main and bonus story can be completed in 3 hours or even less. Compared to Cursed Heart the story of Clockwork Tales wasn't very captivating either...

Score: 6/10

Pro: 
+ nice graphics
+ additional bonus story

Contra:
- really too short

author: {'steamid': '76561198084135095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1412359762}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056807270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1411497262}
review:
I would definitely recommend Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink, as it is a beautiful hidden-object adventure game.  The game also has a great little story, with some quirky characters, which makes it highly entertaining and enjoyable.
However, compared to other Artifex Mundi games it falls a little short, and it lacks replay ability.  

Other Artifex Mundi games have the ability to skip hidden-object areas for bonus games, such as dominos, or matching memory games.  Clockwork Tales does not have this option, and for people (like me) who enjoy completing the game in every way possible, you lose a reason to replay the game.  It is very easy to play though the game and get all the achievements in one sitting, which while good for some players, isn’t as good for others.

Clockwork Tales is definitely worth playing if you enjoy these types of games, and especially if you enjoy Artifex Mundi games, as they are always very well polished, and highly enjoyable.  Just do not expect the game to last more than a few hours, even if grinding the achievements.  Take Clockwork Tales for what it is, as there is a very enjoyable experience to be had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053757623', 'num_games_owned': 3175, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1409446197}
review: Красивая и качественная HOG-игра. Рекомендовать вполне можно. Для кого-то наверное минус, но но она довольно легкая. Есть пара сложных головоломок, которые я прошел с подсказками, но в основном особо мозг не грузит.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969256634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1410812195}
review:
Part hidden object, part adventure, Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a fun adventure game with some interesting puzzles to challenge you.  The game edges on the short side and as a result, the story is over before it gets a chance to develop.

Play this as a casual adventure game to pass the time. If you really like adventure games and don't want to miss out on any of them, then Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is one of the better games amongst the myriad of choices that have sprung up over the past year or so.

A must play if you're looking for a quick fix for your adventure game addiction, or casual gamers alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078465337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1410553525}
review:
It's quite a nice game, but not that full of action as the description makes you believe. There are no fights, flying or whatever. Okay, you can watch those things in the cutscenes, but not really do them yourself. This is, why I'm a bit upset. I guess, the description is highly exaggerated! 

Nevertheless it's a good game. It's a kind of point and click adventure, but with much more puzzles than usual point and click games have, and there are also many, many hidden object scenes.
Usually I hate that hidden object stuff, but playing this game was really fun! :)

I also like the places and animations in this game. Mathew the crow is really beautiful, I love this one! 
You can really see that those people who made this game spent a lot of time and joy on creating this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025254064', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1638835115}
review:
As far as Artifex Mundi's Hidden Object Games go, this one is better than Abyss, but still not as good as Alex Hunter. It's almost as though the developer wanted to make their own "Clockwork Man" game, but gave you a robot bird helper instead of a man. At least it utilizes its Steampunk theme way better than that series did. The bird has some useful talents that are actually required to retrieve certain objects, providing a neat twist on the genre. It feels like the actual Hidden Object scenes are getting fewer and farther between in these games, and have an art style not quite up to par with the rest of the game's beautiful scenery, but at least the puzzle-solving aspect is fairly involved, even though many of them are similar to puzzles in other HOGs. Although it's only in the bonus chapter, the sewer cap puzzle in this game is lifted *directly* from Abyss - it's literally the same puzzle and screens. I'm not sure whether to take that as a moment of homage, or as a sign that the developers are starting to rest on their laurels too much.

Oh, and there's a part that involves giving catnip to a cat. I guess that should count for something.
Rating: 3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197963164050', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1410032236}
review: It's a well made Puzzle game with hidden objects. The puzzles are rather fun and not too hard. Music, sound an graphic are quite good, the voice acting could be a little bit better in some cases. But all in all it is a very nice and enjoyable game and the price is fair enough that nobody have to think twice, if he wants to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116975671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1516781419}
review:
I love these Artifex Mundi games. They have great visuals, intruiging settings, and casual gameplay, and whatever they lack in challenge, they more than make up for in the pleasantness of the experience. It reminds me of reading a particularly satisfying book, and specifically/necessarily one that comes from the "Young Adults" section, as it is not exactly overflowing with complexity but is still highly enjoyable. 

This game gets high marks in most areas except story resolution. It seems like it abruptly ends, and I was irked and dissatisfied by the conclusion to a degree; Clockwork Tales, for the most part is vibrant, lush and well-executed, but has a very rushed and non-climactic ending. It is as if the timer for the project went off, and everything had to be turned in 'as is'. Still: [ 7 / 10 ]

author: {'steamid': '76561198145098101', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1408711259}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1408089745}
review:
アイテム探しアドベンチャーゲーム。地震発生装置を使う悪者をやっつけにいく話。
例によってこのディベロッパーのゲームは難易度は低い。今までのシリーズとの違いは、機械仕掛けの鳥を使って遠くのアイテムを取れたりすることだけ。全実績解除するのに1周だけでなのはいいが、パズルの内容が今までの同ディベロッパーのゲームと結構被っていたりネタ切れ感がある。序盤の雰囲気がいいのだが後半になるにつれ盛り上がりに掛け、ラストシーンは端折られ感がある。ゲーム単体とすれば悪くはないがマンネリぎみである。

author: {'steamid': '76561198086170655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1407950403}
review:
Zabrzańskie studio Artifex Mundi jest dobrze znany wśród wielbicieli przygodówek- tym razem twórcy zaprezentowali nam bardzo przyjemną grę Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink, opowiadającą o przygodach agentki Evangeliny Glass. Gra jest casualową przygodówką z silnym akcentem na ukryte obiekty i puzzle, spodoba się nawet graczom stroniącym od przygodówek jak od ognia (w tym autor niniejszej recenzji )- Artifex mundi wielokrotnie udowodniło że potrafi robić gry bardzo estetycznie wykonane, dysponując bardzo małym budżetem potrafi wykonać gry dające mnóstwo frajdy.

Jak już wspomniałem, w grze kierujemy krokami agentki wywiadu Glass, która przybywa do miasta w odpowiedzi na niepokojący list wysłany przez doktora Ambrose Ink'a, dotyczący dziwnych trzęsień ziemi i powiązanego z nimi Gerharda Barbera. Kierując kroki przez kilkadziesiąt statycznych plansz rozwiązujemy zagadki, szukamy przedmiotów, jednak- co warto dodać- tym co wyróżnia tą grę  (oraz inne od Artifex Mundi) wśród innych przygodówek (także tych z ogromnym budżetem ) jest to, że zagadki są skonstruowane bardzo logicznie, nie zbieramy setek przedmiotów, aby przez kolejne godziny szukać piksela na setnej planszy, na którym użyjemy np. sera (vide Sam & Max Sezon 1z 2006)- to rozwiązanie powinno bardzo przypaść do gustu graczom, którzy nie znoszą przygodówek, a jednak chcieli by im dać szansę. Wracając do historii- akcja dzieje się w mieście Hochwald, przywodzącym na myśl wioskę w Bawarii, sama postać Barbera przypomina moim zdaniem „miks” standardowo przedstawianego w filmach oficera SS z Cesarzem Willhelmem II, warto też dodać, iż całość jest utrzymana w klimatach Steampunk'owych i przypomina trochę okres tuż przed I Wojną Światową- zeppeliny, produkty rewolucji przemysłowej, nowe wynalazki itd. Fabuła jest bardzo ciekawa i naprawdę wciąga.

Kwintesencją gry są jednak zagadki i puzzle- i za to gromkie brawa dla twórców: łowienie ukrytych obiektów jest bardzo wciągające, warto wytężać wzrok bez podpowiedzi (oczywiście że są!), bowiem w grze jest do zdobycia garść osiągnięć STEAM, które można bardzo łatwo zdobyć w całosci- trzeba tylko uzbroić się w cierpliwość. Oprócz standardowych ukrytych obiektów, mamy całą gamę zagadek logicznych, oraz układanek. Brzmi to strasznie siermiężnie, ale uwierzcie- wykonanie i estetyka tychże zagadek jest na naprawdę wysokim poziomie!

Tym co w grze spodobało mi się, oprócz bardzo ciekawej historii i logicznie prowadzonego wątku fabularnego jest oczywiście grafika- autorzy postawili na bardzo starannie wykonane statyczne plansze, ręcznie malowane, bardzo oszczędnie wykorzystując animacje (są to raczej poklatkowe rysunki). Każda lokacja jest wykonana z pieczołowitością i polotem- naprawdę wszędzie mamy do czynienia w ten czy inny sposób ze steampunk'iem- w grze kapie wręcz od hmm... nazwałbym to od rewolucji przemysłowej, wszędzie pojawiają się koła zębate, maszyny latające, a nawet konstrukty. Pod względem graficznym mogę się przyczepić tylko do jednego- postaci nie zawsze są udane, w szczególności dziewczynka, której musimy naprawić lalkę została wykonana nie najlepiej- ale to jest czepialstwo z mojej strony być może.
W grze przygrywa również bardzo miła dla ucha muzyczka- powiedziałbym że jest bardzo relaksująca, nie- nie usypiająca, ale relaksująca w przyjemny sposób. O odgłosach otoczenia, przedmiotów i postaci nie można powiedzieć nic złego- tyłka „nie urywają”, są po prostu starannie zrobione.

Uważam że warto zainteresować się tą przygodówką studia Artifex Mundi, oprócz wyżej wymienionych cech gra ma jedną olbrzymią zaletę: gra nie „wywyższa” się, twórcy po prostu zrobili bardzo dobry produkt, który broni się sam, nie potrzebując grafiki robionej na stacjach roboczych, olbrzymich nakładów marketingowych i całej „propagandy” . Czułem wręcz że to gra zrobiona przez graczy dla graczy, po to żeby dobrze się bawić, a nie zdzierać olbrzymie kwoty od graczy.

Clockwork Tales to gra, która spodoba się większości graczy- Osoby które grają okazyjnie, zapiekli Skyrimowcy, czy „World of Tankerzy” również wieczorami odnajdą w tej grze mnóstwo przyjemnej i relaksującej „nieinwazyjnej” rozgrywki. Miłośnicy przygodówek znajdą w tej grze wytchnienie od przytłaczających czasami abstrakcyjnych zagadek, tak jak wspomniałem gra jest casualem na kilka godzin, gra nie przytłacza gracza ogromem, skomplikowaniem. 
Tym razem nie podaję oceny, myślę że każdy powinien grę ocenić sam (choćby grając w demo), niemniej warto mieć w swojej kolekcji przynajmniej jeden  produkt od rodzimych producentów z Zabrza i sprawdzić na własnej skórze czy to jest to „co tygrysy lubią najbardziej” :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107317047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1407690213}
review:
Jogo fantástico!

Com belos gráficos o jogo lhe vicia a ponto de não descansar em paz até que resolva todo o mistério... amantes de aventura deveriam experimentar esse jogo! Gráficos ótimos! História intrigante!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018177297', 'num_games_owned': 2753, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1407629980}
review:
I actually pretty like this one.

I don't believe that I've ever beaten a hidden object before, but this was pretty fun.

The art's pretty great, but the animation can be a tiny bit...unsettling.

It's short. I beat it in 2 hours, but I enjoyed it through.

Play it if you like this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060686749', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1407532257}
review:
Good: Very fun, nice story, beautiful backgrounds, puzzles can be easy, good music.
Bad: Very short, animation could use more sophistication, some puzzles are only skipable, no hints.


Although it's short, I very much enjoyed it - playing on easy setting it was just right after a long day of work, relaxing and using my brain just a little bit :-)

I'm not sure if it really is worth the current price of 6,50 Euro, to be honest. Steam says I played for 3.7 hours - and that includes the bonus chapter.

The ending could use a bit more explaining, IMO.
